reviews.text: As much as I like the Cheesecake Factory, I i really don&#39;t like this one. The food quality and service here is 1star quality. I ordered their shepherds pie and the  meat in it was very greasy. I decided to give it a second chance on 1/1/20 and and they served me below room temperature orange chicken with not so fresh vegetables. To make it worse before I even ordered my meal I requested to my waitress clean utensils but she didn&#39;t even help me with that.
I tried the dulce de leche cheesecake today for the first time.  The clerk said it is one of her favorites, and it&#39;s now one of my favorites.  Highly recommend.

My friend took me here as a bday treat for brunch. First off, I never even knew that they served breakfast and brunch here. I&#39;ve been here many times for dinner. It was my first time for brunch and I must say it was quite delicious. I have never ever had anything bad here. My salmon dish was cooked perfectly and loved the flavor. I especially enjoyed our slice of strawberry cheesecake that we got to go. I absolutely love their cheesecake selections. I will be back soon.

They served wrong orders. They even served an ice-cold dish. Sent it back and got it back; not warm AT ALL.. the only warm thing was the plate. Gave a complimentary salad though..<br><br>-Did not at all live up to the promise that was on the top of the menu. They did NOT give me the best service. They did NOT give me the best service. And they did not live up to my satisfaction.<br><br> Some dishes were good, but I&#39;m just mostly mad about the wrong orders and ice-cold dish.

I love Cheesecake Factory, so this 1 star review is solely for this location. I have now eaten here 3 times (or rather, I tried to eat here 3 times. More on that later). The first two had inattentive and slow service (didn&#39;t get refills for 5-10 minutes at a time). I&#39;d probably rate at 2-3 stars if that was my only experience. <br><br>However, today I tried to stop by for dinner. After waiting for a table, I was finally seated. From here, I sat at my table for 20-25 minutes without a single person coming by to grab drinks/food or let me know that they will be with me shortly. I even flagged a couple people down to see if my server was coming and pretty much just got a &#34;too bad, so sad&#34; response. <br><br>After 20-25 minutes I just got up and left. No one seemed to care, so that will likely be my last visit here. Absolute shambles of a waitstaff.
The cheesecake is always on point here, but the food and service were deeply unsatisfying.

What a disappointment!. Cheesecake factory is one of those places i go when i want something a little but fancy but i still wanna wear jeans. The food is good quality but it is definitely high priced for a franchise. It&#39;s not really fine dining but it&#39;s a couple of notches over a red robbin. <br><br>At least until today...<br><br>They didn&#39;t bring me a steak knife until i asked for one..... same with the steak sauce which i really needed because the steak was charcoal on the outside. <br><br>My sister&#39;s hamburger was ok, but her fries arrived only when she was halfway done eating. We were talking a lot so not even eating fast.. at least 10 mins late. <br>The waiter told us they were out of bread so they were baking it. It came out really late, but that&#39;s not the worst of all. <br><br>They swiped my husband&#39;s credit card against someone else&#39;s check... that&#39;s not a big deal but on top of everything else it makes for a really bad experience. We travel a Lot.. and have been to other CF in denver even. This was by far the worst experience and, the only bad one we ever had at a CF. <br><br>Like i said, this place is a little bit fancier than average, i was not expecting french wine or five star service, but i was definitely not expecting 4 major problems on one dinner.

Completely terrible food! I got the shrimp scampi and the shrimp Alfredo and literally the shrimp was microwaved shrimp! The sauce was dry as hell and the pasta was so soggy. Please check my pictures I zoomed in on the shrimp to show you! <br><br>But the cheese cake wasn&#39;t bad.
The food was on point. But the service was amazing the waitress I had, was one of the best waitresses I have ever had. Just for service alone I highly recommend it.

Eric is the best waiter I have EVER had, he made small talk with us while making us feel welcomed! He is so nice, humble, genuine, helpful with picking things off the menu. Quick and was constantly making sure we were okay a reasonable amount of times! The food was amazing! Tonight was wonderful , thank you to Denver and most importantly our amazing waiter Eric for making this experience well because without him it woudnt have been as amazing!

Went here on a Friday night while visiting Denver for the broncos Kansas City game and our server was amazing but we ordered a appetizer and he came  back 10 minutes later saying they were out of it - so we ordered another appetizer and 10 to 15 minutes later the manager told us they were out of that appetizer as well -after many apologies the manager brought us a appetizer and didn&#39;t charge us -  the meals we all ate were freaking amazing , the cocktails were super delicious and even thou we were full we had to indulge in a piece of cheesecake which was freaking. Amazing ! Great food - great service - delicious adult beverages and I highly recommend this place -

The celebration cheesecake was amazing. This one and the red velvet have been my favorite that i have tried so far. There was a s&#39;mores one I wanted to try that looked delicious so I&#39;ll try that next time I go for sure!

Another restaurant along 16th street. We called ahead and made a reservation for 15. Was surprised how empty the restaurant had been and they seated us in the back. Most every time there is a wait for Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>The food is consistent like all the rest.

Haven&#39;t been here in a while so figured we should try it out again....now I remember why. <br><br>We had a good server, but food was mediocre for the price. The cook served a raw hamburger when asked for well done and the managers half ass apology didn&#39;t help. They comped the burger and offered a slice of cake ‍ .......but then took an extra 15 min to have them give it to us.  Won&#39;t be coming here again, but appreciate waiters apology and attempt to check in with us.
Thumbs up! Always been a good choice to grab lunch down there! The servers are amazing! Of course, their cheesecakes are amazing! Love this place!

While staying in downtown Denver, my bf and I started strolling the 16th st mall in search of food. We saw Cheesecake Factory, and since we knew it to be good food, we decided to stop and eat. This was a Friday night, and there was a short wait. We waited about 10 mind for a table, and then it got worse lol. <br><br>Our server was really nice, had a very genuine tone when she spoke, Melissa, I believe, but service was a bit slow. I used to wait tables, I totally get it. But it took a good 5-6 mind before our table was even greeted to get waters or whatever. Then we order drinks and appetizer. <br><br>Drinks come out, tasted fine although I didn&#39;t like mine. No worries, bf will not waste alcohol, so there&#39;s that. Lol. I sipped my remaining water the rest of the night. I&#39;m fine with water, but it would have been nice to get a refill. I ended up drinking my boyfriend&#39;s water too. No one came to take dirty plates/glasses off of our table. And the table is really tiny, fyi. <br><br>It has always annoyed me when your appetizer is either still hot on the table or come out the same time as your food. Our app, which was the Tex-Mex egg rolls and super delish, came out, followed 45 seconds later with our entrees. Dammitttt!! Lol<br><br>My food, the truffle chicken, was good, just a bit too sweet. It felt very greasy, but the mashed potatoes were great! My bf&#39;s salmon was just right too. <br><br>So we tried to eat everything we could. We ended up taking most of the app, and half of my food to go. <br><br>We waited a while to get boxes, then check, it was frustrating. It was a pretty steep bill for the kind of attention we received, but either way, she was nice so that helped. We would not eat here again, though.

I can&#39;t think of a better way to celebrate a 30-something birthday than a trip to REI, followed by a slice of Cheesecake Factory. That&#39;s right, folks, this is what happens when you&#39;re one step closer to 40. <br><br>This was my first visit to the Denver location, but I&#39;ve had many a Cheesecake Factory experiences before: Palm Springs, Boulder, LA, St. Louis, SF Bay Area, Waikiki... They&#39;re all pretty much the same. Large portions, rich food, and A-OK drinks to boot.<br><br>My personal favorite cheesecake is the raspberry white chocolate truffle. But I also enjoy the lemon raspberry cream, Reece&#39;s, or tiramisu. Who am I kidding? Cheesecake is one of my favorite foods -- you could put any slice in front of me and I&#39;d go to town on it.<br><br>I&#39;ve never had to wait for a booth/table because eating at the bar is where it&#39;s at. Chat it up with the bartenders and watch them sling ridiculously large, sugary drinks to go along with the big ass entrees.<br><br>Recommendation: Raspberry white chocolate truffle cheesecake + split bottle of sparkling wine. Happy birthday to me!

I cannot get over the amazing service I had here. I had ordered my dish without tomatoes and it came with tomatoes. I told my server, Chris, not to worry about it and I picked them out. I had not one, but two mangers come by to apologize after he apologized several times. Very good service recovery. They offered to make it again but I opted not to. They made it right by comping my dessert and I didn&#39;t even ask for that. I hope everyone has a good an experience here as I did.

The wait was over a hour, then got slow service, wrong orders, and cold food. They promised on the menus complete satisfaction and I&#39;m unhappy with my dinner. We had to send back an order two times because it was frozen! The second time they just put the cold food on a hot plate. To make up for it they gave a Cesar salad. Everyone at the table was done eating and the messed up order finally arrived. Also, there are many empty tables and a lot of people waiting.

Always and will be my favorite chain restaurant. I have not had a bad experience yet. Our wait time was 20 minutes and we were seated slightly earlier. I&#39;ve learned over time to just order my favorite appetizers and pass on the entrees. Usually I would always be too full with appetizers and take my entrees home. My favorites are their Ahi Tartare, Avocado egg rolls, and fried calamaris. I definitely recommend. I had to get some drinks to celebrate my birthday. I was slightly bummed that they didn&#39;t have white sangria, but the waiter recommended a different drink and it was pretty good. Also I always try to do dessert because, hello, it is called Cheesecake Factory. Anyways my friend and I ordered the white chocolate caramel macadamia nut cheesecake and the salted caramel cheesecake. To my surprise I was not that impressed with the macadamia cheesecake. In my opinion the moistness of the cake takes away the crunch that I love about macadamia nuts. The salted caramel needed to be a little bit more salty. Moving on to service, it was just good, we caught her right before her break. And had another server and her again before we left. I have always wondered why it&#39;s always so loud in every Cheesecake Factory I have been to. Practically have to shout. Not recommended for a first date or an intimate one, and definitely not for proposals.

I&#39;ve eaten at the cheesecake factory on the 16th St. mall many times in one of the managers Doug goes out of his way to make sure my food is hot my order is what I ordered and that he has a very good attitude! And he&#39;s on the floor he makes sure that everybody&#39;s happy! I wish I was more people like Doug that cares about his customers!

I love Cheesecake Factory we live 5 1/2 hours from one so it is quite the treat to go to one. Thant being said we walked in looking confused and was immediately greeted a turned the right way to the check in desk. We were seated before we turned around. Then we sat.... and sat being unnoticed for almost 20 mins.  I finally asked the waitress next to our table if she was our waitress. She said no but came over to help and take our order.  She was nice once I made ourselves known. She was not our waitress and our waiter was on break to bad hostess did not know.  After that we had great service and the manager treated us to desserts.  Still started at 3 stars then we went up to 4

When you go to the cheesecake factory you expect a certain level of service and consistency. The bread was cold and stale when the server finally brought it after being reminded after saying he would. We had to ask for water and beer. Hands down the worst cheesecake factory I have been to and only the second time I have had bad service in many visits and locations.

Price:<br>It&#39;s on the higher end of cheap. Not a place an average working American can go to all the time. We had a burger, pasta, lemonade and mojito and spend $50<br><br>Drinks:<br>Raspberry lemonade was sweet and well worth it. My mojito has fresh mint and liquor was not weak nor too strong.<br><br>Location:<br>Located on 16th street mall. Very convenient.<br><br>Atmosphere:<br>Calming. If you have vision problems with dim lights, this place isn&#39;t fro you. Very dim. If your are a person battling depression, this place isn&#39;t for you. They place sad songs and its dim. Quite melancholy atmosphere.<br><br>Food quality:<br>Food is ALWAYS amazing. They put pride in every dish.<br><br>Customer service: <br>George (a female) was very nice and respectful and cheerful. <br><br>Final thoughts:<br>I love the Cheesecake Factory

We got Door Dash from here on January 18th or 19th, I forget. But any who, I must say I was skeptical at first, but boy they showed me wrong. We got two orders of the Club Sandwiches and fries! They were excellent, I gave 4 stars because the fries were a little salty for my liking, but all the ingredients of the sandwiches were top notch gourmet! The lettuce and tomatoes were superb as was the bacon, turkey and bread they used. They also cut the sandwiches into little triangles, just how I love them, plus the bread was toasted. The delivery was very fast from our Dasher. I can&#39;t wait to try the hamburgers and other items. Thank you Cheesecake Factory workers, keep up the fantastic job!! Hats off to the chef as well!! (:

Great Servers - Pricey Food<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is Americana on steroids. You&#39;ll find all of the national favorites, from burgers to fried catfish. And the portions are quite hefty. The servers are really wonderful as well. That&#39;s the good news. The bad news is the price. Your wallet and/or purse will not be happy with you after eating here. You can spend upwards of $80 for two people on a meal that really isn&#39;t worth that amount.

Ok first of my husband had just gotten off work we meet up downtown after we get off . We decided to do last minute dinner stop. His tummy was hurting so he had to utilize the mens room. I had just had a c.section as we just had a daughter aug13.2019. I get rudely interrupted while trying to place my pad on( sorry for the t.m.i) but I get yelled at saying I need to leave as I am doing drugs n the bathroom. My husband might&#39;ve taken more then five mins. But he works construction and hadn&#39;t had the proper opportunity to use the mens room until now.   I come out as fast as possible to be told I need to leave by Jeff the manager. I assure u we look nothing like drug addicts even though my husband is still in his work outfit there&#39;s still  a horrible discrimination that just happened a d I am so appalled

Yikes what a terrible experience my husband and I had ordering from here... GrubHub took 3 hours (I wish that were an exaggeration) and when it arrived both of our entrees were cold and basically awful.<br>The chicken was rubbery and we each selected asparagus as a side and they gave us 3 wimpy little stalks a piece.<br>And the cheesecake we ordered for dessert had gotten hot and the layers where separating and sliding apart.<br>Overall it just wasn&#39;t good. Quite terrible, actually :(

We have always enjoyed our meals at this Cheese Cake Factory when we were in town. This visit was very disappointing. Our mashed potatoes were cold, not as in they cooled off waiting to be served, cold as is barely cooked. We told our server and she brought a new serving. I had meatloaf, used to be a favorite, this was terrible. I&#39;ve had frozen dinners that were better. In addition, there were shards of some paper product on the meatloaf. They portions were probably stacked to be frozen separated by some paper which was not entirely removed before heating. Disappointing. I showed our server the paper (several pretty big pieces). She said &#39;well that isn&#39;t right&#39;. That&#39;s it. <br><br>This particular location of Cheese Cake Factory has definitely declined since the last time we visited. I&#39;m not rating all CCF locations, just this one.

Sat for 25 minutes patiently, then when I got up to go to the bar the server came along.<br><br>Rude.<br>Worst is the manager literally saw I was waiting for a while and didn&#39;t acknowledge it or bring anyone to help.<br><br>K thanks bye

Let me start by saying I love cheesecake. My favorite is the Red Velvet. It definitely hit the spot. I don&#39;t think they take reservations and they told us it would about an hour and a half wait, we went on a busy night (during The Parade of Lights) I recommend trying to get a table at the bar. People literally hover over the area for the tables. We got lucky and this couple told us they were leaving and handed the table over to us. I was very impressed with our server because he was so busy  but was able to keep up. I ordered a Dirty Martini and my olive had a pit in it. Which was weird because  it was stuffed with a pimento. The drink was marginal. The menu has so many options. Italian , Asian, American, and Mexican. It&#39;s ridiculous. We ordered Calamari and the mayo sauce did not seem<br>to be mixed well. We ordered Chicken Madeira the most popular dish and the plating was sloppy and the flavor was lacking. After reviewing the menu over and over I sadly ordered the Chicken Enchiladas. The chicken was fatty and dry. I was not impressed.The best part was the cheesecake. I was disappointed in the food. I was impressed with our  server and it felt like everyone worked as a team.

Everything you&#39;d expect from the Cheesecake Factory.  Our server at this location was great (unfortunately, can&#39;t remember his name), checked in on us and had great humor.<br><br>Food was delicious as usual and should be, as was the cheesecake (drooling thinking about it)

Worst experience ever in a Cheesecake Factory.  Management was horrible.   Went two nights in a row giving them a second chance was a bad decision.   One order was forgotten night two, first night out drinks we&#39;re cleared and never replaced before we even got our order.  Manager was a jerk and sarcastic.  Food that was delivered was ok, but the service and management was the worst!!!!

This location was huge. Super clean and pretty inside intimate lighting. We sat outside. Our server Lindsay was awesome. Super nice, great service on her part. Food was good per usual. We ordered crab bites, chicken taquitos, raspberry lemonade, avocado rolls, and could not finish it all. They stay open late during the week which is helpful as Denver shuts down at 10pm everywhere!

Very disappointed at the food. CheeseCake Factory is one of my favorite restaurants. I have been in the one in Seattle and food is really good, however the one here in Denver is not as good. On top of this, we sat outside enjoying the beautiful sun, around 6 pm street construction began making it imposible to even have a conversation due to the noise as well of all the dust blowing at your face, food and drinks. We had to asked to be moved inside to the restaurant. Very bad experience. Don&#39;t sit outside if you see there is construction going on.

I understand restaurants are having issues because of COVID. However waiting over 45 minutes to pick up 3 slices of cheesecake that were ordered online is completely unacceptable in my opinion. Will not return.

Disappointing experience. Lesson learned: Don&#39;t stop by on a weekend night for a slice of cheesecake. <br><br>Took 15 minutes for someone to grab a slice. The team at the takeout counter was unorganized and very rude. Management should really look at their staffing levels and employee standards.

Terrible service this Friday night. Waited 2 hours for a table and over an hour for our food. Watched as other people around us who arrived much later, receive their food first. Decided to just leave at that point and take our food to go once it FINALLY arrived. Not sure who is at fault but our waiter was overall fine. Will not be coming back.
The food and service was great but the greeting staff was very rude.  It was as if they didn&#39;t want us to eat there

Alrighty than here goes. My son had decided to go here for his birthday dinner with us. So we told him let&#39;s go.<br>Located at the end of the west side of the Tabor Center there is a parking garage convienently located close to this location and yes if you bring your paystub in they will validate. <br>We started off with a couple of apps which included  cheese sticks, which were more like cheese triangles topped with parmesan cheese and marinara and were delicious. We followed it up with or also had Nashville chicken nuggets that were drizzled with a hot sauce that was on the brink of too hot but you had the accompaniment of a compote dish if you wanted more also with some ranch tp cool your mouth off if you added a lit6too much hot sauce. I enjoyed but my Wife and son said too much heat for them.<br>Next came our entrees.<br>My wife opted for spaghetti and meatballs but replaced the spaghetti with rigatoni , and the meatballs were just slightly bigger than golfball size and my wife enjoyed it so much she had to take 1/2 of it home because the portion was so generous. <br>My son opted for the Shrimp platter that came with 8 nice size shrimp and fries.<br>I went all in and hat the Ribeye which was tender and delicious. It came with a lg side of mashed potatoes and green beans.<br>We finished it off with a celebration sundae for my son that is complimentary and I went for the Banana cream cheesecake that had Bavarian cream inside it accompanied by slices of bananas and whipped cream.<br>Let me tell you , this was cheesecake,  I would definitely recommend giving this lace a shot even if you just go in for some dessert .

Always a favorite. Great atmosphere and the food is always delicious. The service is always friendly and prompt. I&#39;m a big cheesecake fan so I always get a cheesecake to go. I&#39;ve never had anything less than a great steak there. I can say enough good things about all my experiences there.

Unfortunately we listened to the nice cashiers recommendations on the slices we got of cheesecake. They weren&#39;t very good. Should&#39;ve stuck with our favorites. <br><br>The restaurant was clean, busy, everyone was nice. The cheesecake was the only bummer. <br><br>The salted caramel had a weird flavor to it. The lemon raspberry had cake or something in it which got soggy before we walked back to our hotel so that was a bummer.
Amazing service!! Better than expected food! The thoughtful waitress decorated my cheesecake plate with &#34;happy birthday&#34;.

Typically a huge fan of this restaurant chain, and often make it a point to visit one about once or twice a month. However, I&#39;m upset to say my last experience tonight was anything but up to expectations. The server barely addressed us throughout the first 40 minutes of sitting down, never checked to see how our food was, and would answer us with one word answers and begin walking away as we were still asking questions. To make matters worse, she never once refilled our waters during our hour and a half sitting down, and was much more attentive to the table right next to us.<br><br>When our food came out, the omelette had been made with feta and cheddar cheese when we had asked for only feta. When we pointed this out to our server, she proceeded to argue that there was still feta cheese on it, rather than acknowledging it was made incorrectly. The one shining light of the evening was our interaction with the manager. He listened attentively to our concerns, and did offer us some cheesecake for the trouble. Would love to come back to this location when I can ensure my service will be better.

Showed up on Easter. We arrived early so not too busy but we still ended up waiting twenty minutes for a table. Our server was not good. We had to hunt her down for everything. It was disappointing that all the tables around us seated later had their food well before us. Server couldn&#39;t answer our questions about the menu. We worked through it and my food was fine but my husbands was horrible. His jambalaya pasta was definitely off. He has order before and knew something was wrong but we couldn&#39;t get our server back over to address. Ultimately, he walked to the bar bakery area and ordered my cheesecake to go and grabbed to go containers for my leftovers.

Terrible service!  We had to wait 25 minutes for someone to come to our table just to get our drinks.   After they finally gave them to us it took another 30 to get someone to take our order.   The food was eh.   All in all we were there 2 hours.   I would&#39;ve understood the times if it was full, but there were only a few people in there.  I won&#39;t be in any hurry to go there again. Pretty disappointing when you&#39;ve been on the road 10 hours.

We waited 10 minutes for a seat which was great since we didn&#39;t have reservations and we were seated outside really fast, the problem was once we were seated nobody came to take our order. We sat for a little over 20 min before we went inside and asked<br>If someone could serve us, we were told someone would be right out and still nobody showed up, at one point it looked like the manager was coming to talk to us but he  stopped and talked to a server, pointed at us and then left. We ended up leaving and going next door to blue agave where we got fantastic service

It was Christmas and the place was packed, however, we received excellent service. We were even cracking jokes with our server. My hat&#39;s off to The Cheesecake Factory for their consistently good service and food!

Ordered a tiramisu cheesecake, got a tiramisu cake that looked like it was cut by a 5 year old who tripped and picked it up off the floor before they served it lol. Quality is scary bad! Stay away!!!!!! Sad, coz I usually love Cheesecake Factory. Save your time and money and look at their rating. Saddest thing is the cheesecake  factory can&#39;t tell the difference between cake
Came here in the summer with my Dad who was visiting from the UK. The food was fantastic and super rich. The customer service was good too.

We live almost across the street and we&#39;ve ordered take-out several times recently.  HORRIBLE service every time.  Orders (for salads) are promised to be ready in 45 minutes, yet it takes and extra 15-20 minutes every time.  Today was the last straw - ordered 4 pieces of cheesecake - was promised it would be ready in 30 minutes, but had to wait 45...for cheesecake...which is already sliced and ready to go.  It wasn&#39;t even that busy.  Sorry, we are done.  Gave you the benefit of the doubt at first, but you haven&#39;t figured out this to-go thing at all.  Other restaurants adapt - this location is stuck in business as usual.  Food is always very good, but the service stinks.
Extremely disappointed with the food l, which for me ,was the California Cheese Steak sandwich.<br><br>Our wait person was efficient, friendly and all around excellent

If you haven&#39;t eaten here, you must! They have the biggest menu with the calories listed next to each item and a skinny menu for the ultra health conscious, trust me you will find a dish for everyone here. Don&#39;t forget to order a slice of cheesecake they have so many choices and all are delicious, never been disappointed!

Should be called the factory where your dreams of delicious cheesecake go to die. Picked up some cheesecake and small plates to go. They got our order wrong, and the presentation was really bad. It looked like they took the to go boxes and vigorously shook them. Chocolate sauce was everywhere. The food itself was also really bad. Save y

Much a nice restaurant we sat on the patio and the evening was perfect. Had the shrimp scampi (could of been better not the best), my husband had the Cajun pasta (delicious), and my daughter had a slice of original cheesecake (perfect). Our server was very attentive. Awesome location.

I took my aunt who was visiting from out of state here. The server was very attentive and the atmosphere generally pleasant but it took soooo long to get our food. And when it did come out, it came out slowly. Some people had their food while others had to wait another 15 minutes.<br>Parking is another issue. I hate parking downtown but chose this restaurant because they said they had validated parking. I got the sticker from the hostess before leaving but still had to pay $5 to park. Overall, not worth it. The cheesecake was the best part but not worth waiting, eating mediocre food and then paying for what should&#39;ve been free parking.

This was not the experience that this chain restaurant generally delivers. Unfortunately, far from it. At first, I was seated and waited a good 10 minutes before I asked a busser if he knew who my server was. Finally, a server, not mine, appears and takes my order. A bit later, my meal was brought out and that was the end of it. No one offered to take my drink order and no one came back to check on me until I was done eating. I ordered a piece of cheesecake and coffee and after a 10-minute wait my coffee arrived. No cheesecake. I was told it&#39;d be right out but it took another 10 minutes and by then, my coffee was cold. I asked for a fresh cup and in the meantime, almost broke my fork on the  frozen solid low carb cheesecake I was brought, literally frozen solid. Good thing that the coffee warm up took another 10 minutes and gave the cheesecake a chance to thaw, albeit, just a little bit. I waited patiently for it to thaw further while my bill was placed on my table. A terrible experience.

This is honestly a terrible place to go. I went here for my 6 Month Anniversary we ordered two steaks some of the most expensive items on the menu along with an appetizer. Everything was fine until our steaks took 35 minutes the server seemed to be checking on us a lot. Once the food hit the table from another server ours seemed to vanish. No one asked us how the food was, no one checked up on us and no one even tried to bring us the bill. I could have easily walked out since it was if we where invisible. I asked another server to find mine and she seemed insistent on not finding my server and helping me which is not what I wanted. I went to the host stand to see if for some reason my server was sent home and as I walk up I see my server? It was so awkward and uncomfortable I walked back to my table and asked someone for the bill I still tipped 15% on the check because I was trying to have a good day. Management here does it exist ? The servers name is Jana K.

This is hands-down the worst cheesecake factory I have been to. I live close, so I wanted to give them 3 chances, but they consistently cook the meal incorrectly, get your order wrong, or flat out double charge you. I went here after a few drinks, and didnt realize they charged me for two steak dinners. It is never just a simple transaction there, there is always something wrong and the waitresses are super awkward when you tell them. I will never be going back.

Attended a private seminar with my sister and were very pleasantly surprised with the food since I had never been to the Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Started off with a very tasty salad and then I ordered the salmon entree and my sister the steak medallions entree. Everything was cooked to perfection and very tasty.<br><br>The wait staff was very friendly, professional, attentive and efficient.<br><br>We had a great dinner and since we couldn&#39;t eat another bite, took our cheesecake and chocolate cake home (huge portions and so yummy!!).<br><br>Will definitely be going back again! They also have validated parking if you park at the Tabor Center Lot.

Well, in years past, absolutely great.  Now, not so much.  Wait time... excessive.  Rather shabby and old, in need of a refresh.  Corporate, if you&#39;re reading this, you&#39;ve got your money&#39;s worth.  Time to re-invest.<br><br>I like my pasta al dente.  Not raw!<br><br>Come desert time, literally an hour&#39;s wait for a few slices of cheesecake with a 7 year-old and a 4 year-old melting down because service was so slow.<br><br>Doug, the manager attempted to do a last-minute save when the waitress went to battle for us.  Great waitress.  Doug picked up the tab for desert.  Nonetheless.... 7 people with small children and two hours to make it through dinner plus wait time.<br><br>Not fun on our special birthday occasion!

I&#39;ve eaten at cheesecake many times over the years with no complaints and today was a terrible experience. The food was cold, undercooked and tasted terrible. I was truly baffled that I hardly touched anything on my plates and the server didn&#39;t ask if everything was okay and I felt uncomfortable sending it back as my friend ordered something completely different and her food was also cold and terrible. I haven&#39;t eaten at this location before, I will only go to the other locations from now on. Really disappointed in the entire experience.

Very disappointed in the service or LACK of service. Waited 20 minutes to be seated which is not bad to wait. But after we were seated, waited another 20 minutes before two other families we seated after us, the waitress went to that last family to get their drink order and still didn&#39;t get ours. They got their drinks and we still weren&#39;t acknowledged so we walked out. Not even an hello I&#39;ll be right with you. NOTHING ! ! !
This place hit  the spot. I didn&#39;t get my drink and food that quick but it was worth waiting. Maybe I&#39;m just spoiled.  I was just informed that the food came out at the proper amount of time.

Was here today staff were on point! Kind and not pushy&#34; a gentleman by name of Alex, was behind the bar that was really helpful and great energy  made our experience that much greater thanks cheesecake factory.
Cheesecake is always good. Our server was the best and always on it before we could ask him for anything. Loved the location right downtown Denver.

We stopped by after dinner for dessert and a drink. The place was packed but we found a spot at the bar after a few minutes. The bartender was amazing! He was so happy, friendly and helpful. The entire time he had a smile, was offering suggestions to any guest who couldn&#39;t make a final decision and genuinely seemed to care about his guest. Even talking to a couple about their visit and the about to become new parents for the first time. The service was fast and the 30th anniversary cheesecake was great! Highly recommend splitting, it was very rich but a great way to end our dinner! Will be back.

The portions have gotten so tiny and shrunk by at least by a third. The cheesecake is just a fraction of what it used to be for all 3 different slices we got, at almost $9 a slice. I am not going to be back.

Thanks Guys....<br>Now I can never eat here again. My SO says we will ONLY get cheese cake to go. <br>Our waitress disappeared allot, we had to steal napkins from another table. We had to put our butter on with our forks because we had no knifes.<br>Then my 17$ pasta was wrong it was HORRIBLE. I sat for 20min after my date ate his meal still waiting for mine to be fixed. They tried to make it right by removing my meal and thats why our waitress still received a 10$ tip.<br><br>We work hard for our money just like everyone else and when I get treated to a meal on the 16th street mall and it SUCKS.... its sad .<br>I will never be back.
This was my first time visiting and I loved it! Friendly staff amazing food! I ordered the parmesan  herb chicken and really enjoyed it! It is a must to order cheesecake!

Ordered pick up. App said it would be ready at 6:50pm. My husband got there at 6:47pm, good was already sitting there. He asked for bread, woman was totally rude and said there wasn&#39;t any. He got home with the food (we live across the street) and both our dishes were cold. His sauce wasn&#39;t secured in the container and spilled out everywhere. Totally disappointed!!!! Get your act together Cheesecake Factory!!

Situated right on 16th St - Great place for a quick bite. It&#39;s spacious &amp; very busy on a Sunday arvo but we were seated within 10 minutes. <br>The service was prompt &amp; efficient. <br>The menu is massive &amp; comprehensive. And if course the cheesecakes! There are so many to choose from. The serving size is pretty generous &amp; it&#39;s served with a giant dollop of cream.<br>The bread came first - The brown bread was delish! The white bread was a bit too hard.. The chicken  enchiladas was tasty. It was served with black beans &amp; rice. The Renee&#39;s lunch special was average. I had the turkey sandwich, salad &amp; chicken  soup. The soup tasted more like melted cheese with chunks of chicken.. The greens were fresh. Sandwich was ok..<br>The serving sizes are pretty big so make sure you leave room for dessert!

We placed an order through doordash last night for 2 lasagna Verdes and 2 slices of cheesecake. I am absolutely disgusted with what was sent to us and after sitting almost 20 minutes on the phone waiting for Connor, the manager to come address the problem, and calling back after no answer and sitting another almost 10 minutes, his snottiness finally got around to answering my call. <br><br>The problem?..... The lasagna was so loaded with oil that AFTER I drained it twice, it still pooled up in my dish AND I tried a couple of bites only to watch the grease ooze out as I cut into it. I stopped right there! My fiance ate part of his and wound up nauseous and is still paying for it today! <br><br>How does Alex, the kitchen manager run a kitchen and allow such nastiness to leave his kitchen??!! (I had to demand the name of the kitchen manager so we&#39;d all know who&#39;d let such a grease laden lasagna leave his kitchen, to make people sick with) <br><br>I thought this place was a 5 star restaurant according to the passengers I used to bring when I managed a limo service in fort Collins. I&#39;m disgusted and think that the $53 we spent for two servings of lasagna and cheesecake should&#39;ve been better than you can get at any craphole restaurant that serves it for $10!!. <br>I&#39;ve had better lasagna at a hole in wall diner, for far less, with MUCH friendlier service. Whoever kept picking the phone up and print me back on hold without so much as an apology for the wait (actually sounded irritated that I was even making her answer the phone....) Rude, snobby, and obviously nothing close to what 5 star service signifies, and even at 2 stars, I&#39;d expect my staff to provide better service than these 3 clowns did. I&#39;ll NEVER recommend another person to them and when I hear how wonderful they are, I&#39;ll be sure to dispute that. This was my first time ordering anything from them personally, and will be the last. <br><br>I&#39;ve left a message on the website and I&#39;m only sharing this because after reading someone elses review warning of food poisoning recently, I would think the owners would reconsider what&#39;s going on in their restaurant and hitting the streets. First off, Connor was an uppity little jerk on the phone who says &#34;I&#39;ll follow up and I agree that it shouldn&#39;t have been like that BUT, you have to talk to doordash for the refund because we don&#39;t refund for them but, if they give you a hard time I can reach out to them for you&#34;. Nothing else besides how flippant attitude. <br><br>REALLY??!! Since when should ANY other entity refund us for YOUR poor quality?! Regardless of policy, your manager could&#39;ve been sincere, could&#39;ve offered a personal follow up, could&#39;ve offered a replacement, could&#39;ve done 10x what he didn&#39;t do at all. Personally, with what I&#39;m seeing in your one star reviews and especially in the last few months..... There&#39;d be new managers and staff, with clear understanding of how you run a business and deliver customer service. <br><br>BTW, called doordash who said they&#39;d refund half but after raising a little hell and sending them the pictures I took, they agreed to a full refund and was more sincere in their apology for your crap food than your own manager, Connor!! Who, by the way, didn&#39;t bother to ask a name and for a phone number, nothing more than a snotty apology and a half interest in addressing the issue. Shame on you guys!! Maybe stick to cheesecake and let the real 5 star restaurants serve good food?! <br><br>In business you often times only get one chance to make your business shine. You can thank your staff for tarnishing that opportunity. <br><br>If Connor couldn&#39;t handle the criticism and the fact that he had an upset customer who spent good, honest money on damned expensive lasagna, later at night and found themselves smacking from home and skipping dinner altogether because I didn&#39;t want to eat at 11p.m. and go to bed right away..... Than maybe he&#39;d do better flipping burgers at McDonald&#39;s and letting a real manager take the heat. <br><br>You&#39;re damned lucky there wasn&#39;t a hospital bill involved, we&#39;d be having a much broader conversation. But, since doordash politely excused your disgusting food, refunded us in full, and no food poisoning happened, although we&#39;re pretty ticked off that last night&#39;s meal for my fiance that he could only stomach part of....is still bothering him today, we&#39;ll move on and find a far better restaurant to support. Way to mess it up, good job guys, good job. <br><br>As mentioned earlier.... These pictures are AFTER I transferred the food to my own dish and DRAINED grease from 3 times!! I forgot to mention why in transferred to my own dish. .... When I reached into the bag to pull the dish out, my hand was immediately covered with grease that had leaked out on the way to us!!!! Gross!!

Update 8/10/17:<br>We went here last Sunday afternoon around 3:30. They were out of some flatbread my BF wanted. Not a big deal. He ordered a margarita that was served in a wine-looking glass. If he had an ice fetish he would have been in cloud 9, but no such luck. The drink was completely FULL OF ICE. He had literally 4 (normal) SIPS and it was gone. <br>The service was absolutely horrible. I&#39;m not a serial complainer but damn.... and the place wasn&#39;t even busy! I get the Tuscan chicken when I go here- I finished my leftover breast today and there were about 8 spots of gristle in it that I had to spit out. Pretty disappointed with this visit, Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>__________________________<br>Tuscan chicken!! Do it. Very healthy and flavorful. <br>Service was good but my green beans weren&#39;t brought out until the end of my meal. Not a dealbreaker though, and we&#39;ll be back.

We actually had one of the worst dinners ever at a Cheesecake Factory!! My friend ordered white chicken chili there was no white to it looked more like jambalaya and thicker...I had shrimp scampi....fried shrimp... scampi??? Even the angelhair pasta was clumped together<br>I realize they were busy but there is no excuse for that poor a quality of food....Really the only good part was our waiter Gabe....probably should of left when we saw the table next to us complaining about their food !!!  Bad experience!!
The Vegan Cobb Salad was amazing. Our server was also attentive and nice.<br><br>There are homeless on the street from time to time that mightht bug you if you sit outside.

I love the Cheesecake Factory.  Have you ever been there before? Their oreo cheesecake is amazing and so is the strawberry.  The Cheesecake Factory is always crowded because of how good it is.  It has the best food that I can think of out of all the restaurants.<br> My favorite part about the Cheesecake Factory is obviously the cheesecake.  They have a huge selection of cheesecake including oreo, strawberry, regular, and more.  It also tastes amazing.  It is creamy and a perfect size for anyone.  You can get one slice or a whole cheesecake.  They make it fresh so it tastes better than you can even imagine.<br> I really like all of the food options as well.  There is everything from soup to fish and chips.  There is a giant food selection and I never know what to choose from.  They have a kids menu and an adult menu.   If you order noodles, there are lots of sauces that you can choose from like tomato sauce, alfredo sauce, and others.  The desert is another thing that I love about the Cheesecake Factory because there is amazing ice cream and you can get it with or without sprinkles.  There are many other desserts that I can´t explain.  One time I went there and got oreo cheesecake and it was fantastic because it had whipped cream and Oreos on it.<br> The service there is great.  The only thing is that if you don´t have a reservation, you may have to wait  They bring your food out fast and it still tastes amazing.  The servers are very nice and give you recommendations for certain foods and deserts.  There are usually zero problems with my food so I don´t have to spend extra time waiting for them to redo my food or dessert.  When I sit down the server is there to take my drink order in a snap.<br> The size of the restaurant is pretty big and there are lots of tables.  I like this because when there is a lot of people they can usually take me in right away and get me seated.  The tables are located in nice places so it is not an obstacle coarse just to get to your table and it is easy to get around.  I love how there are booths and regular tables so you can sit at either one.<br> The last thing that makes the Cheesecake Factory the best is the atmosphere.  All of the floors are clean and there is usually nothing on the tables or benches when you sit down.  They have nice decorations like little bakers.  <br> I love the Cheesecake Factory.  If you like cheesecake and good food you must go for dinner tonight.  There are not that many of them but when you go it will definitely be worth the drive.  You will go back to your house filled up and you will not be hungry after you go there.   I sometimes come home with leftovers.   It is a great place to go for your birthday or other special occasions.<br> It may be expensive but it is definitely worth it.  If you haven´t tried it yet and you think Chick-fil-a is the best, you should give the Cheesecake Factory a try.

The 20-30 minute wait for a table inside did not bother me, as I knew I was in for a good meal. My meal, the Steak Diane &amp; Shrimp Scampi with mashed potatoes was very good. The speed of the wait service however was not the normal not overly rushed, but not too slow level. it seems like it took over 5 minutes before my server came to even offer me a drink. My server however took both my my drink order and food order at the same time, so I did not have to wait even longer. Despite this both seemed to take longer than normal to arrive. Also unlike normal I was not offered bread and butter, but rather had to ask for it. Just seems today that the service was not on par with what I normally get at this restaurant, but the food was good, as usual.

If I could do zero stars, I would.. Well first off, my boyfriend almost ate a 10 inch black hair in complimentary sour dough bread roll served as we waited for our food. He pulled the big long hair out of his mouth, and I about lost it! If it had been me, I would have thrown up! He calmly showed our waiter who said someone would be over to talk to us. Some lady manager came over nonchalantly saying they don&#39;t bake the bread, and they will let the supplier know. She barely apologized, and did not offer to comp our meal or a thing! She blew us off like this happens every shift!<br>This place has REALLY GONE DOWN HILL! WE had to tell the waiter to take the bread off the table. He just stood there. Like WTF!! Whole experience and meal were horrible.<br>Avoid this place.<br>NEVER GO HERE UNLESS YOU LIKE EATING HAIR!

Kayli did a jam up job! She never even let my water cup get empty. She was very pleasant and attentive to all of my needs. She made sure to explain to me what needed to be explained and she was an overall EXCELLENT server!

Delicious food, amazing service, and ridiculously affordable prices in the heart of downtown Denver!!!<br><br>I&#39;m surprised this place doesn&#39;t have 10 stars. I&#39;ve been coming to cheesecake factory for a couple of years now and they never let me down. The wait on a weekend is about 30 minutes but well worth it. The inside the decor is classy, they have a cute little section to shop for what seems like hundreds of different flavors of cheesecake, and a very romantic and hip dinner setting. They also have the option to dine outdoors on the patio on warm days. <br><br>Without hurting your pockets you can enjoy a nice date night, a happy hour hangout with friends, or a birthday celebration which they LOVE to do here (they always make you feel special with a cheesecake on the house). Definitely on my top list of places to go!!

Went to dinner last night. The food was okay,but nothing special. My wife and I asked for a drink menu. When we got the drink menu it had no prices. We ordered a pasta to share and a appetizer and two mojitos each.. When we got our bill we noticed the mojitos were $16 a piece. We spent $64 for 4 mojitos. I would honestly save your money and try something else.

Sometimes living in the city surrounded by mom-and-pop restaurants and also fancy start up restaurants i&#39;m often reminded where you ate before I discovered these restaurants it was cheesecake factory... Let&#39;s face it have good food... Good servers Who make you want to hang around and just kick it with them like Debbie and JOSH... So let&#39;s get down to the food... it&#39;s always reliable good for me you don&#39;t really have to think about it just ask what&#39;s popular most likely are going to be satisfied with the suggestion ... So basically what I&#39;m trying to say is come home to the franchise restaurants once in a while they&#39;re really good

Service: Seated very quickly, our waitress took a long time to come take our order and took a long time to return to check on us. <br><br>Sangria: great drink. My second sangria order actually had fruit in which was great. <br><br>Chicken Riesling: the chicken was moist and had good flavor. The pasta was very dry and bland. I wish it had more of a cream sauce. I tried mixing with the little sauce that was there. There are so many meal options, wishing I would have gotten something else. <br><br>30th Anniversary Cheesecake: delicious! Come on this is the real reason you come to the Cheesecake Factory that&#39;s all that really matters.

TIME TO GO IN!!! Let me start by exclaiming I would never in any circumstance choose to come to The Cheesecake Factory. This place was in high school one of those places highschool kids took their dates cause it looked classy (inside), and the food was decent (not great, but okay). <br><br>My girlfriend while recently out of state tried another location, and found a dish she was recently impressed with, when she came back to CO she tried the dish at a local location on the 16th Street Mall in downtown Denver and was at that time equally satisfied. The dish I&#39;m referring to is the hibachi steak, Wasabi mashed potatoes, with fried asparagus. <br><br>We arrived at the 16th Street location around 430pm 10/30/16 and everything just seemed off from the moment we entered the building. To start the ladies waiting to seat people were off in the middle of the restaurant. So when you walk in you&#39;re waiting for someone to ask you to be seated at the Desk right near the door, but no one is there, so you just wait. Then if the two ladies aren&#39;t too busy talking to one another or looking down from the middle of the restaurant they FLAG you over, just to walk us back the direction we just came from to be seated.  (I saw two people standing there at the front door for so long they, and they were never approached about seating so they just walked out.)<br><br>We order two plates...  Coullette steak (rare), mashed potatoes, and green beans (my plate). My girlfriend ordered her favorite, and literally the only reason for visiting this restaurant the Hibachi Steak (extra mushrooms) medium, Wasabi mashed potatoes, and fried asparagus (tempura). <br><br>My plate comes and I immediately notice that my steak is medium to medium well (if you&#39;re a steak lover, this is a major turnoff). Charred as hell on the outside. Mashed is fine, green beans are hard as rocks. Literally, how can you ruin a RARE steak I decide I&#39;m starving, and don&#39;t want to send it back as it seemed to take them forever to bring it in the first place (watched my girlfriend polish off the entire damn near basket of bread we were brought waiting for our meals.) I was so hungry I would have literally ate cardboard at this point.<br><br> My girlfriend starts to dive into her meal, and notices that the steak she was given in her meal is mostly gristle and fat, she informs the waiter (Dan) and he proceeds to take the entire plate (not just the cruddy steak), we&#39;ve both been starving while waiting for! Now, all of a sudden a complaint over the steak translates into take confiscate the entire dish... (Thanks Dan!) While she waited another 35 minutes or so for them to fix her another meal (I&#39;m completely done with my food at this point!!!) supposed to be a different cut of steak from a different steak plate, but they were supposed to plate it the exact same way (Hibachi style, same sides).<br><br> Didn&#39;t really go down that way at all! We received a second server halfway through our meal named ****Stephen****, he was awesome, and offered to try and rectify the situation some (comp&#39;d cheesecake, Thank you for that!), but between the long waits, bad food, and crappy service from the first waiter we were both over it. The manager had came initially and spoke to my girlfriend after the first plate was messed up, but basically encouraged her to just choose another plate &#34;as he had no way of being able to tell the quality of the other steaks&#34; for the meal (he had no idea, that this woman was not interested in anything else on their menu). <br><br>The manager never revisited the table to see how the replacement meal turned out. I&#39;ve had better service at Dennys from managers. The second steak was a better cut, but hardly had any mushrooms whatsoever(let alone extra as she had ordered originally), had no tempura asparagus, etc.<br><br> Like when you have your appetite set for something in particular and they mess it up, you kinda just want to leave. We waited so long for our check to come we contemplated walking out of the restaurant at least 7 times. Stephen, later gave the issue back to Dan to fix cause I think he was wanting to get away from the issue.<br><br>I&#39;m almost happy they ruined my girlfriends taste for this spot, maybe I will never have to come back to this God forsaken place again!!! I&#39;m not sure if the kitchen was just off, or what the hell it was going on with the staff, etc. but people don&#39;t want to pay their hard earned money for bullshit. Eat here at your own risk, I could think of at least twenty places in this area I could go for a better meal and service.

This will be the last time I ever order from Cheesecake Factory. Only dish I liked was lemon herb chicken. No longer chicken on the bone- it is now small cutlets- very dry. They didn&#39;t have order ready for delivery driver and it took a really long time. When it finally arrived, food was cold. Mash potatoes were like a brick - worst I&#39;ve ever had. Called manager to see why it was delayed and he said they forgot to sauce it. He said there was nothing he could do for me since it was ordered through Door Dash. Food was terrible for the price. CF won&#39;t stand by their product.<br><br>[Re: Guest Svc.: CF did not have order ready, Door Dash driver had to wait. My favorite item has been changed. The food that arrived was inedible. Unresponsive response! Have not been back to your restaurant]

Came here on a Sunday afternoon. We opted to sit at the bar where Jordan was our server/bartender. We ordered LI Iced teas and they were awesome. For the 2nd round, we wanted something different. Jordan was quick to throw out some suggestions and even made me a customized drink which was AMAZING!!! <br>The food we ordered was very fresh tasting and hot! The Nutella cheesecake was to die for. We will definitely go back.

What can I say, I love a good cheesecake and a good martini! Stopped in here one afternoon to just treat myself. I walked in and was greeted right away, and made my way to the bar, where I sat for the duration of my visit.<br><br>My server/bartender, Leah was great! She greeted me right away, answered every question I had in detail, and was just super friendly overall. I ordered the lunch portion Margarita pizza with an Asian Pear martini. What a refreshing delight that was! Once I finished that one, Leah and her fellow female bartender suggested a drink that turned out to be an absolutely perfect finish. Really enjoyed my visit here!

I was in Denver for Thanksgiving.  I have not been in Denver for close to 30 years, so my experience at the restaurant becomes emblematic of dining in downtown Denver.  Perusing the many comments on this CF location I know I am just going to repeat the obvious:  uneven food, uneven service.  We had a large group, 10+ people.  Food at one table was brought out 10-15 minutes before the other table.  Our other table was ready to go and I was shoveling food in my mouth to keep up.  My salad was supposed to feature avocado.  It became a game to identify the small chunks of avocado in the salad; maybe there was a slice.  Food at both tables was below standard.  Two meals were comped by management.  All of us received free cheesecake as compensation.  The cheesecake was good.<br><br>So I can established that my experience was not good, and I can read through the reviews and see that other folks have experienced the same problems; uneven food, uneven service.<br><br>Beyond blaming the operations of the kitchen the way our server did, I&#39;d like to know what CF is doing to correct these deficiencies, and not just some corporate platitude statement extolling the goals.  Really, what is changing.....?  I would start with slimming down the voluminous menu.  Way to many options and something gets lost when you offer too many selections.<br><br>So for downtown Denver dining, my one experience is at CF, and that really was not too choice.  Is that representative of dining in Denver?  If so, I head to my favorite places in Tucson or Phoenix.

I suggested to Honey that we go to Cheesecake Factory dinner tonight because I know the food is always comforting, delicious and they are known for having great service.  I was disappointed this visit and will not return... at least to this location.<br><br>Pros:<br>We ate dinner at the bar to avoid the wait. Our cocktail was delicious.  Bartenders were pleasant.<br><br>Cons:<br>Food was just okay. Presentation was definetly not up to CF standard (I know becuase I was once an emplyee) and my entree was cold.  I asked for it the be reheated which it was but there something about lackluster about eating a $20 entree that had to reheated in the microwave.<br><br>Service was ok as well.  They were busy but from what I heard there is &#34;normally a two hour wait&#34; vs the 30 min wait tonight, at times, they are even busier.<br><br>Many CF points of service, that you come to expect after eating there for years, were missed, as well as opportunities to rectify them.<br><br>Side note, the Rockies game was playing on one of the bar TVs and the other had a crime drama playing. I had intended on asking if they would be okay with changing the crime drama to the game as well (no one was watching it) and we would then have a clear view of the game.  I never got around to it because of the other hiccups during our dinner.  Most of the time I felt as if asking for something was creating a problem for them.<br><br>I still enjoyed my time but mostly because I was in good company and not becuase the dining experience (which comes a moderate price tag).<br>I was disappointed that things did not go according to the CF standard. Most especially after spending $100 for one meal for two.  That adds up to a lot of hours of work when you do the math.<br><br>Please know that my comments are not a reflection of the staff personally.<br><br>I am leaving this review not because my dinner is of any critical importance but because I have been a continued patron becuase of their attention to detail, delicious food, and great service<br><br>After tonight, I will not return.<br><br>**As I type this I can see previous reviewers comments and realize this is likely falling on deaf ears.
Does the Cheescake Factory need another review? You know it&#39;s great. You know the food is awesome. Just go already.

My wife and I went to the Cheesecake Factory to celebrate a friend&#39;s birthday. It was a busy Saturday (September 22nd) evening and we had reservations for 7:30. The waitress came to take our drink orders. She was a bit quirky, but pleasant. She mentioned that the bar was busy, but we weren&#39;t in a hurry. She came back to take our order for dinner. I ordered the salmon and my wife, the Cajun chicken pasta. After about 20 minutes, our drinks finally arrived. Sometime later our waitress introduced maybe her trainee? Not sure who he was. One way or the other, our waitress disappeared. We grabbed another waiter to order more drinks because we couldn&#39;t find ours. Finally the waiter came with our meals. It was 8:20 and our meals were cold. Our waitress reappeared about halfway through the meal. She asked how everything was and we told her that our food took almost an hour and it was cold. Her response was completely ridiculous. She said, &#34;ya know... you come to a restaurant, order a meal and I put it into the kitchen... there are bound to be problems..&#34; My wife and I were left slack jawed. She said that she&#39;d get the birthday girl and those with cold food free cheesecake. So, four of us ordered cheesecake. The cheesecake came out all boxes up as orders. Then out came our bill. She said that she comped the birthday girl, mine and another guests, but said my wife had to pay for hers. My wife said that the waitress could take hers back to the kitchen and that the only reason she ordered it was because it was offered as comped. The waitress said that she was the easiest person to talk to in the world and to let her know what she wanted and that she wouldn&#39;t take the cheesecake back to the kitchen. She left again and came back a bit later with the new bill. We ended up leaving the establishment at 9:10, making it impossible for us to go to the rest of the birthday activities. All in all it was a TERRIBLE experience and have no plans on returning.

Came to The Cheesecake Factory on a Wednesday afternoon as we were on our wait to another restaurant.  The weather was too cold to us weak Southern Californians so we found refuge inside this restaurant.  We have all been to other locations before so this was somewhere we could all agree upon.<br><br>Food was great.  We shared the guacamole and our waitress offered to put chilis on the side since we couldn&#39;t decide between non spicy - mild - spicy.  What a great solution to our problem.  I got the Louisiana Chicken Pasta and it was wonderful.  Service was wonderful and the servers were very attentive and they were constantly refilling our drinks.
Worse experience. Poor service. Manager Doug apologized and then we waited another 25 min to get the free food. <br><br>My fave Resturant. Not a location I would go back to.

This is just going to be my thoughts on the landmark dessert: always stick to the single layer cheesecakes! While the super tall, multi-layered cake-cheesecakes are tempting and great looking, you&#39;re not getting that much &#34;cheese&#34; in your &#34;cake&#34;! Case in point: The Ultimate Red Velvet Cheesecake has a nice tangy cream cheese frosting but the red velvet cake part was very average. And the 30th Anniversary Chocolate Brownie Cheesecake may look decadent, the brownie layer was an overkill, and not even that exceptional. The Pineapple Upside-Down Cheesecake? Too syrup-y and too &#34;confectionery&#34;, if you know what I mean.<br><br>Note to self: always look at the cheesecakes at the counter before deciding. On the menu, the new Lemon Meringue Cheesecake did not sound good at all. But after we&#39;re done and I stole a peek from the counter window, it looked so simple yet classic, and pure!

We came here tonight for a birthday with a group of 7 girls. The service wasn&#39;t the best. Our drinks were taking such a long time to come out. One of the girls didn&#39;t get her drink until 10 minutes after we all got them and the drinks were half full, not sure if they were spilled on the way or what but the glass was half empty. Then two guests didn&#39;t get their appetizers because the server forgot about them, that took like 15 minutes after everyone els got their food. The food was the worst this time. Jambalaya was bland and the chipotle chicken had no spice to it at all. The cheesecake was amazing as always. The total WITH a great tip was 600$ for 7 people. Such a waste of money. We had better experiences and this time was a very bad experience. Try to just come for the deserts. The food was bad and drinks were half there. Really disappointed. Bad turn out.

Please don&#39;t disappoint me Cheesecake Factory for giving you five stars. They are FAR from vegan friendly but because they have the Korean BBQ fried cauliflower bits, I will be coming here quite frequently. While the restaurant changes their menu every six months or so, staff told me they&#39;ll probably keep the cauliflower bits a LOT longer since they&#39;re so popular. <br><br>Admittedly I&#39;m not a cauliflower fan but for this dish they are battered in rice flour, baking soda, salt, and pepper, then fried. No egg in the batter. It&#39;s been confirmed THREE times by the local restaurant manager, the Boulder CO restaurant, and corporate. The sauce itself is spicy but not fire engine hot. They come to you hot and crispy. <br><br>It comes with a ranch dip, which I don&#39;t get since it contains animal excretions. But these are so good, it doesn&#39;t need a dip.<br><br>I&#39;ve shared this on the Denver Vegans page on Facebook, which has more than 3,000 members. So you had better not let us down, Cheesecake Factory!<br><br>P.S. This visit was to the restaurant at Southwest Plaza in Littleton, not downtown Denver.

After we finished our pizza at Grimaldi&#39;s we headed down to The Cheesecake Factory for dessert.  We got the Oreo cheesecake,  the vanilla bean cheesecake,  the Reese&#39;s peanut butter cheesecake and I got the lemoncello torte. Needless to say everyone loved their choices!  The lemon torte had just the right hint of lemon flavor and was not overly tart. And the cheesecakes were as smooth as velvet!

Well the food was good the service was good but way overpriced. For the honey truffel chicken 2 pieces of chicken and a mound of mashed potatoes and 6 sprigs if asparagus. $17?? Doesn&#39;t add up. Found out the reason they don&#39;t put the prices for their drinks on the menu is they are ashamed  obviously as they are  rediculous.. $13 and wasn&#39;t even a decent sized drink.  We went for a birthday and they don&#39;t even give a free dessert. No veterans discount either .. won&#39;t be back. It is rediculous for a chain of this  size to be like this.. greedy.

Came in at 9pm for dessert and hankering for molten chocolate lava with vanilla ice cream. After waiting 20+ minutes, we were told that they were out of ice cream. They didn&#39;t offer to comp one glass of red wine for our wait and their lack of being able to fulfill the order.

Well we often like to walk the mall and people watch.  We like Cheesecake Factory and were hungry.  It was busy so there was a wait, no big deal. While we wait by the cheesecake bar we watch a waitress knock over the cheese cake she was trying to pick up, THEN PICKS IT UP WITH HER BARE HANDS THE SMASHES THE COOKIE ON TOP DOWN.... ‍‍...I guess it was to hard to have the cheesecake bar employee with gloves on fix it or make another, she was handling other items so I know damm well he hands weren&#39;t clean... I&#39;m honestly questioning ever eating out again. Long story short we left without eating. Kinda what ya get in a tourist trap I suppose.

I went here last night...the service was terrible. There was a new server training....it was an hour before we finally got our food after them basically forgetting about our drinks. My entree was totally botched...dry and cold. We had the manager come to the table and he basically just offered to take it off the check...nothing but the cheesecake I bought before I went home was even worth this experience. Clearly needs new management.
Food was pretty  good, not cheap.  $75 lunch for 2 with 2 drinks.  Feels like they were always rushing to fill the table again

Honestly the food was pretty good like usual! The serving was amazing as well. But how the server approached my friend bout her dress could have been said differently . She sat us down and looked her dead in the eye and said this is a family restaurant you really shouldn&#39;t be wearing that. Honestly my friend and I didn&#39;t know how her dress was positioned like that till she said something . Her dress honestly positioned differently because the long walk we had due to downtown parking .Just how the hostess said it ruined my friends vibe the entire night and she drove from Cheyenne Wyoming to celebrate my birthday with me .

I mainly like the cheesecake factory because its consistent. Eventhough they have a million dishes to choose from, their chicken piccata and the crusted chicken romano are my go to entrees. These dishes are perfect for sharing. Every time they are perfectly cooked. Also when you share one of their incredibly huge dishes you can save room for some of their incredible cheesecake. If you like carrot cake try the carrot cake cheesecake. My new favorite.

It was  Saturday, March 1, 2020, around 6 pm when my family and I went for the Cheesecake Factory downtown where their food was great and the service of the waiter was phenomenal, (he was great, brilliant, so helpful, kind, and patient{a top-notch by all standards}), but the lady at the reception or front desk was too disrespectful, rude, and temper. She asked us to wait outside at the building&#39;s lobby which okay and very normal to me, but when I politely asked her are you going to call us when we are outside which is by common sense meant in the lobby as per her instruction, she replied started aggressively and rudely yelling and shouting at me in front of many people and saying&#34;if you&#39;re outside I won&#39;t&#34; where I told her I am going to be of course outside the restaurant but in the lobby as per your instruction. Anyway, it was a really bad and shocking experience and I really got embarrassed in the front fist of myself, my family, staff, and people who were around me. I will try to never visit that place. I don&#39;t understand where is the management for installing such aggressive people in the front line of their businesses.

Seriously we have tried to give them the benefit of the doubt but you know it&#39;s bad when even door dash has multiple issues with them. This time they went too far we were charged for a whole pumpkin cheesecake that we ordered but when we actually received it it was just one slice. (Where&#39;s the other 11 slices??) the food is decent but over priced for the quantity you receive.

Mmhmm... Cheesecake Factory has always been a solid dining choice for me when downtown, but this time wasn&#39;t so great. Was here on a Sunday night for a family dinner with the in-laws, so a total of 7 people. Overall, I don&#39;t think anyone of us thought the food was any good. It took about 45 minutes to get our food and it was cold when it arrived. The managers came to personally apologize, but nothing beyond that. <br><br>I went with Chicken and Biscuits with extra chicken. The gravy has a &#34;crust&#34; on the surface when it came and looked more like slop than gravy... The biscuits seemed to come straight out of a bag and the chicken &#34;breast&#34; was a flat piece of chicken, probably frozen. <br><br>It was a disappointing visit...

I love this cheesecake factory. Marybel and Dayna are awesome. I really enjoyed their help and customer service.They owe me a free slice of cheesecake but they are the best to deal with never the less. Quick, charming, and I hope I deal with them everytime.

Every time we eat here or order take out, it takes nearly an hour to get food once we order. The last time I ordered take out, I was told 25 minutes but it actually took 50 minutes. However, even though it was an extremely long wait, the server was doing a great job and gave me the best service she could. She even got a manager involved before I even asked to give me some accommodation. Despite a very slow kitchen, everyone does give great customer service.
Great service on a Saturday night. Kayli took good care of us and was very attentive. Food was good... came in a timely manner.

I visited this restaurant about a month ago to celebrate both my birthday and National Cheesecake Day. I also had a gift card rom customer service after I had a horrendous experience with another location in California when I was on vacation. I called them ahead to make sure my disabilities would be accommodated, and was told that everything would be taken care of when I arrive. I went around lunchtime and basically spent three hours there because the speed o service was extremely slow, and they kept switching the servers on me, making me confused as to who to order with. I was also told by one of the servers that the full-size cheesecakes were also on sale, along with the single slices being half price, but I was quickly disproven when I went to pay and ended up spending about $20-30 out of my own poket, when I didn&#39;t anticipate spending anything at all with my gift card. I sent a complaint to their corporate offices but haven&#39;t heard anything back in almost a month, making me believe they don&#39;t are about providing good quality stoker service when things go wrong. Very disappointed, as the food was the best part about everything and was actually pretty good, even if it was trembly overpriced. But I probably won&#39;t go back to this location in the future, and might try another location next time, if I decide to go back.

Wednesday night (07/25/2018). Arrived at 7:40 pm. Seated at 8:05 pm. Ordered all foods at 8:10 pm. Food comes out at 9:00 pm. Orange chicken comes out cold and soggy. Saw it sitting on the kitchen counter for a while. Asked to have it reheated. The party next to us, that came after us, got their food first. Only 1 drink out of 4 refilled the entire time. No sorry for long wait. No sorry for cold food. Very unfriendly. Threw our check on out table. No thank you or anything.Worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been to in my entire life. Ridiculous. Servers name was Sorrel. Will never come here again, maybe even all Cheesecake Factories locations.

The service here was horrendous! We arrived at 8:45pm and didn&#39;t get get seated until 9:20 pm. When we got seated we waited another 20 min to have our drink order taken, and another 7 min just to get our drinks in hand. When we finally ordered we waited an hour just for them to tell us that they ran out of 2 of the dishes our party ordered. Once our food arrived many of the side dishes that came with our meal did not arrive with our main entree.<br>When we asked for drink refills we didn&#39;t get them until about 20 min later. When we finally got our check and paid, it took about another 15 min to just receive our change.

Food is good service is terrible. Waiter never checked back with me after serving my food to see if it was OK. No drink refill. Waited 15 minutes after finishing food to try and get the waiters attention. He checked both tables on either side of me. I ended up asking a bus boy to help. He told the waiter but the waiter continued to ignore me. I ended up going to the hostess to pay for my food.

Cool. Pretty cool. Just cool. Cooler. Coolest maybe. <br>No this is really good people if you are looking for some coffee drink with 75 people in waiting but you go straight to the bar and seat on your own order a freaking Irish coffee or water whichever it&#39;s really cool checkmate our this place is good.

I had reservations at a 5 star establishment and was very frustrated with my service. So I left and walked a few short blocks until I saw that big iconic sign &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34; I had plans for a very romantic evening in mind when I left my house that night. But with my plans flipped on head and not many options we chose to dine at a high top in the bar because we were starved at this point. Service was slow at first but to be expected with how many people were in the restaurant. I can&#39;t remember our servers name but he was fantastic. He also had a 14 top on our same section but it didn&#39;t effect our service at all. We started off with drinks, I got a mojito and my lady had a martini. Then appetizers we got the lettuce tacos, crab cakes, and stuffed mushrooms! My girlfriend got the medallions and I had a filet. They were both amazing! I can&#39;t express enough how much The Cheesecake Factory saved my night! Thank you to the entire staff!

Every time I come here, there&#39;s at least an hour and a half wait and they will not accept reservations. I was quoted an hour wait and after I checked in, they told me it would be another 45 minutes. They have no courtesy, even management is rude. Your food takes forever to come out and when it does, your lucky if it&#39;s at least warm.  I&#39;d definitely recommend to stay away from here, as this send to be a common issue from the other reviews.<br><br>Update: finally got seated after an hour and forty minutes. I ordered the Stuffed Cheddar Burger only to be told that there all out. I will NEVER be coming back to this place.
