I love the Cheesecake Factory and normally this is my go to place when dining out of town with the family. We were seating very quickly which was nice but our service was beyond terrible!! <br>The waitress failed to refill our drinks, bring the alcoholic drinks, or even bring the table silverware. We waited for more than an hour for our food while the people around us got their food fairly quickly. The food was cold and pasta was hardening up from sitting for a while before getting to us. One of the seafood plates was undercooked. I spoke with the manager which offered to bring another plate for the undercooked one. We didn&#39;t bother making more complaints as everyone was tired and frustrated and ready to leave. <br><br>Worst experience at a Cheesecake Factory!

After ordering the &#34;pizza style&#34; chicken parm - the server came back to say they were out of the pizza sauce for the dish and could use a different tomato sauce. A-ok with me. When it comes out, it&#39;s a completely different dish - lightly breaded chicken instead of fully breaded, a small portion of sauce, and worst of all-  no melted cheese. I told the server to at least add cheese to it - and it came back with a bunch of mozzarella cheese melted...over the pasta. None on the chicken. Incredibly disappointing. On top of that it cost $18 - waay over-priced. The strawberry blossom cocktail was great though. Only redeeming factor.

Do not order to-go. We ordered at 7pm for 8pm. We got there at 7:35 and waited patiently in line. They were understaffed and should not have been accepting to-go orders. I watched as the type of cheesecake we ordered dwindled. When we got to the front for our order, they told us they were out of what I had already been charged for. Why wasn&#39;t it set aside for my to-go? Manager tried to say it has to do with the ticket order. No it doesn&#39;t. My ticket came in at 7pm. Your people don&#39;t set aside cake orders for the to-go. The food we got in addition to the cake was subpar and absolutely not worth the money.

Was not expecting the vegetarian options available here. The vegan Cobb salad and the Asian salad taco without chicken. Everything seemed fresh and tasted good. Shout out to our waiter Gabrielle (hope this is right). She provided exceptional service!

My wife and I love eating at Cheesecake Factory not only because I am an enormous fan of cheesecake but also because my wife is an indecisive eater. The wide variety of meals to choose from makes this an easy option to appease all parties. Plentiful portions, awesome apps, delicious desserts and a menu to please everyone in your party makes this place a tried and try favorite of ours and if they had a frequent flyer card we&#39;d be lifetime platinum members. Prices are reasonable for the food you get but be prepared to part with some money. I don&#39;t think we&#39;ve had dessert and left without spending $50. No drinks included in that figure either.
Me and my wife ate there tonight.<br>The food was good, I ordered the Bellago chicken<br>The dish was very big and satisfying, I most definitely go back

Who knew?! Felt like a tourist in our own hometown of Denver and it was fun! Received a gift certificate for this place and made a Friday night date night and it was perfect.... TIP: sit literally at the bar; makes for a more authentic experience, not to mention quicker service!<br><br>Surprising is the &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu, and I had the Ahi tartare ...raw tuna with avocado and and a soy-ginger sesame sauce... Great taste, presentation and fresh... 390 calories, and entree was the Fresh vegetable salad... Green beans, roasted beets, edamame and bunch more veggies topped with a unique pomegranate vinaigrette...490 calories!<br><br>Nicely greeted, awesome service, great ambiance!
Bartender Alexander is great!   Otherwise food and cheesecake is as expected.  Great area for walking downtown.

The Denver Dept. of Health conducted an inspection on 7/23/2019 and found 4 critical violations: pan of moldy food in cooler, employees touching food with bare hands, improper cold holding and drinks stored improperly.  This report will be available to the public by Monday.  The last health inspection on 3/27/2019 found 3 critical violations which included Poor Hygienic Practices!

Normally a good experience, but last night ruined my anniversary. We waited forever for service, eventally got cold bread, then waited even longer for just glasses of water. Despite this initial poor service, I convinced my girlfriend to give a higher tip than she thought was fair. As a result of this argument, our post dinner plans were ruined. The waiter offered to pack up our leftovers, but excluded most of an order of mac &amp; cheese. We discovered this after the fact, furthering the disagreement over the tip. As a result of all this, I am still in the doghouse. Needless to say, this is the last time I ever go out of my way to give someone a reasonable tip who doesn&#39;t deserve it.

The food is excellent. The portions are huge. The only reason why I don&#39;t give it 5 stars is that when we walked in,  The restaurant was empty somewhat. There were plenty of tables, yet we had to wait 10 minutes before we were seated. It seems like the hostess had more to say to her coworkers then she did to work. That&#39;s why I&#39;m not giving it 5 stars. I think the service needs to be stepped up when it comes to the hostess.
I just waited an hour on my steak, but when it comes, its dry and cold. Don&#39;t eat at this place<br>.

It was awful. Never again. The food was burnt and the mashed potatoes was like a rock. Not creamy at all they was so dry. How do your burn three chicken breast. Now the worst park. The chicken kids meal and food poison. Throwing up happened about 4 hours later  after eating the potatoes and one bite of the burnt chicken. Such a shame since we eat at the Littleton one all the time. We assumed all Cheesecake factories would have a higher standard. I guess not.

The wait to sit was long and taking name system outdated. Watched a hostess walk around restaurant for 3 minutes looking for someone who was already called. They need to get beepers or something to call patrons when their tables are ready. <br><br>On to the food. The comp bread was good, a little stale but ok. Butter for the bread was frozen. Too hard to spread. <br><br>The loaded potato soup was fabulous. Best soup I&#39;ve ever eaten. Creamy, with chunks of potato, chives, and bacon added an explosion of flavor. <br><br>The bacon bacon burger was cooked perfectly. Medium, lots of juices and flavor throughout. The &#34;secret&#34; sauce complimented the burger. Any more sauce though and it would kill the burger. The bun- way to big for the meat. Did not care for all the extra bread. <br><br>Overall, A-

3.5. This was a good meal, even though I had to ask for the second sauce they forgot to put on the dish--not a big deal. Our server was kind and pretty much in the ball. We had the chicken Bellagio and it was very tasty as always. Their bread was soft and warm. The Oreo cheesecake was luscious. Shared everything--the portions are too large to not share unless you want tomorrow&#39;s meals taken care of too. We will always come back to The Cheesecake Factory.

Vegetarians beware!!! I ordered a pasta dish, that ordinarily comes with chicken, without chicken. It came to my table, with chicken. I returned it immediately and a few moments later the same plate returned minus the chicken (or so the kitchen thought). I took two bites and then found a large chunk of chicken.  They had literally pulled the pieces they saw out. DISGUSTING!!! I would never have wanted a bite of anything with meat having been laying in it moments before. Poor judgement and training! Manager apologized with a very typical reply. But I no longer trust this place. <br><br>I guess if I am looking for positives, lots of space in this place, lots of seating. The wait was quick (30 min at 7:30pm) for a Sat night.

Decent food. I came here for lunch with co-workers on Friday 4/14/17.  I tried the Nashville nuggets which were surprisingly delicious. The appetizer came out quick but our server did drop one of the nuggets.  Also had the lunch pizza and salad.  The pizza was decent but not great.  The crust was crunchy and the middle was soggy.  Not particularly how I like my pizza.  My co-worker ordered the pot stickers which were sitting in a soy sauce that made them too salty. I always have liked the Cheesecake Factory and have been to various locations across the US but I must say, this is the worst looking interior out of all of the ones I&#39;ve been in.  It just didn&#39;t look impressive inside like others locations I&#39;ve been too.<br><br>Overall, even though I&#39;ll definitely go to CF again, it most likely won&#39;t be this location. If you like this franchise, this location probably won&#39;t make you any more enthusiastic about the restaurant.
I love the Cheesecake Factory!!! The service and food is always on point no matter where you eat. I always get the Samos&#39;s and the Thai chicken wraps! Love it
That&#39;s nice,chicken sandwich is good, I&#39;ll try hamburgers next time with my friends,everyone is enthusiasm here.

I usually love the cheesecake factory but this location is horrible. First off, my pasta sauce was watery. Second off, our waiter didn&#39;t refill our water until we were about to leave. We also asked for more bread and he never brought it. And the grossest part was that I accidentally left my leftovers on the table, and when I came back in (2 seconds later) to get it, it was gone. You&#39;d think the waiter would tell me he threw it out, but NO he rustled through the trash and so kindly gave it back to me. Gross.

Decent..can be hit or miss due to service and when it&#39;s busy..boy it can be busy<br>I love the tiramisu more than the cheesecakes lol..must try! and the bbq pizza amazing..<br>But maybe serve coffee in &#34;regular&#34; cups.

I&#39;ve been here a few times now for late night dessert and wine! The cheesecake is incredible each time! I&#39;m a huge fan of anything chocolate so I have tried the anniversary cheesecake which is exquisite and I recently tried the tuxedo cheesecake which has a mascarpone layer which makes the cheesecake even more creamy and delicious! Topped with whipped cream you can&#39;t go wrong with this especially if you are a chocolate lover like me!<br><br>Paired with a glass of rose wine this was just what I needed! The white Zinfandel wine is also a great dessert wine that goes great with cheesecake! If you&#39;re in the mood for something sweet check this place out as they have a huge variety of cheesecakes to choose from! Ask the waiter what their favorites Are and they always give great recommendations and never steer you in the wrong direction! Besides the delicious dessert offered here, the service was good. They had a table for two ready for us in about ten minutes which was great, because it gave us a little time to look at the cheesecakes before we sat down so we had an idea of which ones we wanted. Great dessert spot if you&#39;re around 16th street you will never be disappointed!

The food was really good.  I had the Chicken Madeira. They ran out of mashed potatoes so I subbed in the asparagus. Just before serving the food, our waiter notified me that they had just finished potatoes so I got both!  They were both really good.  I ordered the lemon raspberry cheesecake.  I have ordered this before at other Cheesecake Factory Restaurants and thought I had died and gone to heaven.  However, this go around was not as good.  It had a layer of cake on the bottom or something that had soaked up quite a bit of moisture.  But I scraped the cheesecake off the bottom layer and it was really good.  I also had a lemon drop martini.  It was awesome! Service was a little slow but they were also really busy.

Hire more staff! I&#39;ve been here twice in the last month and the staff are running around like chickens with their heads cut off. Few weeks ago we waited more than 10 minutes before anyone approached our table and now I can&#39;t even get an order in with the bartender as I&#39;m sitting at the bar. They&#39;re running around extremely busy and no one to support. I would have ordered more but never been asked if I need anything. Poor service.

Came here with some friends for dinner and drinks last night and the whole staff was amazing. Our waiter was always right there when we needed anything and always had a smile on their face. Everything we ate was so good. I would highly recommend this place for a night out. Anything you order whether it&#39;s food or drinks or both you won&#39;t be sorry. And you&#39;ll get great service to go with it.
We have been to many Cheesecake Factories in many cities and I would rank this as the best one yet. The food was perfect, our waitress was fantastic and everything was very clean and organized.

The food service was excellent from start till end. We started off with the Buffalo  Wings and Chicken sliders as appetizers,the complimentary bread &amp; butter held us off till the meals came. I had the Shrimp &amp; Chicken Gumbo with brown rice ,in a nutshell was seasoned chicken with veggies n brown rice.. not to say it wasn&#39;t special,  but that&#39;s basically what it was..Customer service was superb, Denver&#39;s Restaurant was a bit smaller than what we have back home in Cali, but nontheless it didn&#39;t skip a beat...

This place is always ALWAYS packed.  Cheesecake is obviously very good with over 20 options to choose from. Food is ok, it&#39;s a chain with options for all. Good service, tends to get a little loud and the wait line outside is intense.
We had Katie as our server and she is excellent. We had time restraints because we are going to a show and a fairly large party and she was always one step ahead. She is very kind and accommodating.

Very bad service. We came in and told the host how much the wait was for outside she said not long we&#39;ll take you back shortly we waited and waited another lady pulled up and asked for outside table they called her within 5 mins mind you I was standing next to the host booth and I told the young lady that we were first and she said that she wanted outside I said we said outside to and she looked and was like ohh you&#39;ll be next. People were being called but yet we still were waiting we ended up leaving. Never again!
Lovely location. Sat outside and it was perfect. Service and food were wonderful. Shrimp scampi abd cajun chicken pasta..delish! Also got smores cheesecake..yum!

Excellent service and experience. On top of everything from customer service to quality of food. . .  Richard was our server, he was very helpful and professional. I will be coming back with friends and family when they come to visit

I know two people that have worked here. I have also eaten here a few times and at different locations as well.<br><br>Pros:<br>- You feel like you are eating in a palace.<br>- They have alcohol here (but it&#39;s expensive!)<br>- National cheesecake day, bogo cheesecake (Often a 2 hour wait)<br><br>Cons:<br>- Overly abused staff (look at the life come out of their eyes as they recite the hundreds of specials they just had to memorize). One of my friends referred to this place as &#34;Slavecake Factory.&#34;<br><br>- Very high calorie density, 2 days worth of calories packed into one sitting at this place.<br><br>- High prices, low quality. This food ingredients sound fancy, but it is corporate, be honest with yourself.<br><br>Don&#39;t come here. Denver has so many impressive local restaurants nearby, just walk a few extra blocks. You will pay less, and your wallet and stomach will feel much better.<br><br>For people complaining about slow service, keep in mind these poor white crayola crayons with the tie have to run through a palace to retrieve what you need.
Gabriel and his helper were great food was excellent can&#39;t wait to be back. Drinks were on point atmosphere was very joyful!!

Thanks for ROYALLY screwing this up!<br><br>My daughter is attending college in the Denver area, first time away from home, and we had arranged for her 18th birthday(we could not be there as we don&#39;t live in Colorado) to be celebrated at this Cheesecake Factory with classmates.  40 minutes to be seated(even with a reservation) and another 40 minutes without so much as getting anything to drink!! The girls were informed that the CF would not place their cake in the fridge while they were dining. Thanks Cheesecake Factory, that wasn&#39;t a cheap cake!!<br><br>Eventually, having been ignored, the group left and split up!! Needless to say, my daughter was BEYOND disappointed and depressed that the event went so horribly and she was spending a special birthday away from her family!<br><br>So, thanks for completely screwing up a special event in a young ladies life!!! I&#39;ve seen the other reviews about your horrible service.  You MAY want to look into that, but you will NOT be getting my money when we visit her in the future.
Really disappointed. After waiting for 50 mins to get a table, and then another 35 mins to get the food, it  was overall a horrible experience. Really poor service. Average and overpriced food.

Came here for lunch and the restaurant was very dead with maybe 3 tables in the entire dining room. The hostess seated us quickly but was not friendly and extremely curt. Service from then on was extremely slow... from start to finish, the entire process took over 2 hours. To top it off, I have a pineapple allergy and enquired about it for one of the desserts. The waiter reassured me that there was no pineapple after asking me if it was an allergy and after he &#34;checked with a manager&#34;. <br><br>Needless to say... there was pineapple juice in the dessert! So disappointed. The only reason it gets 2 stars is because the entrees and apps ordered were fresh and very good.

Last night my lovely friend Priscilla and I had two great chicken dishes.  Her breaded chicken bites were so tender, juicy, &amp; just the right amount of seasoning.  My chicken &amp; pasta dish was sliced very thin, seasoned perfectly, covering a warm bed of pasta.  We both had leftovers so we had enough food for two meals for the price of one.  The mango mojoto&#39;s were nothing short of amazing.

I have been to numerous Cheesecake Factory locations and this one is by far the worst!  The hostess was very rude when putting our name on the list.  When we were sat at our table it took 15 minutes before our table was attended.  The food took longer then normal to arrive at our table and our server didn&#39;t touch our table but 2 times.  On top of all this, food was subpar from what I have normally experienced.  Visiting here from out of town but will not come back.

Beware, this menu is the size of a small book. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is a downtown Denver classic that everyone needs to experience. I have been several times now and I am always taken back at the incredible service and the high quality and quantity of food. The cheesecake here, of course, is marvelous. There must 100 different flavor same assortments of it, and all of them are delectable. <br><br>From birthday parties, to romantic dinners, the Cheesecake Factory promises to satisfy.

Completely Incompetent.<br><br>I have to drop my rating for this location of the cheesecake factory based on consistently sliding service and food quality coupled with complete lack of response from management.<br><br>This last incident culminated with paying, yes, PAYING, for a dessert to go, then being held hostage for OVER 20 MINUTES.  No dessert.  No sight of our server, or ANY server.  It got to the point where, about every 4 minutes, we deducted a dollar from the tip.   Then it stopped being funny when I grabbed the check proving that we&#39;d paid, stomped up to the bakery bar, and demanded my damn cheesecake (that I&#39;d PAID for a half hour ago) so that we could leave.  <br><br>Naturally, I contacted the Cheececake Factory.  About a week ago.  Have I heard ANY sort of reply from them?<br><br>Nope.<br><br>Sorry, CCF, but you&#39;ve slid down into AppleBees territory.  As in:  Next time, I&#39;ll hit McDonald&#39;s, because I know it&#39;ll be better.<br><br>See ya.

We had a large party to celebrate a birthday and we had been looking forward to going to eat here for a while. We started off with one server who we asked a high chair for and he never brought it. Then they gave us a second server and asked him for the highchair and he brought it 20 minutes later.<br><br>Three of us ordered entrees that included mashed potatoes. Three different servers came by to tell us that they were all out of mashed potatoes and asked us what other side we wanted so we them we&#39;d have the macaroni and cheese. When the entrees arrived, my daughter noticed something blue in her fettuccine alfredo which turned out to be a piece of a rubber band! The manager just happened to drop by our table so I mentioned it to him. He said it was part of the pre proportioned pasta. He did offer to bring us a new dish and also deducted it from the bill which was good.<br><br>After all the other entrees arrived, they forgot two of the sides of macaroni and cheese. After telling one server and the manager about it, later they brought out one side but still forgot the other. After they finally brought out mine, my meal was already finished. Also the sides of macaroni and cheese were not made the same. One looked like the kids menu entree and the other looked like a proper side with bread crumbs.<br><br>For our large party having to servers, drinks were constantly left empty and my husband frequently waiting to ask for another beer. The service was terrible. Our first male server did not give a s*** about his job and it was very obvious.

This was the worst experience. My date and I were celebrating our anniversary and were surely disappointed in this restaurant. We were treated poorly, our servers were inattentive, and we waited up to an hour for food. We attempted to order chicken Parmesan but after 10 min we were told they were out of it and had to order something else. When our food came the pasta was hard and cold like it had sat out for awhile or was pre-made. During this whole process our original server had decided to leave and hand us off, all while he kept every other table, which made us feel like we were being stereotyped as &#34;not good tippers&#34;. When it came to paying the bill we had to wait 30 min for our server to come back around and take our cards. Even though I work in the restaurant industry and live on tips, we knew neither of the servers deserved a good tip for how we were treated.

This was a very disappointing visit to CF. My boyfriend and I were seated right away by friendly staff. We got our drinks and put in our order right away, but that&#39;s where it all goes down hill. We ordered an appetizer and our main lunch meals and received our plain bread. (Where did the dark bread go?? Other tables had it?) While waiting for 35-40 minutes, our drinks were not refilled and we didn&#39;t get our appetizer but instead, our main lunches arrived. Without any warning regarding the hot plate, my boyfriend burned his arm on his plate twice. Finally, our waitress came up to ask us how our food was. We expressed our frustrated with her regarding the delayed food arrival, lack of appetizer, burned arm, and asked for a manager and more ketchup. Once all of these things arrived (minus the appetizer), we were almost done with our food. Waitress admits she never put in our appetizer order and that she would put it in right away, we told her just don&#39;t even put it in at that point. We were starving 45 minutes ago. <br>Manager came up to talk to us and didn&#39;t really seem to have much concern, just a business type &#34;here I&#39;ll comp your one dish and a dessert, we are sorry this happened&#34; kind of thing. Cool. But we weren&#39;t looking for a &#34;free meal&#34;. It shouldn&#39;t have happened in the first place as the restaurant wasn&#39;t even busy. After walking by us several times, the waitress should have at least asked if we needed a refill on our drinks or checked on our food since we had been sitting there twiddling our thumbs for over a half an hour. My boyfriend&#39;s meal shouldn&#39;t have been sitting under the heater for however long it takes to burn someone via plate. <br>To make things even better, we received the check with a charge on it for our &#34;comped&#34; cheesecake slice and were told we had to pay for it because we were comped the appetizer... which we never received. <br>Once all was said and done, an hour and a half later for a burger and a salad, we finally ended up paying for my meal and our drink, which was great. But left frustrated and with a headache. <br><br>Birthday cake cheesecake, however, was the best part of the whole meal.

We arrived at 5 pm Saturday and we&#39;re seated right away. Our waiter took the order and it took 30 minutes to get our water and another 15 to get drinks. We then waited another hour and they messed up our orders five times. Served us raw salmon and offered to take the salmon off our bill. No significant effort to apologize. They really need to replace the managers.

From the initial greeting &#34;What to drink&#34; to the &#34;bye&#34; as our check was dropped off, our server Sorrel P was COMPLETELY rude and unprofessional. As servers, we totally understand if things were busy and the potential chaos of a weekend dinner shift, but that was just not the case. Drinks were literally dropped on the table and my plate and side of sandwich was actually slid down my chest as if the plate was slipping from his hand. I made a comment &#34;whoa&#34; and moved back and not even an apology was given. There was a very prominent attitude from beginning to end. Whatever he HAD to bring to the table was dropped without talking to us and walked away, but we had to ask for bread and the correct sides/dressings for our meals. We paid with two different cards, and I explained how we&#39;d like to break up the check. He did not pay attention because he was telling to a nearby server directly over my head as if I wasn&#39;t sitting there, that now he feels alive because he is finally phased. As he started processing the cards he yells back to our table &#34;how did you want this?&#34;. I was beyond pissed off at this point, we just wanted to leave ASAP.<br><br>I honestly have never had such a disappointing experience with The Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s a family favorite, but will more than likely not be returning to the downtown Denver location.

Worst experience ever. We got there a little over an hour before closing took forever to seat us because tables weren&#39;t cleaned. Then they didn&#39;t serve us bread and once we got our food it was truly disgusting. I order a pasta with chicken, garlic, tomato, and mushrooms and my pasta had the garlic shells on it and my onion also has the onion shells. Super disgusting. Then my boyfriend&#39;s chicken Alfredo was super watered down. Had no taste to it at all. We came from Chicago and we always order this in Chicago locations but this time it was disgusting we didn&#39;t finish our food but didn&#39;t say anything because we just wanted to get out of there.

no matter where you are, they always deliver consistent food and quality.  you can order from downtown location and expect to be presented exactly the same as ones in honolulu.  <br><br>parking was free on sundays so that was added benefit.  sever was doing his best and food was good too.

I debated about posting this, but the more I talked to other Yelpers about it, I decided I need to. A few weeks ago, we sat at the bar just to order dessert and watch the end of a football game. I only ate half of my slice of cake and was looking up at the TV when I saw something moving out of the corner of my eye. I looked down to find a roach running around on my plate. I immediately grabbed my phone to document and the bright flash in the dark space caught the bartender&#39;s attention. I told her there is a roach on the plate and she immediately took it. When she came back she simply said &#34;I didn&#39;t see a roach.&#34; Well, here is the video of the roach crawling on my plate on September 7th.

Arrived at about 1130 and had a short 10 minute wait to be seated.  Taken all the way to the back and seated along with 2 other groups at the same exact time.  Not sure why they insist on doing that when they could wait 5 minutes between groups to give the staff time to get a drink order from each.  I can&#39;t be upset at our server as we were one of her first three tables and she was immediately overwhelmed.<br><br>Sunday Brunch, Brûlée French Toast and a side of extra crispy bacon. The French Toast is a large helping with a couple of strawberries on top and the side of sweet brûlée to pour over the toast.  The bread was slightly crispy on one side where it had been on the griddle but was cooked throughout for the size of the pieces used.  Overall it had good flavor and was plenty for one person to consume.<br><br>On the down side, I&#39;ve gone to a number of CCF in the past and the overall experience I had with my party on this day was much like all the others.  Pretty sub par.  I will probably just stop going to the Cheesecake Factory as a whole due in part to the combined poor experiences I&#39;ve had over the many years.
This is the worst Cheesecake Factory I have ever been to. The service absolutely sucks. Do yourself a favor and don&#39;t come here.
I got the 2 eggs with breakfast potatoes and bacon, not bad! But their chocolate hazelnut crunch cheesecake was SENSATIONAL.

Ive never sat down in here and ate the food. I always come in hit the Cheesecake display order a slice or two and go home. <br><br>Ive never been disappointed. And they always have a sample tray out. This time was the Pumpkin Cheesecake. Delicious. <br>I grabbed my Keylime Cheesecake with whipped creme and headed home. <br>Friendly employees quickly taking to go orders for Cheesecake and Actual Food. Who knew their was such a thing. <br>And when i devoured the Cheesecake at home it was delicious. And the fork they put it was a plus, meaning I didnt have to dirty my own silverware.
As  expected, just ok. I don&#39;t feel any newness in chain restaurants.

Service was excellent,  friendly.. kept checking on us and refilled water as needed.  The Chinese chicken salad was flavorful as usual.  Tried the sweet corn tamale cakes, my new favorite.  Sweetcorn bread covered with green chili sauce, tomatoes and sour cream, with a perky Chipotle sauce.  Yum, you&#39;ve got to try them.

Standard! Huge menu but just another CF. it was busy and my kid was starving so we ordered his chicken strips right when we sat down but they were not delivered until when all the main courses came out.

The cheesecake is very tasty and very sweet. The service was slow and the wait staff was visibly rushed but at least everything was clean. This is a good sport for desert but I would t make it a regular dinner place.
Bloody ass steak might as well been for a goddam dog shit was bloody asf I almost threw up the steak was have fat like goddam, expensive asf for shitty ass food

It was not that factory besides the long wait the food you could tell had been sitting under a heat lamp for a long time since it was so dry..my husband had the filet mignon asked for it mid-rare it came so charred and over cooked. was very disappointing trying to have it for the first time won&#39;t plan on coming back to this location at least:(

If there could be negative stars, that&#39;s would I would give this Cheesecake Factory. Worst restaurant experience of my entire life, hands down.  Had a hungry group of 10 teenage girls and 3 adults. Had to wait 1.5 hours. The adults decided to get cocktails. Took 30 mins to pour wine. Then it took another 1.5 hours to get our meals once we finally sat down and ordered. One persons&#39; meal was under-cooked. We had to send it back. We all orders cheesecakes when we orders our food, then were told, while we were finally eating, that they were out of virtually all of the cheesecakes we orders. They had us change our order to the few flavors they had left. Then came back again and said they were also out of most of those. You&#39;ve got to be kidding me. Isn&#39;t this the Cheesecake FACTORY? I gave up. Told them to cancel my Cheesecake order. All told, took us about 3.5 hours to wait and eat very sub-par food.

I went to Cheesecake this weekend with the intention of taking my boyfriend and close friend to a nice dinner and I was incredibly disappointed with the service. To begin, i asked the hostess about bar seating since it was a long wait and she told me it was open seating as well as the tall top tables in the center. I confirmed that we could sit at a open tall top because it was cleaned off and with a horrible attitude she repeated herself then walked away from me. I understand it is open seating I am not stupid, I just wanted to make sure that table was available I did not deserve to be talked down to as she did to me, she should have given me a yes or no answer. We were then tossed between two different servers throughout the coarse of our meal and everything was lost in translation between the two of them. The waitress informed us that they did not have the meal my boyfriend ordered however, she waited half an hour after us ordering to tell us that. Almost an hour later our food finally arrived and the other waiter, Kameron, did not bring my friends food but instead asked him what he ordered then told him somebody else took it sorry. He offered to compensate him with a salad while he waited another half an hour to get a new meal. Amazing, a free $2 salad for a missing $25 meal. My friend told him he didn&#39;t want the food because he was very upset and did not want to wait even longer. The waiter ended up still charging my friend for his beer and did not even offer genuine condolences on ruining the evening for us. The waiter also never offered water refills, we had to flag him down for more water at the end of our meals when we could finally find him. Side note- their drink menus do not have pricing so do not be surprised when you get charged $11 for a half a cups worth of a margarita. I used to really enjoy the Cheesecake Factory and now it seems as though they are more focused on packing their restaurant in as much as possible to make themselves more money than they are on appropriately serving their customers.

I give this place zero star they are prejudice if u ain&#39;t white don&#39;t go there it take us 30 min to get a drink but the white people came after us got there drink and appetizer guess wat the manager claim he watch this table from now on then we got more drink take them ten min to get straw then I ask bout our wine he say oh I forgot then I got mad I say I ain&#39;t tipping but we still tip guess wat the dick head prejudice white guy say in front of the manger I don&#39;t need yur tip threw it on the floor in front of the manger didn&#39;t say anything so if ya ain&#39;t white don&#39;t go there period I was force to put one star up<br>Wat kind of franchise wat let them act the way they did guess that manger is prejudice too just like I said if ya ain&#39;t white don&#39;t go there<br>Beronica u are right cause we not white white<br>Yea u gotta be like trump white to get service there

Best take out. Have you ever bought a hamburger n fries takeout. Got home and it&#39;s all soggy? Not here my friend.  Got some slidders at the cheesecake factory all of the condiments were separate, the fries were in a separate bag and they even thru in two types of their yummy bread with butter (also wrapped separately). What&#39;s the big deal you ask? I hate soggy bread.  Sandwiches that feel like &#34;takeout&#34;. Limpy fries!! No can do my friend.  Not here. Best takeout ever!

One of the worst experiences we&#39;ve had recently!  Busy, the wait wasn&#39;t long though.<br>Server came brought drinks.  Came back for our order and that&#39;s when things went downhill at warp speed.<br><br>Botched my daughters order completely and brought exactly what we did not order. Then they tried to fix it, and brought the same wrong order a second time! <br><br>I ordered a quesadilla and the first thing he asked was, do you want chicken in that. I responded yes because that&#39;s that only way I ever eat them. He said &#34;great, I&#39;ll get the order&#39;s put in.  Well you can probably guess all I got was a sticky cheese quesadilla. I showed him they error and he says, Oh, you DID want chicken in that??  Yeah, I&#39;m pretty sure I was speaking English when I said that and you confirmed what I said.<br>Later 2 employees scrambling to fix my daughter&#39;s order and they leave in a rush. At no time did either them, or anyone for that matter ask if we needed our drinks refilled.<br><br>The service was just sad and disappointing all around. Prices are over-inflated, and on top of all that I&#39;m pretty sure it was the shrimp that were likely undercooked that made me a bit ill last night.<br><br>No way we return to this place.  No way.

Amazing food, service and atmosphere. The patio is the best place to enjoy your meal, while people watching 16th street.<br><br>I would give it a 5 star but the drinks are insanely overpriced which put a wrench in the evening.

I cant get enough of the cheescake factory, i always order my favorite &#34; di vinci pasta&#34; and no matter how packed it is service is pretty quick and even if it gets a little slow they always make up for it with a smile. I recently came in and after dinner ordered my cheesecake to go but when i got home i realized that the slice given to me was really small compared to the usual, so i contacted management letting them know that i was dissatisfied and they didn&#39;t disappoint me, i received a letter in the mail with a gift card! Awesome management and customer care. No wonder i visit it in every country i find it in!

Went last night and had an awful experience. While waiting for our food which took forever the waitress dropped Ranch dressing all over the side of my leg. I barely got an &#34;I am sorry&#34;. The meal finally arrives with exception of two of our entree&#39;s. The missing meals took 15 -20 mins. No apologies, just hear ya go! All in all just a crap experience. Won&#39;t be back ever!

I came with a large 20+ group and we still had great service and they were very accommodating! Good food, in a reasonable time, and Debbie was fantastic! <br>She was so understanding, kind, and fun to be around!
Baja tacos were tasty! Daughter enjoyed the cheeseburger spring rolls with ketchup Had a very nice waiter. Had no room for cheesecake...bummer!
Great place for large groups downtown. Plus I also like stopping in for just dessert. Large portions and great cocktail menu!

Every part of me wants to give this place a higher rating but overall this place is average food at best.<br><br>However this is the &#34;cheesecake factory&#34; and their cheesecake is amazing!! Over the years I&#39;ve had the fortune of trying over half of their flavors and let me just say every single one is a slice of heaven (Especially the Peppermint bark) if you love sweets, this is the place for you!<br><br>Sadly the life changing cheesecake simply cannot make up for the service and food. I&#39;ve been here numerous times and (other than dessert) have left disappointed every single time. The staff is one of the most unorganized groups I&#39;ve ever seen, the moment they become somewhat busy they turn into a group of chickens with their heads cut off...<br><br>Additionally the food is very bland and does not offer anything that stands apart from a red robin, olive garden or Applebee&#39;s. Every dish is very simplistic and could honestly be made at home. <br><br>Overall I highly recommend coming here for dessert only!
would def. come back here to eat. Great staff great service and food :0)

Try the Mac Cheese Balls . Outstanding. I also had the fish tacos. Very tasty. <br> The only con is:The price for Alcohol drinks are a touch high.<br> <br>All in all. I have never been disappointed with the Factory. Food is always good. Plan on some time looking over the menu unless you already know what you want.   Lots to chose from.<br>And as always the service is very good.
Amazing chain resto. I&#39;ve been to the one at Redondo Beach for dinner and Breakfast Brunch here as well as lunch and dinner. Great food and service and their mimosas... Yum! Great for brunch!
Never like this place. I don&#39;t like the food n expensive. I would rather go somewhere else. My friends like coming to Cheesecake Factory I don&#39;t know y.

Things were just &#34;off&#34; at the Factory this evening; and I believe it was the management.  The place seemed amply staffed, and the place wasn&#39;t full - yet it took a awhile to be seated.  Our appetizer (Thai Lettuce Wraps) took so long that our entree came first.  The waiter was adorable, polite &amp; efficient: doing the best he could with an &#34;out of sync&#34; kitchen.   Drinks (Ultimate Margs) were heavy on the sour mix.  $12:50 ec    Chocolate Cake - (reason we came) was awesome.  The food is good , even great.  The flow of Things this evening were -- mis managed.
Great food and cheesecake. Good service and knowledgeable staff. <br>Will recommend to all of my family and friends. <br>Validate parking but you still have to pay 1.00. ?<br>Overall, good.

Just ordered takeout from this location while traveling to Denver.  We ordered a few dishes for takeout (7 of us) but they forgot to put sauce on the TWO chicken masala dishes and only gave us two spoons!  I mean how does that happen?  It was just very plain bow tie noodles with some seasoned chicken.....We had this dish at many other cheesecake factories in other cities and know exactly how it should be made and taste.  This particular location was not good at all and definitely do not recommend.  We will not be returning customers.  Very dissappointed!

One star for today  unfortunately <br>Yes we all have busy days but not just wait almost 2 hours for order but food  was cold and pasta .,spaghetti and kids macaroni wasn&#39;t even cooked ,so disappointed

So I went to the Cheesecake Factory for the first time this past Saturday night.  Food was pricey but good. (I don&#39;t eat out much).  I was irritated that drink prices aren&#39;t listed but apparently that is common also.  What I am a bit upset about is we decided we might take home a dessert for later.  I asked if the carrot cake had nuts in it.  The waiter was unsure and said he would check.  He came back and told me that there were no nuts in the cake but the outside edge of the frosting had nuts.  I repeated the info about the nuts being only on the outside of the frosting and not actually in the cake.  He said, &#34;Yes&#34;.  So I decided to purchase the cake to take home for later and I would cut off the frosting with the nuts.  The cake is FILLED with nuts!  I would not have spent $8 for a slice of cake if I had known there were nuts in it.  Luckily, I am not allergic.  I just really don&#39;t like walnuts.  I did not check the cake before leaving and didn&#39;t go to eat it until today.  Irritated and upset I spent $8 on a piece of cake that I won&#39;t like.

When I got my food, I thought to myself. &#34;What did I do to offend the staff here?&#34; Person next to me sliders are beautifully presented on a wood board. Mine are thrown on a plate and suspiciously soggy. Like I said. What did I do?

So we had the crab cakes and the artichoke.....DELICIOUS! Then we each ordered different cheesecakes.......................I imagine eating sweetened MUD might be the same. Heavy, paste like, not-very-good-tasting, stick to the roof of your mouth.........<br><br>Cheesecake is part of their name and the signature dish should be MUCH better. Maybe they should call the place the Crab Cake Factory.

First time at this location. As always, great food and great location! I had the lettuce chicken wraps which are always amazing! Great service l! The Long Island Ice tea was over priced and really ok, not great. Disappointed with the drink. Overall, very good food.

A coworker and I were taking a customer out to lunch and they suggested the Cheesecake Factory.  The service was prompt and attentive and everyone enjoyed the food.  For a quick business lunch this was ideal as its on the same city block.

I&#39;ve been here twice and will continue to return when I visit Denver. I&#39;m not sure if all CCF are the same but this one knocks the ball out of the park. It&#39;s not just the cheesecake that makes this place special, the entrees are superb. The menu is so large that there is something for anyone. It can be a little pricey but they offer plenty of inexpensive choices, also.

Came late one night just for dessert and were seated in a roomy booth and had an attentive server who offered to make a fresh pot of decaf when I ordered coffee.  As expected, dessert portion was huge and after our fill, had the remainder packed to-go.<br>I&#39;m not a huge fan of chains, let alone visit CF often, yet the experience was what I expected.  The bathrooms we&#39;re clean and offered hand lotion, which is fancy!

Slow service and extremely rude long haired blonde waitress who used two ponytails in her hair brought another round of drinks after we declined another. She was uncomfortably rude to my colleague who accidentally spilled her water. Our party was barely checked on through the whole night. Will not be returning.

So I tried the Denver location and they SUCK! I had a reservation and still waited for an hour for a table. Then we waited for an hour and a half for our food. We never got a refill. We also ordered appetizers that came with our meal. <br>We told the manager about our expiprernece and he said, &#34;sorry.&#34; After a $500 tab for my family.... And it was special occasion.... &#34;Sorry.&#34; Considering we watched people at tables around us be served and come and go..... He really should have done more than saying, &#34;sorry.&#34;  My take away, the Cheesecake Factory is SORRY. I will NEVER go back. They are nothing what they used to be- they are a high priced Chilies.

I&#39;m giving it a good review because it deserves it. Out of towners really enjoy going there and so we take them and everyone is always pleased with their food. Not sure why people hate on this chain so much.

While most of you know I not the biggest chain restaurant fan, I find the Cheesecake Factory to be A-ok. Here&#39;s why:<br><br>1. The service is always friendly and my water is always filled.<br>2. The prices are decent for what they offer and the food is always good :) [minus my cold salmon on my salad....psshhh]<br>3. Location is perfect...right across the street from the office!<br><br>HOWEVER....<br><br>1. Their menu is so extensive that it makes it hard to choose one thing. i found myself overwhelmed with page after page of food, drinks, apps, desserts and the like. oye!<br><br>Overall, this place is just fine for what it is :)

TL;DR - Don&#39;t order Cheesecake Factory off of Postmates.<br><br>Let me preface this review by saying we ordered from Postmates, and having worked in the food industry for several years, I&#39;m well aware that you can&#39;t judge food from delivery, as you&#39;re removing it from it&#39;s natural environment. However, I&#39;ve had both positive experiences with Postmates *and* other Cheesecake Factory locations in the past, and my last experience was not something that left my girlfriend and I wanting to return. <br><br>We ordered the Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo, a classic dish that so many people have grown to love. Being a former chef and having made this regularly, I reached peak lazy when we resorted to ordering from Postmates at 10pm on a Saturday night. (our first mistake? As I could have whipped up an amazing concoction if I had the materials necessary)... But that&#39;s beside the point. Anyway, the first thing we noticed about this dish was that it was not typical of a Cheesecake Factory portion. Normally when I go to Cheesecake, I can leave with more than enough food for two people. Not this time. The next thing we noticed was that our pasta showed up cold. Like really cold. This is one thing I can forgive, as I made the decision to order delivery. However, the chicken was stale, the noodles were barely cooked, and the sauce was non-existent. This pasta, as a born-and-bred Italian, made me want to give up pasta forever and become a leaf-eating vegan.<br><br>Because I know that this stuff *happens*, I&#39;m going to give Cheesecake another chance to wow me. Whether that&#39;s in a year, or 2 weeks, who knows... But I&#39;ll surely update the review then.

Living downtown the past 4 years, and enjoy CF&#39;s food so much that I have a hand full of favorite dishes I go to as my comfort food. On average I eat at the 16th street mall location 2 to 4 times a month. The question here is why I like the food so much but am only giving 2 stars. REASON....... The bar staff<br>     Many instances, at the bar my drink will go empty, empty as in I quit eating my food for 15 minutes. During those 15 minutes the bartender will pic a few favorites to keep there drinks full. One bartender went the distance to ask if I needed a takeout box after a few fork servings of food.The person next to me will be asked over and over again if the need a refill. Not me. Maybe its because I am a amputee in a mobility scooter. Shall i feel degraded, NO, shall I feel disrespected maybe. Maybe I should feel nothing at all because If I was wait staff, I probably would not be able to afford eating there but maybe a few times a year.

Food is decent depending on what you order, any chicken option should come to your table on time, every other time I&#39;ve ordered anything other then chicken (flatbread, burger, red meat, fish) it&#39;s taken longer then an hour and a half. Only reason I&#39;m giving two stars is because the chef behind cheesecake has good recipes and seasonings. Most of the food I&#39;ve gotten here is not bad but drenched in things. The manager is very rude, rushes around not caring about anyone in his pathways as well as yells as employees instead of taking them to the side or back room... (very unprofessional and not something anyone would want to see from the manger). The floors are very slippery as well, surprised they haven&#39;t had anyone fall. After evaluations I have to give this place a one star review.
Came out for dessert tonight ....but this place is always so busy.    which is good.   the food is good.   so we had to get are cheesecake to go but so worth it

The cheese cake factory is very overrated. Ive been to this location and feel like the best thing is the dessert. Ive had the food. The spaghetti is always good and mac n cheese, potatoes au gratian delicous. But ive had better chicken and steak. The last time I attended my chicken was unseasoned and very dry that I had to ask for a side of pasta sauce. I had potatoe skins and mac n cheese which were delicious. I also had a steak with mushroom that was a bit over cooked and needed the mushroom sauce...i am of sauces but you cant tell me that the best place to get a burger would be at a sushi bar? Over all i love the Banana and peanutbutter cheese cake. Delicious.
Busy place, and I know why; great food! The atmosphere is visually pleasing, but louder than I prefer. The service is friendly but a bit slow. The food, however, is excellent!

I came here today for brunch with my family. I&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake Factory many times before, but that was before I started Yelping.<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is normal sooo crowded because of the good food, but luckily we beat the rush. There was a marathon going on downtown so we were scared it was going to be pack, but it was surprisingly not.<br><br>Our server was nice, not bad not great. She checked on us during the meal which was nice. <br><br>I love the Cheesecake Factory because they bring out bread and butter before the meal. Very good, very fancy. The prices here are a little high, but there are added amenities with that extra cost. The bathrooms were very clean, and so was the restaurant. <br><br>I got the brunch combo to eat, which was two eggs, bacon, and two buttermilk pancakes. I also ordered a side of breakfast potatoes with that. It was so good. The Cheesecake Factory has never disappointed me with the food. It&#39;s always brought out the way you ordered it, and in a timely manner. <br><br>Before you go, make sure you&#39;re ready to wait to be seated if you&#39;re planning on going during any rushes. This place can get packed!<br><br>Excellent place to eat. I will be back!

Outdoor seating is nice as long as you don&#39;t have drunk people walking by on a Friday or Saturday night.<br><br>Indoors it&#39;s super crowded and loud. They should get some sound padding for the walls. I just wasn&#39;t impressed by this location.

Visiting from California we chose to eat at The Cheesecake Factory as the food is typically good at the one near our home. This restaurant was awful. Food took forever to come out, the order was wrong, some food was cold, and one rice dish was stale. Our waitress had a pretty apathetic attitude but I guess she&#39;s used to it based on these reviews. I don&#39;t know why the corporate office is tolerating this. We asked for a manager but she couldn&#39;t find one.

Original review 10/20/17 <br>I have to say that it was the worst experience I have ever had at any restaurant.  I ordered a MEDIUM RARE steak and actually saw it sit under a heat lamp for over 30 minutes... Can you imagine the shoe leather steak they tried to serve me?  After a 45 minute wait my wife and I told the Manager to send the steak back to the cook and let HIM EAT IT!  We will NEVER RETURN!<br><br>UPDATE.... If I could give a NEGATIVE 5 STARS... I would!  This is a followup to my previous post regarding the Medium RARE steak that sat under the heat lamp for 30 minutes and served to me looking like shoe leather.  Well today I got the most pathetic apology letter with absolutely NO RESOLUTION AT ALL!  They didn&#39;t offer jack &#34;S&#34; to try to keep me as a customer!  My wife and I have eaten there on many occasions, as we both work downtown Denver.  It will be a cold day in hell before we go back..... Carrie S. is a poor excuse for a manager, lacking in customer service and support to say the least!  Do yourself a favor and go to ANY other restaurant.  Either The Thirsty Lion or Maggiano&#39;s would be a far better choice!
The breakfast here is a must stay away. The food is very bland and boring. It&#39;s called the cheese cake factory for a reason!

We went here after a Rockies game for dinner with my daughter.   The service was sub par but the food was good.   We got there early and the gigantic restaurant was only partially full.   Our server dropped off waters and disappeared meanwhile I watched several employees huddled in the back hanging out which was no bueno since our server didn&#39;t come back with their customary basket of bread.   I did see a few baskets being delivered to other tables so I was disappointed when our server finally returned and snapped at me when I asked about our bread.  She told me that they were out and that she had been checking.  She then took our ordered and recommended the Mac and Cheese burger which did not disappoint.   I had a small Caesar salad with my burger and it was outstanding.   Th burger was very cheesy and filling.    We then got a piece of cheesecake to take back to our hotel and we were out of there.    The good was great as always but the service was not very good.

Love coming back here!<br>I haven&#39;t been here in ages but every time I do come back the food is always amazing. I had the macaroni and cheeseburger just because I was like ?? How would that work and it was really good. It&#39;s pretty massive- I only ate half of it, and I had the dulce de leche caramel cheesecake. Yum!

Racist as hell, i was told there were no seats to dine alone and i had to eat in the bar, due to my drinking problems i perfer to sy away from the liquor. So i sit down and i watch people who sat down five minuts after i got there get served right away wile . Its Tuesdays at 4pm pretty empty. Thanks racist mexican girl at counter.

When it comes to food (not desert), the cheesecake factory rates as a simple three. However with the 16th St. view and people watching it gets a one star bump. Recommended to all who pass looking for a nice place to sit and watch people.

I generally give good reviews. Hard here. Food came out not together 10 mins apart a plate. My steak medallions came out last and ice cold. Manager was nice and compd my dessert. I dont send food back. Desserts came with no forks but check immediately dumped with them. It was sort of a mess

Love the Cheesecake Factory!<br><br>I absolutely love the avocado egg rolls, but ended up having them as my meal. The don&#39;t offer a smaller portion, so to pay $10.95 and then another $10.95 for a salad seemed a little excessive for lunch.<br><br>Had the Reeces Peanut Butter Cup Chocolate Cake Cheesecake and it was amazing.<br><br>Service was good. Atmosphere is good.

So the food I had was pretty good, Thai coconut Lime chicken... minus the fact that they garnished it with spicy hot peppers and do not have a warning about this what so ever on their menu, this was not even a listed ingredient. So yeah, had an unpleasant surprise that made me choke on my food. Once removing the garnish the food was pretty good. Service was fast and friendly.

People always talk about how HUGE the entrees are at The Cheesecake Factory... However, if that&#39;s the case, then WHY did I have to order 2 entrees?!?!?!?!?!?! Either I need to enter into a food eating competition ASAP, or The Cheesecake Factory is stingy when it comes to serving up HEALTHY GRUB!<br><br>I ordered the Tuna Tataki Salad (seared tuna with leafy greens and a sliced tomato) along with a side of grilled asparagus and a side of olive oil dressed green beans. The dish was delicious but, it definitely felt like an appetizer portion. <br><br>My dining companion ordered the Shrimp Scampi and the Steak Diane. She was served a MASSIVE dish that was mostly filled with EVIL MASHED POTATOES (a low-carbers nightmare, not that she is a low carb eater or anything)... And a sprig of basil. She was HOPING there would be far more greens on her plate, but nope, the soupy potatoes were the vegetable of choice. She proceeded to not finish the potatoes and instead ordered a side salad. <br><br>As for me, I wolfed down my tuna in literally a minute and proceeded to complain that I was still HUNGRY. I have a wolf in my stomach eating the food I ingest... I swear. So I discussed with the waitress how I might be able to get some salmon with more green beans. She was nice and tried to figure out the most cost effective way for me to fill my trap and it worked! I got the grilled salmon and green beans, just the way I wanted. <br><br>Of course... I was STILL hungry, but I am just a freak so I decided to slap my baby wolf and asked for the check when I was done eating. <br><br>I always remember the Cheesecake Factory being absolutely delicious. It was good but it wasn&#39;t &#34;run around pants-less through the restaurant screaming how much I love the place&#34; good. I don&#39;t think I will be going back. There are far tastier places on the 16th Street Mall. Sorry CF... I don&#39;t think you&#39;ll miss me though, there were millions of people in there shoving their faces with your gluttonous meals!

Servers were very friendly. I had the pork chop w/Apple sauce. Meat was cooked and seasoned well. But was quite fatty. Mash was great as was the Apple. Price was a bit pricey for what type of place it was but nothing too crazy. Lastly the Red Velvet Cheese cake was amazing.

WTF is up with all the ads in the menu? TACKY.<br><br>We were undecided between Cheesecake Factory and Maggianos downtown.  I&#39;d never been to the Cheesecake Factory so we chose here, however we probably won&#39;t ever be back.  <br><br>We almost left after being bombarded with ads in our menu and given plastic cups with no straws to drink out of - if you&#39;re going to go for that, go for it and charge less for the food.  I asked for a glass to drink out of and they did bring me one.  <br><br>The reason it gets 3 stars is because the food was alright.  I ordered the Tuscan chicken off the &#34;Skinny&#34; menu.  I was relieved &#34;skinny&#34; meant low refined carbs not small portions since it was about $17.  It was a very acidic dish with balsamic vinegar and lots of cherry tomatoes, but I thought it was very tasty.

So I&#39;m a big fan of CFs and have been to quite a few all over the US.<br><br>This one doesn&#39;t pass muster. <br><br>Arrived at five, was quoted 30 minute wait. No problem, we expected that. This restaurant is smaller than the CFs I&#39;ve been to and it&#39;s especially crowded up front by the hostess stand. Waited outside in the street and was buzzed back at around 5:40. Fair enough. Then was told to form another line where we waited another thirty minutes while harried employees struggled to get organized and seat us.<br><br>Seriously. Thirty more minutes. We soon realized that there was no rhyme or reason to when people were being seated and noticed that people who approached the desk were seated next. We did the same and the hostess just shrugged, grabbed menus and took us to our table. Wtf. <br><br>Service was spotty. Yes, it was busy, but all CFs are, and the well managed locations still provide excellent service. <br><br>Food was good. <br><br>Disappointing experience. Never again.

I have been a long-time customer at the cheesecake factory for over 20 years, and visited this particular restaurant over 100 times and this was the worst service and most disrespectful service I have ever received! We went in the afternoon with a handicap individual and ask for a booth to accommodate her that is easiest to get in and out, less pain for her and the hostess said that was only one booth in the entire restaurant we could sit at or its going to be over a 45 minute wait for our small party of three even though when you looked around there must have been only 20 customers in the entire restaurant itself, obviously they&#39;re short on staff and the hostess said most of the sections were closed..They gave us a table that was completely circular very difficult for the handicapped individual to get in, and the hostess did not care nor the waiter when I asked them about the poor table  accommodations. Already not getting typical cheesecake factory service we sat down 10 minutes later bread came out and the waiter and then another 10 minutes past before the drinks arrived at 20 minutes after sitting down I am astonished because there were hardly any other guests in the restaurant! When the bread arrived it was not properly wrapped in a cloth napkin for some reason it look like they were disposable and napkins set on top of the metal with the bread touching the basket everywhere pictures are displayed to show this disgustingness lack of sanitary conditions for the bread. The waiter was very rude would not explain anything on the menu and only came to the table twice in the hour and a half we were there and he also clocked out of his shift before our table was gone we asked for help and they said he already went home for the day I cannot believe to be so disrespectful to your table while leaving them and also being rude to them while rolling his eyes at our table when we were asking questions. Our table wanted to talk while we ate that is why we came in early knowing that there would not be a lot of people unfortunately we could not talk or catch up because the table was never cleared it, it was disgusting there was a sauce on the table even and the waiter came by and said oh my and walked away never cleaning it pictures are displayed also how awful the table locked at this not clean Cheesecake factory standards. I was embarrassed that I took my guests to this establishment and I will be letting everybody know how bad the service has declined at this location!

We had the worst experience ever. After waiting an hour to be seated we waited for another hour and a half to get our food. There was another large party next to us and they received all of their food before us and they were seated after us. A lot of what we wanted to order was not available. We ordered cheesecake and that took another 20 minutes and then they didn&#39;t even have the cheesecake we wanted. We were waiting for our money back and that took so long that we just left without our cheesecake and money. Will not be coming back.

Cheesecake Factory is always a &#34;fail-safe&#34; place. We know the food will be good, and that we will have a lot to choose from. Honestly, I wish they would scale down their menu a bit, as it does get to be overwhelming, especially if you like a wide variety of foods. For dinner at this location, we were told that our party of two would have a 40-minute wait, so I ordered some peach Bellinis from the bar. Our 40-minute wait was no more than 15 minutes. We did not order appetizers, but went straight to the main meal. My Shepherd&#39;s Pie was delicious - big pieces of meat and carrots, lots of mashed potatoes, and a great thyme-mushroom gravy. Loved that gravy. We split a key like cheesecake for dessert - it eats lighter than the calorie count. ;-) I just wish our waiter had been more attentive. While he paid attention to my husband&#39;s beverage desires, he never asked if I wanted a second Bellini, and failed to notice my empty water glass for quite some time - I had to ask another waiter for a glass. All in all, we will always come back to Cheesecake Factory locations for their desserts, and good food.

Always love the factory.  Haven&#39;t had it in awhile so my husband and I made the 15 min walk from hotel for Sunday brunch. So glad we did and we could walk it off on way back lol.  Took a few cheesecake slices back with us.

This is one of my favorite restaurants to go to with a big group. Although they don&#39;t take reservations, the wait is worth it. We had a table of eight and they sat us in a corner booth that was spacious and comfortable. The service here is great! I love the complimentary bread that comes with the meal. The sourdough is my favorite and they always give you plenty of butter for the bread. I ordered the cuban sandwich and it was amazing! The bread was crispy and buttery, and the ham and pork belly was seasoned well and not too salty. I&#39;m watching my calories, so I asked for no cheese and the mayonnaise on the side. But the sandwich was still really good. I definitely can&#39;t wait to visit again. <br><br>Tip: They have a low calorie menu, so you can order something under 500 calories if you want. :)

It&#39;s cheesecake. You can&#39;t go wrong with cheesecake. The menu is huge, the cheesecake is bomb. Your kids will be happy and so will you. The serving staff is always quick and responsive. Never had a problem with efficiency or order accuracy.
Was going to give this place a 5 star but he didn&#39;t bring us out bread. Other then that service  was good. And food was good for being a chain. Got my self a bbq burger

Love this yummy place! I go once a year and am never disappointed. Staff are excellent and love to help out customers.<br><br>Parking is a hassle, and the lines are long. But hey, it&#39;s downtown at a wonderful restaurant. I recommend this place.

I have been to the downtown Denver Cheesecake Factory twice. First time I ordered a burger Medium Well and it was practically raw. By the time I got it back from kitchen everyone else was done eating and I had to get it to go.  Second time, we stopped by to just order dessert to go.  They don&#39;t take names or ask to see receipts, so they must have given my order to someone else. Twenty minutes of waiting and I realized people who came in after me where picking up orders to go. When I asked about my order they couldn&#39;t find the ticket and staff argued about what happened to it before remaking our order. So frustrating. I never have this issue at other Cheesecake Factory restaurants.
I ordered the Mac and cheese burger to be cooked medium well and it came out raw. I sent it back and did not try to order anything else.

Amazing! Great service, food came WAY fast,  cool food design, I like the gluten free.  My sis loved it too.  Good portion of food.  I ordered spaghetti and meat balls,  gave me a huge bowl. Cheese cake was amazing! Fancy, medium good price. Lots of thanks 2 our waiter.  Thanks Saun!

What a cluster fuck! First time and last.  Came out with a party of 4 never receive my meal. Horrible service. Sorry management. Waste of good time on vacation. Take your family elsewhere! And tried to make me pay a full bill gtfoh. DOUG Was the manager. Bald or shaved head w/guy!
We got to the restaurant at 10:45am for Sunday brunch, and I ordered the French Toast and it was amazing. Great service.

If I had written this review a month ago, they would have gotten a solid four stars. I&#39;ve been coming to Cheesecake Factory for literally decades, and always met my expectations (decent meal, nice atmosphere, fair prices for the portions). Tonight however, I ordered the herb salmon and received a blackened, totally burned fish that was inedible. I apologetically sent it back, and 20 minutes later the manager personally served me completely raw fish. Of course the manager came back, said he was so embarrassed, and we walked away with a free piece of cheesecake and paid a $70 bill even though one person in our party didn&#39;t even eat dinner. Manager looked at the floor when he walked by our table while we finished our wine.. total slap in the face. Never, ever again.
Thoroughly enjoyed our dinner. The wait was much shorter than expected. Our waitress was very kind and attentive. Enjoyed dessert of course!

I had never ate at the Cheesecake Factory before but always heard people ranting and raving about it... Well I finally got to try it and I must say the food is good and the cheesecake is better. But...... Seriously do they need to have a 20 page menu? That thing is way overboard especially for people like my self who already have a hard time trying to make a decision this can cause some problems as it took me about 15 minutes to decide what I wanted to eat. Besides that avocado egg rolls were very good and the red velvet cheesecake is to die for. I also tried the mac and cheese burger which was totally unhealthy but well worth every calorie!

Had dinner here a couple of times but had never written the review. The restaurant itself looks good, servers have quite slow service and response. Food is ok. <br>Here is the real bad thing that happened to me tonight which convinced me to write this such bad experience. After finished my meal, I provided 2 gift cards as I bought from this exact restaurant location at the end of last year to pay for the meal. Ten minutes after I checked, the server came back and informed me that one of the two cards didn&#39;t go through. I showed her that I just checked the gift card balance at their cashier just right before I got seated (I also provide her the paper that I received as an evidence of gift card balance checking which was clearly stated everything they need to know to prove that I really had that amount until the server took my card for check). The server then left my table again (about 10 minutes) and came back with acted manager. The manager told me that after he tried every single way to check my gift card on their computer, it still came out that this gift card cannot be used because it had 0 balance in it. He also asked me (not very polite manner) whether I used it after I had checked the balance at their cashier. Wait!? Is that what the manager of the well-known restaurant should ask their customers? It&#39;s like I knew that I have already used that card and I still used it to pay for the food. Come on! even little child knows what should he do in this situation. The manager still tried to find out if I misunderstood or I lied by trying to check the balance of the gift card online. Absolutely, he couldn&#39;t find anything but the balance was zero. I spend almost 30 minutes at that time to wait for the checked out process and that made me missed the bus to my home. I then tried to figure out by myself that what&#39;s really happen to me. So, the first thing I did is to call the gift card department. The gift card representative informed me that the gift card had been charged for the left amount during the period of time that the server brought my card to check. I let the GC representative talked to the manager. Thank god that he didn&#39;t accuse me whether that was the real cheesecake factory gift card representative. The truth came up that I told the truth even I didn&#39;t know what&#39;s really happen to the charging process, I guess it&#39;s because of their system or human error. I had never experienced this bad service before since the problem came to the manager, his reaction disappointed me a lot. The manager who suppose to have power and knowledge to manage the situation like this professionally but came up doubting his customers. Such an unprofessional habit of the restaurant manager. I could say that I was very angry at that time. I felt like someone slammed their hand on my face because I want to eat for free. Someone might ask &#39;Why don&#39;t you just simply provide another card for them to charge?&#39;. I will just ask them back &#39;Why would I paid more since I had already paid them for the gift card?&#39; Was I impatience enough to give them a chance since they already spend more than 30 minutes of my time fixing the problem?

The cheesecake is good, but pricey.  <br>Our server was very good &amp; attentive.  The food was average, but the price was ok.  The cocktails are over priced and not worth the money.  Even a house bourbon Manhattan was $10.50.  There are better places in downtown Denver that won&#39;t kill your wallet.
This place has the best food and desserts, you have to try the fire cracker bites and their amazing cheescakes

Walked in after a nearby show at about 10:30 for a quick dessert. Proceeded to see two other groups seated ahead of us who definitely arrived after we did. Finally got seated and had excellent service thereafter. Definitely need to work on their late night seating process, as I surmise there are a lot of lucrative dessert &amp; cocktail patrons to be served then.

When I was a teenager, I thought The Cheesecake Factory was the best place ever... now that I&#39;m just a bit (ahem) older, and realize that a 20 page menu isn&#39;t necessarily a plus, I think that it&#39;s A-OK. <br><br>No, the food here doesn&#39;t blow me away. But, they certainly do have something for everyone. They have also taken a good shot at identifying &#34;healthy&#34; dishes (note that at TCF, &#34;healthy&#34; qualifies as under 600 calories). Also, the service here is actually pretty good. <br><br>Finally, the location is great - it&#39;s right on 16th street, so you can eat here and then walk pretty much anywhere you want to go downtown. They also do very well with groups - even did separate checks for our lunch group of 20.

Oh man I&#39;m wading into dangerous waters here. All I can think of is Marilyn Hagerty&#39;s Olive Garden review.<br><br>Look, this place is as corporate as it gets. They are one step away from having cliff divers and a pirate show. That said, if you want a sit down lunch at the Tabor center, and don&#39;t want to leave the building (ahem, SNOW), it&#39;s not the worst option ever. <br><br>The menu, I&#34;m sure you know, is absolutely insane. The few times I&#39;ve been there, I&#39;ve gotten the fried chicken salad. It is fine.<br><br>End of review. (breathes easy)

We tried some of their new special menu items tonight, and they were pretty good.  Party of 2 was seated fairly quickly for a busy Friday night.  Drinks were good, food was good, service was good - and best of all the CHEESECAKE was AMAZING (as always).  I have been to this location a few times on different visits to Denver and have not had a bad experience.

It can be an hour to an hour and a half wait to get seated. The parking validation only lasts 3 hours. This has been frustrating every time we dine at this location. Over 50% of the 3 hour allowed time is waiting for a table. Pease change your parking policy to cover 4 hours durning prime time weekend dinner hours when you wait time is long. Or maybe offer reservations so we don&#39;t have to wait over an hour for a table. <br><br>On a more positive note - The service was exceptional and the manager at this locations was very kind in helping us at our table.  We always love the food!

Today I &#39;ve had best ever cheesecake in my life! It was first time in cf, so I decided to try their classic cheesecake. Classic never gets old! I don&#39;t like too sweet desserts, and that was exactly what I wanted. Another one red velvet cheesecake for my husband was also good, but too sweet and more dry than mine.

AWFUL SERVICE. We had a 9:30 PM reservation and by 10 PM we still had not been seated. They apparently did not account for the party before us staying for dessert- though you&#39;d think if we had a reservation, they would. Then, the service was extremely slow and our waitress was not attentive. Will not be back.

Come to think of it....I think I&#39;ve only ever eaten at the Cheesecake Factory once for their dinner/lunch offerings....the other visits have been strictly for cheesecake.  With a menu this expansive, it&#39;s hard not to find something that appeals to each individual in your group.  Yes it&#39;s a chain establishment but they definitely do their desserts right.....
The only saving grace was the cheesecake and decent service. The food and drinks way too pricey. I&#39;ve been to many Cheesecake Factory&#39;s in my day and this was by far the worst.

Their cheesecake counter is beside their dinning counter (indoor n outdoor). We wanted to enjoy the cheesecaske in the comfort of their place. We be more than willing to pay a fee if needed. Was told to wait 10mins for both indoor n outdoor seats. However we could see lots of empty seats in both areas(indoor/outdoor), really cannot understand why do we need to wait that long for a seat. I believe they do not want cakes customers to take up space for diners who likely will spend more money. While I went to take a call, staff was rude to my wife, was told to take the cake n go. We won&#39;t come back again.

The biggest problem I have with this restaurant is really not even a problem, it&#39;s my problem being indecisive. The menu is SO large and has nearly every type of cuisine you could be craving. It&#39;s a book, so if you don&#39;t like to read, you may have issues. They have a great variety of different types of cuisines and the cheesecake menu is off the chain! Super delicious, mouth watering just thinking about it!

Having serving experience myself, I&#39;m picky when it comes to being the customer.
