I guess it&#39;s a good thing that I generally go out to eat for the food, not the service (which wasn&#39;t phenomenal). I&#39;m a vegetarian, so my food choice is limited and I&#39;m usually skeptical about veggie burgers. There wasn&#39;t a whole lot on the menu that I could eat without sifting through some sort of shrimp or chicken, so I went out on a limb and ordered the veggie burger with a side of sweet potato fries (I mainly came for the dessert, mind you.) <br><br>Fortunately, I was not disappointed. Far from it, in fact. This veggie burger was easily the size of my entire face in circumference and half of my face in width, making for an exceptionally messy meal. But exceptionally delish nonetheless. Best burger EVER. I&#39;ve experienced an actual cow burger back in my day and never favored them, but this will definitely be my &#39;usual&#39; when I go out for some grub. And I&#39;ve never had a usual, I like to change things up, so that&#39;s also saying something.<br><br>Oh yeah, and the Oreo cheesecake was pretty great.

Our server was extremely quick and the food was great. The lunch menu was a bit overpriced for the size. I chose a dinner option instead. Also, for dinner, especially during the holidays l recommend coming here because they make reservations differently. On short notice, this is definitely the place to be because they don&#39;t take reservations over the phone.

This place gets a lot of harsh reviews and I can understand certain peoples points but not others! It&#39;s the cheese cake factory not a top notch restaurant.<br>The service is always great, the foods reasonable and The cocktails are nice.<br><br>It&#39;s a casual place to go get drinks and eat. The food is decent and a lot better than other rival chains.

Usually I like Cheesecake Factory, but it seems like the prices have gone up while quality has gone down. Normally I wouldn&#39;t leave a review this low, but the Alfredo was probably one of the worst things I&#39;ve ever had in my life. Tasted like rubber with cream dumped over it. Lots of better options on 16th

We ate here last night 4/8/18.  We sat at one of the Hi-Tops in the bar area.<br>We placed our order for drinks and an appetizer.  When the appetizer came we had to ask for napkins and silverware.  We then placed our dinner order.  I ordered the Bistro Shrimp Pasta.  There was very little , if any, sauce.  That is not the way to cut food costs.  I guess if you are trying to get people to order more drinks that would be the way to do it.  Make the food so dry they need liquids to choke it down.  I also ordered a dinner salad, but never received it.<br>We ordered cheesecake to go and all the pieces looked so much smaller that the ones they actually serve in the restaurant.  Not only that but there was very little cheesecake in the Lemon Raspberry Cheesecake.  It was mainly the lady fingers and the mousse.  <br>If I am going to spend $75 on a meal for myself, I expect better.  Now I know why it has been awhile since we have eaten there.

Apparantly these folks are tired of getting thrown under the bus for their lack of healthy options, because there is a new &#34;Skinny Taste&#34; menu out with quite a few options under a few hundered calories.  And the portions are still quite sizable!  (My friend ordered a chicken meal that she took half home)  Also, if ordering from this menu, the servers are not to bring bread to the table, so that should help with watching caloric and fat intake.<br><br>I love their food (something for everyone), love the cheesecake (though it&#39;s much better to share a piece without whipped cream if you&#39;re trying to be relatively good), and service is pretty consistant.  <br><br>Also, if ordering off the regular menu, realize that you don&#39;t have to finish it all in one sitting.  You&#39;re likely an adult who should know when to stop eating and can make a $15 meal last for three... just sayin&#39;...
Poor service=No Tip<br>If a server doesn&#39;t like their job they shouldn&#39;t have to make the customers experience crappy.

We took family from out of town out for dinner.  We were told an hour wait.  Our buzzer went off at 30 minutes. When we took it to the hostesses, they took it but didn&#39;t seat us.  When we inquired about the wait, they said it wasn&#39;t our turn.  No apologies, no explanation.  We had to beg for another buzzer.<br><br>Then, while waiting in the waiting area, the manager announced people could go sit at tables around the bar because it was too crowded, so my mother in law went to sit and was told by the waitress she couldn&#39;t sit there.<br><br>They were out of the food I ordered but my replacement meal was delicious.  The saving grace was our excellent and attentive server.<br><br>I&#39;d be hesitant to go back again.

Ordered their veggie panini... bread came out burnt to a crisp. Was surprised it even came out of the kitchen. And they never placed my friends order. They removed my plate and we sat there while our party ate. Her plate came out before mine and they comped her meal but not mine... wasn&#39;t sure how the circumstances were any different but that&#39;s okay. Really nice waitresses just some issues with the kitchen.

This restaurant is a classic example of horrible bang for your buck. Our server misled us several times about the price of our drinks when we specifically asked about the exact cost. Instead of checking like we asked (multiple times), she estimated the cost to be several dollars cheaper than the real price, which added up to be much more expensive than we thought. Our food came out late and we didn&#39;t get any bread until after our main entree came out (not to mention their food is terrible, also at ridiculous prices). Lastly, the coffee we ordered (also more expensive than we had SPECIFICALLY asked) was so watered down it looked and tasted like bad tea. And the cheesecake was partially frozen. It wouldn&#39;t have been such a bad experience because we already knew to expect shit food, except that our server deceitfully told us incorrect prices numerous times when we asked for the cost of unlisted items on their menu. They are obviously purposely trying to deceive customers to spend more money. Literally the only saving grace, and the only reason we came in the first place, was because we had a gift card. Definitely won&#39;t be back. SAD.

I pig out every time I&#39;m here, my favorite is the environment reminds me of Atlantis.<br><br>Overall awesome service been twice with a party and have been treated like royalty. They really know how to please a party. I would like to make a small complaint too long of a wait for the ticket, it&#39;s like they expect us to order more and more. Cheesecake is too good it&#39;s almost unreal. And the flavor variety uhhhhh it&#39;s VERY STRESSFUL DECIDING hehe

I just wanted to update and say I did get a gift card to make up for the experience, and Shannon Venturo did return my call and promise to review service levels at the restaurant among Eduardo, other waiters and Ben the manager.
My guy and I went here for Prom, and we got very good service and the food as usual was delicious! I love the Cheesecake Factory, we will be back! :)

Clean, excellent customer service, great variety of choices, and great atmosphere! I always line visiting the Cheesecake Factory when I get a chance because the service and food quality is consistent.

Let&#39;s begin by saying that cheesecake is my absolute favorite dessert! I have honestly only eaten the food here a handful of times, but I am a frequent cheesecake patron. I have this tradition where I buy a whole cheesecake from here every year for my birthday and I try to get a different one every time. I love the chocolate cheesecakes, the red velvet cheesecake is to die for, and the Reese&#39;s one is so sweet I can only stomach half a piece of cheesecake at a time. But my absolute favorite cheesecake is the 30th Anniversary Chocolate Cake Cheesecake. It has just enough chocolate brownie cake and equivalent amounts of regular New York style cheesecake. Looking back at the picture of the cake I got last year, my mouth is drooling as I&#39;m typing this. No matter your preferences, there IS a cheesecake for you here; they have so many incredible flavors. Most people hate growing older, but I&#39;m looking forward to it, as long as I&#39;m scarfing some cheesecake while I do it.
So far so good, the cheesecakes are awesome as always. Maybe a little pricey but good

Came here to give myself a nice relaxing birthday dinner. From the minute I sat at the bar, to getting my drink, bread, dinner, and of course, my cheesecake, it all went spectacularly well. The whole meal was amazing. I could not find one thing wrong with anything. Well done, folks.

The service sucked! The waitress always seemed to be inconvienced when I requested anything! This place is definitely not a place for families. Everybody around us was wasted and we could barely have a conversation at our table because of all the drunk bastards in here.  Not coming back! Go to another location if you want Cheesecake Factory.

We go once a year on Nicole&#39;s birthday. The menu is a 57 page monster. If you can&#39;t find something here you want to put in your face, well go outside and chew grass.<br><br>That said, I don&#39;t enjoy the place much myself, not for lack of choices, mainly just because it&#39;s a gigantic chain full of suburbanites. You get downtown from your earth-toned suburb and eat here? Well that&#39;s fine, at least i know where to find you.<br><br>The food is good enough the JW Lemonade is quite tasty and makes being there tolerable as only the best alcohol could.

I have loved the Cheesecake Factory for many years, but this one is poorly run.  I go to the 16th street mall location at least once or twice a week and yesterday was the worst experience of all.  Being that there were plenty of high top open tables at the bar, my boyfriend and I sat at one.  For 10 minutes, while we watched many servers scurry by us, we were not greeted or served.  <br><br>I finally got up and asked the hostess if anyone was serving in that section.  As I made my way back to my table, the manager (a very unpleasant woman who should be fired) attempted to make excuses as to why we were still sitting there unattended.  I asked her if we could move to a table in the restaurant instead of sitting in the bar since the bar service was poor.  She became abrupt as though I was the problem.....not in fact that the problem was that she was short staffed and unable to manage.  <br><br>As I began to follow her back to the hostess station to see if there was another option, she stopped me and told me to sit back down at the bar table and she would check on it.  More time went by, so my boyfriend and I decided to get up and go to the hostess station anyway, even though we had been told to SIT, as though she was barking a command to a dog.  <br><br>She then came around the corner as we were walking and told us there would be a 20 minute wait for a table in the dining room....buy why?  There was no one in the lobby waiting and there were MANY open tables all around.  Enough - we decided to go somewhere else.  <br><br>This woman has no customer service or organizational skills and really should not be managing this restaurant.  CHEESECAKE FACTORY - PLEASE FIND SOMEONE ELSE.  YOUR RESTAURANT IS FAR TOO GOOD TO HAVE SOMEONE LIKE THIS BEING THE FACE TO YOUR CUSTOMERS.

Went there for lunch today with my Dad.  Our server Mikayla was phenomenal! She was knowledgeable and very attentive! Food was delicious and the strawberry lemonade was great!  Hope to have her again during a future visit!

Sitting outside. Haven&#39;t seen my server yet, but another server waited on me without me prompting her. She is very friendly.  Had the farfalle with garlic cream sauce and ordered a piece of cheesecake to go. The pasta was enough for two and had good flavor.

We arrived in Denver and my husband was sick with a sinus infection.  We go to 2 places on 16th street for the beer fest and Broncos Game .  This is one of them.  As he was not feeling well, I called in an order from the on line take out menu.  They had id ready in 15 minutes. He got his usual Tuna Tataki Salad and I got my usual, Pasta with Shrimp.  Both packaged well with sauces separate and spill proof.  They also portioned out one huge slice of cheesecake into two smaller containers as I didn&#39;t want to catch my husband&#39;s cold sharing a dessert with him.<br><br>I have eaten here over a dozen times in the last 2 years and never been disappointed.

Yes this is a chain but I still love it.  Great cheesecake and so many flavor options.  I like my cheesecake to taste like cheesecake  so I am not a fan of some of the crazier ones with a ton of stuff in them.  The chocolate coconut one was too chocolatey for me and not cheesecake-y enough.  The key lime, vanilla bean and dulce de leche are my favorites.  On my last trip I tried the seasonal lemon merengue and it was fantastic.  Love the fresh whipped cream that they top each piece of cheesecake with.  On to the food.  The menu is huge and it is so hard to decide on an entree.  I always seem to order a pasta, I love the chicken bellagio and the chicken madeira is great as well.  If you don&#39;t feel like looking for and then attempting to parallel park your car they offer free parking in the parking garage under the cheesecake factory.  You will get parking ticket and bring it to the front desk and they will validate it for you.  I believe the validation is good for 3 hours.  Expect a wait, especially on the weekends.

I really do like this location with excellent service and great food!  Parking is tough to find downtown, but this is worth the wait.  The price for food is a little steep, but the dessert is outstanding.  Entrees, not bad.  Steak seems to be one thing that they do as well...usually a little underdone.  Still, I would recommend this Cheesecake Factory.

Amazing service . Food was out extremely fast and never needed a refill on my drink , it was always taken care of. Been to other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s but this was by FAR the best. Very happy with the food and the staff here!! Very impressed!!  If your looking for a good place to eat I HIGHLY recommend!
The cheesecakes are pretty huge. Two people can easily suffice on one. However too expensive.

My friends and I were in town for a convention at the Colorado Convention Center. We decided to go to The Cheesecake Factory for dinner one night, and we certainly wished we had chosen elsewhere. We waited about an hour for a table, but there was nowhere for us to wait comfortably. We hung out up against a wall, but continuously had to move out of the way because the staff needed to get through with dirty dishes. Once we were sat, our waiter (Russ) came right over to greet us, so it seemed to get better from then on. Wrong. It took over 15 minutes for our glasses of wine to come to the table after we ordered them. Then, once our food finally came out, two of my friends orders came out wrong. One of my friends asked for a side Caesar salad with her burger. Her burger came out burnt and with a small salad of mixed greens and no dressing. It took about 20 minutes for us to get out waiter&#39;s attention just to bring her some ketchup so she could attempt to eat her burger. My other friend ordered the steak dinner, which is kind of hard to mess up. She is allergic to wheat, and her dinner came out as steak tips cooked with noodles (which it does not say in the menu)? Again, it took 20 minutes just to get out waiter&#39;s attention in order to explain that she could not eat the meal if the noodles were cooked with the steak, in order for him to take it back to the kitchen. He said a new one would be right out. About a half an hour later, when the rest of us were done eating, her replacement meal came out, where we had to ask for it to be boxed because we did not want to stay there anymore. A manager never came over to the table, and they didn&#39;t even take my friend&#39;s meal off of the bill or offer her anything else. I&#39;ve worked in the restaurant business, and I typically give the wait staff the benefit of the doubt, but our waiter never apologized for the mix-up and took forever just to bring us our bill. It&#39;s safe to say, I would not recommend dining here if you are looking for quality service.

The cheesecake factory is great, and I like this location. We came in with our baby and they were very accommodating. Our server was prompt and kind. And our food was delicious. I also like that they have a &#34;skinny&#34; menu with items that have less calories. And this menu is very extensive, especially compared to other restaurants. <br><br>The only thing I wish they had is a vegan cheesecake. Then it would be a five star place.

Yeah what is the appeal for overpriced food and bad service...  Yeah I get it the menu is a book but I don&#39;t know as an answer to many questions is honestly obsurd.<br><br>And I come to find out they have gluten free entrees they can offer....wow.<br><br>grabbed dinner because we ordered a cheesecake for pickup.  THAT was delicious!... hence the three stars<br><br>The meal and service were not.  And the waiter seemed unaccommodating to my gluten questions and honestly not great at his job.  Easy check with apps, salad, drinks, and a desert and he couldn&#39;t get it right.

Dirty dirty dirty!  Not what I expect from the Cheesecake Factory!  The napkins &amp; silverware were filthy - looks like they were washed in chocolate cake &amp; the plates were not cleaned! Food was ok, but not as great as other locations! Not returning here.  I told the manager and he just said thank you for thanking him!

It was not what I expected when I first sat down, tables were a little too close together for a good date night in my opinion, but after that everything was amazing. We were seated almost immediately on a saturday night and we ordered the calamari for an appetizer the portion was huge! Definitely need two people if you plan on eating an entree! The entree portions were also very big! Not too expensive considering you practically get two meals out of it! The chicken marsala with mushrooms were great, very tasty wine sauce. And then came the cheesecake. We had to try it and wow! The kahlua cocoa cheesecake was wonderful! We will be returning once a month for cheesecake. Bravo!

We specifically called in advance to ask if they were dog friendly so we could eat lunch here for our anniversary and bring our dog with us. We were told that it was no problem at all as their patio is dog friendly. Once we arrived after a half hour drive we asked once again just to be sure that our dog would be fine here. We were once again told that the patio is dog friendly, and were seated at a table. After sitting for about 10 minutes, we were approached by someone else who informed us, quite condescendingly might I add, that the patio was dog friendly as long as our dog was outside of the establishment. We explained that we were told not once, but twice, that the patio was dog friendly and we drove to cheesecake specifically to celebrate our anniversary. Our dog is well behaved and sat right underneath us calmly for the 10 minutes we were there. The fact that Cheesecake Factory deems their patio dog friendly under the criteria that the dog is not actually on the premises is a complete farce. Add to that the utter incompetence of the staff to inform us properly that in order to eat at their establishment I would have to actually have my dog sitting outside on the scorching hot pavement is just purely disrespectful. I guarantee you that The Cheesecake Factory will never receive business from me again.

I love everything about The Cheesecake Factory: You have a lot of meals you can decide from, the water does not really taste like chlorine (which is a huge plus!! We don&#39;t have water that tastes like chlorine in our home country and I don&#39;t want to get used to water that tastes like chemicals), the cakes are heavenly good, the waitress was the most nice and patient waitress I&#39;ve met so far, you get free bread to snack on while deciding on what you want to eat. The only downside is that the meals are on the pricier side. (Burgers around $13, pasta around $16)<br><br>When I went there this weekend for an early lunch, my friend and I were the first people at the restaurant and could save a good table on the patio. The restaurant fills pretty quickly, so we were lucky to have such a good table.<br>As it was our first time there, it took us longer than usual to go through the menu, because they have so many options. They even have a smaller menu with low calorie meals, which I find is pretty nice. The waitress was very patient with us, because even after 20 minutes of sitting there, looking through the menu, we still couldn&#39;t decide on what to eat. She even offered her help to find a meal for my friend, after asking if she&#39;s in the mood for burgers, pasta, sandwiches, etc. I asked for a mix of the &#34;skinnylicious veggie burger&#34; and the normal veggie burger and without she took my order without questioning it.<br>We both enjoyed our meals and ordered  some cheesecake for dessert. The Oreo cheesecake is heaven on earth! The slices are worth the price of $6.95-7.95! I hardly spend a lot of money on dessert, because I&#39;m pretty specific when it comes to pastries, but I can 100% recommend that cake! We also had the Reese&#39;s peanut butter cheesecake, but that one was too heavy for me, even though I love Reese&#39;s.<br><br>I&#39;m not giving 5 stars, because I think the prices are too high, but you definitely come here every now and then when you want to have a good time with great food! :)
Thank you Cheesecake Factory for responding.  Not sure what would happen if I responded in you general mailbox and how you could fix my unhappiness.

Worst experience with a CCF. Won&#39;t do reservations for a party of 15 and yet it&#39;s an hour to two hour wait for an available table as they seat everyone who comes in after you in rows of tables that are together in sections.

The food was delicious and the banana cream cheesecake ease divine. Both not only met, but exceeded my expectations.  The service, however, could use improvement.  We were greeted at the table by a female server who was obviously not pleased with her job or just unhappy that day. Then another server brought our drinks and explained she would be taking care of us.  The first server came back, telling us there&#39;s confusion over the sections that day.  Then the second server came back and completed our dining experience.  The attention to our table was appropriate and we were never left needing any items, but there was just a lack of positivity.  Maybe they were just upset they were working on New Year&#39;s Day and we order hot water to drink.

The good stuff: The service was really good, fast seating, good flavors.<br><br>The bad stuff: Outrageous pricing. Ended up spending $77 before tip on 2 entrees, some nachos, 1 slice of cheesecake and a cocktail. They don&#39;t put prices on the drink menu because they know people won&#39;t buy a watered down mojito for $13. Nachos were $14 and were supposed to have chicken but there were maybe 5 pieces in it. Small portions for $20 pasta entrees. Completely not worth the money, especially when there are better restaurants in the area where you&#39;d spend half the cash on twice the food. <br><br>Overall- skip it. You&#39;ll find better food, atmosphere and pricing elsewhere.

I went to the Chessecake Factory for lunch a while back. I have to say the California Club sandwich and avocado eggrolls I had were really excellent. So for food this place is fantastic. <br><br>If you&#39;re on a diet (I do weight watchers) though, it&#39;s kind of rough. They have some salads that are kind of healthy, but they don&#39;t post any of their nutrition facts (I had to find them from Washington where they legally have to). Not the healthiest food ever, just delicious. <br><br>The service was good, and they&#39;re great about bagging your leftovers up for you. <br><br>Good location down on 16th street too.

Food tastes decent. Kinda pricey. Came here for the first time with a group totaling 4 people... One girl NEVER GOT HER FOOD! We ended up leaving after 2 hours with free meals for the rest of us (thanks) but she never got to experience the food! Not happy with this place. Manager was even laughing when she came to apologize. So not worth it. Not this location anyway.
Been here several of times but decided to do a review since I was here! Didn&#39;t get any cheesecake but I am tempted! Great place to get dolled up with the girls!

Been here a three times the past couple of months~~always just get cheesecake~~first visit: awesome server, awesome cheesecake~~second visit: awesome server (happily moved us to a better table w/no complaints), awesome cheesecake again~~third visit: &#34;okay&#34; server (seemed to forget we were there--btw, reason I&#39;m not giving five stars), awesome cheesecake again~~~we will for sure go back! Btw-love the fact that on a hot Summer day, the air conditioning is cranked up and seems to slap you in the face~~a good slap of course!
Excellent food and service.  I recommend the Asian Chicken Salad and the fried mushroom, avocado, and zucchini appetizer.  The lemonade is a little too sweet for me though so just go with a water.

I like this location; it&#39;s been years since I have been to a Cheesecake Factory but to be on the 16th St. Mall is nice! The menu has a wide variety of dishes and tastes and their cheesecake (of course) is decadent and delicious. I had the lunch portion of pecan crusted catfish that came with succotash and mashed potatoes. The mash were good - rich and buttery and I only had a few bites of that to avoid a food coma. The fish was also good but I missed that pecan nutty flavor coming through in my bites. Looks like a good place to people watch if you sit outside.

This place has a massive menu, it feels less like a menu in your hand and more like a novel.  I&#39;ve had a few different things, over the different Cheesecake Factories I&#39;ve been too and they&#39;ve all been pretty tasty.<br><br>That being said, I feel like some of the items are a bit overpriced and given when you go you could potentially be waiting in an obnoxiously long line.  That&#39;s hardly their fault if they&#39;re getting a lot of customers, it&#39;s just something to take note of.<br><br>I&#39;d also like say while I am not much of a dessert person, the cheesecake here lives up to it&#39;s namesake and is quite delicious.  It&#39;s probably one of my favorite desserts I&#39;ve had, and it the primary reason I&#39;ll stop in to eat.

Good golly this place was heaven and a pleasure to try out! We stepped inside and the place is huge, and very fancy. This place is great for a romantic date and a large party of friends and family. We started off with an appetizer of bread sticks with a soft, creamy buttery filling which was mouth watering and flattering. The server brought a large circle of bread with sesame seeds on top, which left my mouth a fan of their bread and pastries. The menu has a large variety of items to choose from, that I&#39;m not sure it&#39;s possible to try everything on the menu! I eventually ordered a Blue Cheese B.I.T. Burger topped with their crispy bacon, lettuce, tomato, onion rings and lots of blue cheese! The burger was so fancy, that the top bun was not even placed on top of the burger. The Blue Cheese burger was also a tall burger with lots of onion rings stacked on top the delicious beef patty. I was very much in love when I tried my first bite and enjoyed the beauty of the art that this burger very much provided for me. <br><br>I recommend this restaurant to anyone who is looking to have an amazing time with a date, friends or with family. The Cheesecake Factory comes with so many items on their menu, that this place is perfect to try new things. I know I definitely will when I come a second time around. Cheers!

I don&#39;t always go to Cheese cake factory but when I do, I order Jamaican spicy black beans shrimp with fried bananas. I love this. It makes the Indian in me very happy. Super spicy shrimp curry is just awesome! Nice and friendly staff too even though it was too late and too crowded.

Food: I ordered a sandwich for lunch.  The bread was toasted a bit much as it was too hard, and I had a difficult time biting into it.  It also lacked much flavor.  The fries that came with it were average.  However, the cheesecake was absolutely delicious.<br>Service: The service was fine.  I didn&#39;t have to wait for refills, and my server was pleasant.<br>Ambiance: I didn&#39;t like the long booth seat because it felt like I was dining with the people next to me.  The restaurant seems like a decent place for all ages though.<br>Cleanliness: The dining room and the bathroom were quite clean.<br>Price: I thought the price was quite reasonable.  The cheesecake was on the higher end, but I thought it was worth it.<br>Overall: I would definitely stop in again for dessert.  Perhaps I would give lunch another try, but I would stay away from the sandwiches.

We were seated right away even though it was dinner time. The waiter came right over and was happy to take our order and not wait since we knew what we wanted. We were only ordering 2 appetizers and he still offered us bread, which was nice. The fried mac n cheese was amazing like usual. The avocado egg rolls looked different which worried me, but they tasted just as amazing as they do in other locations.

I love that the restaurant is open late night. I have always been a fan of this savory shrimp and noodles dish in a creamy lemon sauce. This last visit though I decided to venture out and try something new. Usually when I find a dish that I absolute crave, I always get it on return. <br><br>I chose to go with the Fried Macaroni and Cheese Burger with a side of fries. I read the description and never looked at anything else. I was not disappointed. they always have the tastiest french fries, cut to perfection and crispy all around. This burger was so flavorful. I like a well done burger, and this was cooked as ordered but still juicy. The fried macaroni was so tasty, and I was worried it would be too battered, but just the opposite. The macaroni was creamy and complimented the burger perfectly. To add another dash of sin to the dish, they give an additional splash of a cheese sauce over the fried macaroni. <br><br>The hamburger was huge, so half was plenty for me, and the leftovers were just as delicious. In the end, everyone was too full to even consider a piece of cheesecake. Next time perhaps.

Surprisingly, this strip of 16th in Denver offered far more franchised, restaurant powerhouses than I expected, at least with all of the gypsy activity going on all on the streets and sidewalks.<br><br>But, the Cheesecake Factory appetizers can never do you wrong, especially for happy hour. Our waitress cared for us in a very genuine way, refilling our water and expediting our dinner for the sake of us catching the Rockies game. All this took place despite us sticking to the cheap $5 appetizers in the bar for happy hour.<br><br>Guacamole: $5<br>Crab and artichoke dip: $5<br>Spinach dip: $5<br><br>Food coma and 3 piles of chips for less than the cost of a drink at some penthouse nightclub? Priceless.<br><br>And don&#39;t forget to get a slice of cheesecake on the way out... that is the main reason I suppose the high school program groups and fallback date nights would like to come this way--not judging, just pointing out some of the true demographics! I just like cheap munchies.

Beautiful interior, friendly service, I assume the food is fantastic.  The bar service is top notch and he didn&#39;t miss a beat last night.  My wife and I just stopped in for a drink and some cheeescake and now we&#39;re itching to go back and really give the place a test drive.  So far so awesome!

Worst service I have ever experienced! The only time our waiter was prompt was when it was time to run the check. Don was an awful waiter and our dinner took 2 hours! He didn&#39;t offer a new fork when he witnessed it drop on the floor, he spilled wine on my girlfriend, he brought out the wrong desert and it took an additional 20 minutes to get the correct one and no apology was given, once we finally got our desert he forgot to bring a fork so we could even eat it, and last but not least as we were finally leaving we see our waiter outside smoking and ignoring all of his tables! Because the service was so bad this dinner took so long we ended up missing the event we intended to enjoy downtown and I had to run back to the car to feed the meter. This location doesn&#39;t even deserve 1 star! We will never be returning and I would avoid this location if possible. Don you are awful!!!

This place is awesome for my wife and I since she has Celiac and has to eat gluten free. Our waitress was very accommodating and was willing to go and ask the cooks about anything we had concerns with. The food we ordered was very tasty and typical of other locations we have eaten at. This location gets three stars because: 1. My glass of water came out with some good sized white mass stuck to the inside of the glass. 2. Our food took a while longer to get to us than I would have expected. 3. Parking in there area is limited and will cost you money no matter where you end up.

Service was absolutely horrible would not recommend going, the staff was very rude and aggressive, when putting in my name and being told It would be a 40 minute wait, I waited an hour and then they lied and said they came to look for me, waitress was very disrespectful and slow.

Disappointing.   The Cheesecake Factory usually produces consistently good food. Not this time. <br>Maybe it was a second crew cooking on the 4th of July. <br>We ordered nachos with chicken to start. It looked like someone had thrown it on the plate then realized we&#39;d ordered chicken and grabbed a handful of the closet chicken in the kitchen, smothered in a horrible dried orange sauce. Yuck!<br>The white chili was okay, but when there is twice the amount of rice than chili, it looks like they&#39;re going cheap, while still charging $$.  The spicy chicken sandwich was tasty, but again thrown on the plate, with most of the chicken, smothered in sauce, missing the bun. The most disappointing was the chicken and biscuits. The chicken was black on the bottom (not burnt but black from a not clean grill,) then covered in a bland, lumpy sauce with soggy vegetables. The biscuits were overcooked and dry. We had this boxed up for our dog. <br>We thought we&#39;d have dessert, but decided against it given our experience. Disappointing!

About the only thing good about this place is the take-out bakery.  Order a piece of cheesecake.  It&#39;s over-priced, the piece is too large and can feed probably 4 people.  I recommend taking it home and eating it over the course of a week.  I wouldn&#39;t go out of my way to eat here, but if you&#39;re in the neighborhood and wanting a sweet something late at night, then this is probably as good as it&#39;s going to get.  Personally, I would not eat dinner here as the wait is always too long  and the food is not that great.  I&#39;m not sure why people eat at this place.  It&#39;s an over-priced Chili&#39;s or Applebees, in my opinion.  blah.  Don&#39;t waste time and money with this place when there are plenty of local restaurants downtown with much better food.

I walked in to place a take out order of cheesecake, shake, and ice cream. It took 50 minutes to get my order! I mean everything but the shake is ready to go already. 50 minutes to make a shake??? Had a ask the the heck was going on several time. It&#39;s like this nearly every time I go in there. Get it together.

Jack of all trades, master of none. That is all I can think of when I come to this disaster of a chain restaurant. Ended up here because of a birthday so I didn&#39;t have much of a choice. So many options and they are all terrible, got the fish tacos if you&#39;re interested. It was sitting so long under a heat lamp that the bottom fell out of all of them and I had to eat them with a fork. Service was equally terrible especially for a Thursday night. Did I mention it was overpriced? Not that i&#39;m in love with chain restaurants, but if that is what you&#39;re looking for Yard House is a little further up on 16th street. That is a much better option in my opinion. I can&#39;t hate on the cheesecake and lemon cake. That was the only highlight.

I had a late lunch today service was good as usual food was also very good I recommend the imperial chicken and shrimp. The only reason I gave it 3 stars was restroom was nasty and they were slow also the booth we were seated in was dirty.. sort of ruined my visit.

I ate at the Cheesecake Factory with a large party on a Sunday around 5:00.  We had to wait about 20-30 minutes to be seated because the large party that had the table before us was camping for about 20 minutes after they paid the check.<br><br>Overall, the service was good.  Drinks were kept filled, and our large party (about 10) was accommodated quite well.  With appetizer, entree, dessert, and the pre-added 18% tip, the total for my wife and me was around $90.  It wasn&#39;t too bad, but it also wasn&#39;t what I&#39;d call a $90 meal.  The spinach dip was a bit bland, as was the house-made guacamole (no lime).  I had the Salisbury steak.  I ordered it because it came with a vegetable and with potatoes unlike the regular steak which comes without a vegetable for abut five dollars more.  The wife had the spaghetti which I have to admit was the best restaurant spaghetti I&#39;ve ever had.<br><br>Cheesecake was good, but again - was it $7.50 good?  I just can&#39;t say it was.  For my dime, I would have taken a smaller portion at a slightly lower price.<br><br>Overall, it was a good experience, but the wait, the price, and the fact that for that price the food didn&#39;t knock my socks off made it less enjoyable.<br><br>Recommendation: for a tasty meal at a similar price, I recommend heading south to the Park Meadows area and trying J Alexander&#39;s.  But, if you absolutely must have a huge menu with over a dozen different kinds of cheesecake, I suppose  you should go to The Cheesecake Factory.
Weekday lunchtime only (no kids)<br>Bar area only (no kids)<br><br>love the oriental chicken salad and a glass of wine

I would like to start off that the food and our server were amazing! It may have been better if it didn&#39;t take an hour to get our food, but that is understandable on a busy Saturday. Although I do have one major problem... After spending $150 just between two people, the MANAGER would not validate our parking card. She said they &#34;don&#39;t validate that certain structure.&#34; I really thought she was serious, until it literally took us 45 minutes to walk around the whole area, just for a rude security guard to tell us that he has never heard of Cheesecake not validating that parking structure. So then there went another 15 minutes arguing with security, convincing we weren&#39;t lying. I&#39;m not sure who to blame in regards to this issue, but this corporate company holds their business at a facility that keeps you there longer than an hour just to figure out how to get a validation!!! It makes me never want to visit this business again, because now I feel as if the manager was just not paying attention, after taking our money of course!

Ok... Cheesecake Factory in general is no biggie. It&#39;s expensive, fattening and pretty standard. You can get 3 days worth of calories all in one meal. With that said, I am a fan of their HAPPY HOURS available only in the bar area!! <br><br>Mon-Fri from 4-6 you can get a lot of stuff at $5 and I believe its full size because the portions looked pretty big to me. I came here with a group and each of us ordered about 2-3 things. Everyone got to try a variety of stuff at a fraction of the price. For example, I ordered the Chicken Pot Sticker, normally $9 but only $5 during HH. Que awesome! The Sweet Corn Fritter was pretty delicious too. The Fried Calamari I really liked also ~ que yumm for $5 dollah per item. <br><br>I think all Cheesecake Factory have the same HH but call ahead if you wanna double check.

Honestly the worst Cheesecake Factory I have ever been to. We decided to go here when we were on vacation in Denver. Back home we never had any problems. Unfortunately it was a little but different here. The food was cold and tasted a little bit old. When we asked for the manager he was very unapologetic and acted as if we were incompetent. Although our server was great!

I am not a big fan of cheesecake and I pretty much stay away from restaurant chains. But the Cheescake Factory was the only thing open late one night. My family has been coming ever since. Great high quality food. Attentive service. Full bar. Food served after 10pm. What more could you ask for?

Cheesecake Factory has always been bourgeois to me so I have  never gone there of my own volition. Well, I mean, I&#39;ve never said, &#34;Hey, let&#39;s go to Cheesecake Factory&#34;. <br><br>However, I have eaten food from the restaurant or dined there at least three times in 15 years. The food is good. There is no doubt about that. The staff is knowledgeable but I wouldn&#39;t call them &#39;friendly&#39;. <br><br>I have had one of their chicken and pasta entrees and their simply grilled salmon which were both delicious. I&#39;m a big fan of cheesecake and key lime pie so that is my cheesecake of choice when I visit. <br><br>Will I go back? Sure, as long as I&#39;m not paying.
Pumpkin cheesecake, don&#39;t mind if I do.... and George (female) is awesome!<br><br>Female vs Cheesecake.... 0 to 1

Fantastic food. High prices but worth it. The cucumber ice tea is amazing! Service is really slow though and the man who seated us kept going on about how horrible the movie we just saw was when we liked it so that threw us of a lot. But overall great.

I love the Cheesecake Factory. We almost never have to wait to be seated and our waitress is also prompt and helpful. They have a huge menu which is easy to get overwhelmed with. Also their portions are HUGE! Either go hunger or go with someone to split with. The Cheesecake Factory is also on the worst for you list and with their portions I can see why. They wouldn&#39;t be all that bad for you if you didn&#39;t eat the whole entree. <br><br>The cheesecake is to die for. I have tried just about every cheesecake they offer and have never been disappointed. My favorite is the white chocolate raspberry. I always take mine home, because there is no way I can eat cheesecake after my monster meal.

Service was excellent, but the food was very poor at lunch time. The Skinny menu is attractive, i ordered the Skinny Chpped Salad and most of the ingredients on the menu didn&#39;t make it to the plate. My coworker&#39;s order was not served today at lunch so we had to wait for another 30min for her order. Its so sad that the quality of the food was really poor because this place used to be fantastic.

Yeah so it&#39;s time to update this.<br><br>We came back back for a nice anniversary dinner.  Everything was going well.  We were seated in a nice dark corner in the back away from the noisy dinner crowd and rug rats.  The appetizer of chicken croquettes was good and so was the bread.  <br><br>I had the pasta and meat sauce which was just meh.  Seriously, Olive Garden&#39;s is better.  I ate about half and decided to get a take home box along with a slice of tiramisu cheesecake to take home.<br><br>He (Randall I think his name was) brought out the boxes and the check and then we waited.<br><br>And we waited...<br><br>And we waited...<br><br>5 minutes....<br><br>10 minutes...<br><br>The overly generous gratuity I had left him for mediocre service gets scratched out and we begin deducting a dollar for each passing minute.<br><br>20 minutes goes by.  No cheesecake.<br><br>Finally we&#39;d had enough and it was evident that our waiter (Randall) just completely and unprofessionally neglected us after bringing us the check that included the charge for the cheesecake we&#39;d PAID for and was not delivered.  We got up and marched directly to the bakery and demanded our cheesecake that we were never served.<br><br>And to think I gave them another chance.<br><br>Strike two for Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>There WILL NOT be a strike three.

If you&#39;ve ever been to a Cheesecake Factory, you know what to expect. If you don&#39;t, then this is for you.<br><br>You can generally expect to have a good wait time to get into a seat because the food is awesome. Do not mistake this wait time for poor service because it&#39;s generally anything besides lacking. <br><br>At this one in particular, you can also sit outside. Even on a brisk spring or fall evening it&#39;s comfortable because they&#39;ll crack up the outdoor heaters just for you. It&#39;s very nice as long as there&#39;s not a breeze.<br><br>They&#39;ll start by bringing you a little bread, and all of it is worth trying out and making sure that they&#39;ve got more coming for you.<br><br>The drinks that they&#39;ll offer are pretty varied, from general bar items to very specialty drinks, but sometimes the beer selection is lacking oddly enough.<br><br>Appetizers are delicious and as you can expect to find throughout the entire menu, it&#39;s all over the place. You can get a dozen kinds of pizza or chicken or a delicious pasta for that matter. <br><br>The main event though is of course.....the cheesecakes. I try to order a different one each time that I&#39;ve gone in, but I&#39;ve been to different locations dozens of times, and I haven&#39;t eaten the same one twice yet. <br><br>Enjoy!

HORRIBLE SERVICE! The kitchen appeared to be backed up as my husband and I waited 20 minutes for table bread and then waited ridiculously long for our food to arrive. This place was not busy and we arrived after lunch hours. The waiter seemed nice but he rarely came to my table for refills, etc. As we paid for our bill (that also took too long to accomplish), the waiter charged us the total amount from another&#39;s table order. We had to stay even longer in order to correct their bill mistake. Over two hours wasted for a simple, middle of the day lunch. Would not recommend this restaurant!

The avocado egg rolls, and chicken lettuce wraps always hit the spot. I never leave enough room for cake and I always say I will but the food is so good it&#39;s hard. Also the four cheese pasta is pretty good too. Very creamy and I had to split it with my boyfriend because it was just too big for me. And the mash potatoes are always good too. One of my favorite places to eat.
Everytime we dine here its always so freaking good. Their portions are quite big and food is on point. Also, besides their cheesecake.. Their stuffed mushrooms are the best!

Wide variety of options and dependable food and selection that everyone can find something. if it is not too windy, ask for a table on the patio to people watch. <br><br>The salad choices here are worthy of return trips - as much so as their cheesecake variety.

My aunt and I went here for dinner and we wish we would have made a better decision. The place was packed which was understandable, the service wasn&#39;t bad, but the food was not good at all! It was also her birthday, and our waiter has told us she got a FREE piece of cheesecake with her meal. When we looked at the bill it was on there, along with the total being $70! As soon as we left i started puking. My aunt had assured me it was for sure food poisoning. Attending this restaurant was by far the worst decision we made during my visit here in Denver.

Not only is the cheesecake to die for but the food is so tasty, the restaurant is beautiful and in downtown Denver, what a great mixture!! I loved taking my Italian husband there so he could see that the food in America is also delicious :)
Ran out of salad?!! Ordered something else, 43 minutes and counting. Waiter has no clue as to when. Why bother?

Best dinner I have had in so long! We just celebrated our Anniversary and decided to have dinner at the Cheese Cake Factory. Do your self the favor and order the herb crusted salmon or the chipotle chicken pasta. So delicious! In addition, the service was top notch! We had a great server and an overall great experience.

I went with a party of 2 for lunch on a Saturday afternoon.<br>If you&#39;ve ever been to cheesecake factory, or if you&#39;ve read the Yelp reviews, you know about the portion sizes. This is a double portion, so make sure to split your entree in half and box it before you blow your pants out. <br>The service was literally some of the best I have had in Denver. Trudy, our waitress, kept our drinks completely refilled and even brought us strawberries with our cheesecake because that is one of her favorite additions.<br>The food is delicious and comes out piping hot. <br><br>The only negatives I would have is:<br>-It is always packed.<br>-The seating is very cramped. They tried to stick us in a tiny table elbow lengths away from another couple and we just requested a different table, which they took care of right away.<br>-This place is loud. I think it&#39;s probably due to all of the marble used throughout the decor, but expect to have to raise your voice.<br>-Parking. Though this isn&#39;t a problem for me, as I walk, anyone that drives into downtown is going to have to street park or find a garage and pay while you eat. <br>-It&#39;s so pricey. You&#39;re looking at $50 for 2 entrees and 2 cheesecakes. And, while I really wanted a drink I just can&#39;t do it at $10 a pop. But, if you do what we did and eat lunch and then take home half of everything for dinner, it&#39;s not horrible. Definitely worth a splurge in my opinion, as this is one of my favorite chains.

I really don&#39;t understand why people love this place so much. The cheesecake is obviously delicious, but I think they make too many dishes to really be good at making any of them. They put SO much food on a plate, and it&#39;s all so rich. Any time I go here I leave with a stomach ache that lasts for at least a full 24 hours. <br><br>MEH. There are much better restaurants on the mall.

This was the first time that I had been to the Cheesecake Factory. My son had gone before and highly recommended it. The service was great and the waitstaff was always available for our drink refills. I ordered a salad and the portions were great. The flavor was wonderful as well as I got a mexican flavored dressing with tortilla chips. We would definitely go back there again. My family really enjoyed this restaurant.

Stopped in on a busy Saturday evening around 430pm.  They were able to get my party of 2 seated within 10 minutes and our waitress had our drinks and fresh bread within minutes as well.  I did notice the couple next to us ordered some alcoholic beverages and that took about 15 minutes for them to get.  My husband ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger that cake with fries and he had no complaints as it was not greasy and a pretty big portion size.  I ordered the lunch size Herb Crusted Salmon since we got there before 5pm and it was amazzzzing!  So fresh and tasty.  Just the right about of herbs to not make it overbearing.  My only complaint was that the Asparagus was basically raw.  We ordered our usual Banana Creme Cheesecake to go and that was yummy as well and came with Whip Cream and a sliced Banana.  I think this place serves portions worth the value.  It&#39;s clean and has a good atmosphere whether you are on a date or having a family dinner.

Arrived around 7 pm and didn&#39;t have to wait, due to friends already being there, so I can&#39;t comment on that. Parking is horrific, but that should be expected with the location. The food was amazing, and the service was surprisingly quite even though it was packed! Definitely expensive, but you are in downtown Denver, so it&#39;s expected. The only reason it doesn&#39;t get 5 stars is because the waitress decided to interrupt our conversations multiple times to explain what was on the menu that we all had readily available and had already read. Will be back, but I&#39;ll not have the same waitress, hopefully.

I absolutely love the Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes here, which is why I always return to The Cheescake Factory and this particular location is close to the performing arts complex, so it&#39;s become the place we go after a night at the Buell or Ellie Caulkins, etc.<br><br>My last experience here wasn&#39;t the best, with the exception of our server (and the tamale cakes).  The restaurant was very under staffed, considering the influx of guests that came in at 10pm on a Tuesday.  There was no one at the check in dek when we arrived, and there were already 12 people waiting to request a table.  When she did arrive, she had to individually seat us, without any other assistance, which meant we waited about 10 minutes before we even put our name down.<br><br>Then, our poor server got 6-7 tables at the same time and he was definitely rushed and feeling overwhelmed.  We had to wait quite a while to get our food and when it did arrive, the order was incorrect, so it had to be sent back, which increased our wait time (and we were starving!).<br><br>The food was average that night, and the portions at Cheescake are huge, so that always means two meals for the price of one!  Our server, however, was very attentive, all things considered and he was very apologetic and quick to make things right for us.  <br><br>The cheesecake itself here is always a great choice, so you can never go wrong with any of their selections.  My personal favorite: Banana Cream Cheesecake.  It&#39;s really light and fluffy and not overly sweet.  Oh!  and they do brunch on Sundays.  The waffles are very very good.

Although I do like the Cheesecake Factory, I still wonder why people wait one or two hours to get a table at this restaurant on any given day.  Even though the food is pretty decent, the first question I have is whether the wait is worth it.  Anyway, I was there with my friend and since we were close the to restaurant we decided to have dinner.  My friend got a martini - I was impressed by its size and I started off with a Margarita.  Drinks were good and arrived to the table in less than 3 minutes.  For appetizer we order calamari, the waiter told us that it was his favorite.  It was not bad, especially after dipping it with the sauce that came with it.  For main course we had a Chinese Salad which we felt it was average and we also had Mahi-Mahi, which was too fishy.  We told the waiter about it and the manager stopped by our table and let us choose another dish and he bought the Mahi-Mahi.  We replaced it with a Miso Salmon that was way better.  For dessert we had the White Chocolate  Raspberry cheesecake and it was delicious.  We also got coffees, one decaf and one regular, they were both cold.  It was interesting because I would assume that they are kept in different containers so it was strange to see that both were equally cold.  Anyway, service was good so I won&#39;t complain, I&#39;ll give them another chance, especially since we have been at this restaurant in several occasions and we have experienced a much better time than our last visit; it was not too bad but we have simply had better experiences at a restaurant that has the potential to average four start but due to inconsistency is sending a mix message.

I met this place back in Miami and loved it immediately. The food is really really good, the attention is also good and the ambience is definitely different. If I can think of a not so good thing about this site, it may be the noise level. For obvious reasons these franchises are so damn popular, so wherever you go they&#39;ll always be packed.

$80 for our dinner meal plus tip! The food was okay but the cheesecake was yummy. Service was to be expected - not too bad, not super great either.  What prompted us to try this place was the location; it is in the strip area so it was convenient plus the fact that there were a lot people going in. There are other restaurants out there to try though.

We went here on St Paddys day for a quick bite. We got a seat pretty quickly sitting in the bar area.  Same menu as the restaurant just not the long wait for a table.  Huge menu with plenty of choices.  I had the lunch portion, a pizza and salad.  The salad was fantastic..the pizza is just okay.  My friend had the Pot Pie and said it was wonderful.  Great service and we were in and out on a super busy day! Worth a try but you aren&#39;t gonna get anything here you haven&#39;t had before.

Poor management. Came here with a party of 8. Took us 2+ hours to get seated. Even if they were waiting on a table to open up, you would think they can put tables together. Apparently that isn&#39;t a thing.

We like this place because of how late it&#39;s open and of course the desserts are just phenomenal. Tiramisu (not tiramisu cheesecake) is a must have here. Their service is definitely lacking a little but it&#39;s not benough to keep us away.

Went here for my bachelorette party. The food was ok. We had two servers and didn&#39;t see either of them. One of the bridesmaids got the wrong food. They forgot one of our cheesecakes. Didn&#39;t take any of the mess ups off of the check, and nothing was offered to me for my special night. We&#39;ve been here for 3 hours now, and STILL don&#39;t have our check. We had others plans tonight! We even called a manager over and told him about everything that happened. I&#39;m sorry but, &#34;I&#39;m sorry&#34; isn&#39;t good customer service.

Had a pleasant experience here at The Cheesecake Factory with mom. Our server was friendly, down to earth, and always kept our drinks full without asking. Rarely do I ever give a 5 star, but this place earned it!

Always really crowded but that is to be expected and even with the crowd I&#39;ve never had to wait more than 5 mins for a table. The food is always good the portions are huge but every time I go I always feel like our host/waiter/waitress hates their job.

I really like the Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve frequented locations in several different states.  Last night,  my husband and I came to this location for the first time.  We expected a wait but we also requested first available open seating on the patio.  When we were starting to be escorted to a seat inside,  my husband asked what happened with the patio seating. She looked flustered but she apologized and looked for available seating.  When she said we would need to wait my husband told her waiting was out of the question so please go ahead and just seat us.  She responded.. &#34;well I don&#39;t want to seat you if you are angry&#34;. We didn&#39;t know how to process that so we took a seat and tried to deal with it.  It went downhill from there. We were sitting next to an obnoxious group of ladies and their waiter leaned over our table to take a picture of them without any heads up.  He didn&#39;t even ask us if it would be OK.  It totally interrupted our conversation and quite frankly it was pretty rude. We had to sit there and back up so that he could take pictures of them.  I hate when people lean over me and I really hate it when they do it at a restaurant. My husband spoke with Connor who is one of the managers and he was very professional and courteous.  We decided to stay and eat... until my husband realized that his steak wasn&#39;t cooked. He has to have his steak well done.  This steak was red on the inside.  Completely unacceptable! On a positive note,  once we voiced our concerns with Connor, he immediately apologized and made it right. He is really an asset to that establishment and because of his actions we will definitely try this location again.

Menu way to big.  Steak was good a little overcooked. Cheesecake was excellent.<br>Even with a party of 9 we only waited 15 min. for our table. Only downside is it&#39;s to dark and reading the menu was hard to do

Yummmm.....review for yummy cheesecake only!<br><br>We arrived late after dinner and were seated on the patio for a round cheesecake and some people watching.  I ordered the turtle and my hubby had the Khalua.  Both were great, super sweet and large enough portions to take home.<br><br>Service was quick and courteous and not once were we pressured to leave when it came to closing time.

I had the Asian Salad last night and it was bad.  I absolutely don&#39;t recommend it--it should be taken OFF the menu.  Take lettuce, carrots, and 1 oz of chicken and drizzle olive oil over it--no taste what so ever.  The cheese cake dessert was fantastic.

Sad to say it&#39;s the first time I have been subjected to racial profiling:-( no one should ever be profiled due to the colour of their skin! I am aghast at what awaits us in the future. I live across from Cheesecake and have often stopped by over the last 10 years! A new fairly well dressed gentleman assumed I was Mexican and questioned my credit card. No earlier individual was subjected to this. After scrutinizing my ID he accepted!!!! Trump - you have your people!!! To add insult to injury the manager Holly Weaver was pathetic in her meagre  attempts to apologize!!!  Tragic!!!

The Cheesecake Factory never disappoints me...<br><br>I LOVE their cheesecake and I LOVE their drinks. Their strawberry daiquris have made it on my Top 3 Strawberry Daiquiris list. I&#39;m very disappointed with their selection of vegetarian options. They have something like a 15-page menu, and only a few vegetarian options, most of them pasta. I&#39;ve gotten sick of getting the same old thing every single time, so I&#39;m not as excited about their actual food. <br><br>I love the ambience and the atmosphere. The waiters are always very friendly. If you go on the weekend, you will have to wait a while, so just prepare for that. I don&#39;t think they take reservations, which seems silly. <br><br>Best place to go for just a slice of cheesecake after a show, play or dancing.

Incredibly bland food that&#39;s reheated from frozen meals made off site (talk to former employees if you want to lose your appetite). Ads in the menu. For the price, you could go to any number of far better places. If you enjoy food, stay away.
I had a good salad; <br>Juices were too sweat;<br>Service was good;<br>Just too big!!!

My friend and I visited the evening of 5/8/2015. I&#39;ve been here many times and have always had a pleasant experience. The avocado egg rolls are to die for! But I&#39;m not writing a review for the food. I&#39;m writing a review today because of our amazing server. If I remember correctly (and I hope I do), her name was Elizabeth and she was exceptional. She not only attended to our needs but anticipated them as well, she kept our water glasses filled, had perfect timing on knowing when we were ready to order, and made us feel like we were at home. She genuinely wanted to ensure that we had a great dinner. She was definitely one of the best servers I&#39;ve ever had!

This place is an absolute rip off. We stopped in for lunch and a cool day in the city and what we got was a cold shoulder and an old fashioned hold up. The service was very slow and the wait staffs &#34;git up and go had got up and went&#34;. Then my wife ordered a Mojito from the lunch menu. It was our fault that we did not ask the price up front since it was not listed on the menu. I ordered a margarita under the same circumstances. When we got our check we were floored. The Mojito was $12.50 for what could not have been an 8 ounce glass. My Margarita was $9.50 and it was served in a modified and small wine glass. (And to add insult to injury, after lunch we set out on 16th street and 3 doors down a restaurant was advertising their Mojito&#39;s for $5.00.) The food was equally proportioned and pricey. There is nothing about the food, staff or drinks that makes this place worthy of the pricing. Overall, it really kind of ruined what was otherwise a nice day in the city. There is no way we would ever return.

Amazing atmosphere,  friendly and attentive staff, the crab and artichoke dip is fantastic! My wife had the shrimp with angel hair pasta, and i had the steak dianne with herb encrusted salmon. Everything came out in a timely manner, and my meal was not only delicious, but my steak was cooked to a PERFECT medium rare temperature!! <br>If your looking for amazing food and a fun atmosphere, with medium+ prices, i HIGHLY suggest you bring everyone to the Cheesecake Factory! We will definitely be back!

Yeah. This place pretty much sucks except the cheesecake. The food is terrible. My beer was warm. I got the philly cheese steak and the meat was  so chewy I had to spit it all out. Our waters never got filled. We sat there for an hour until I finally asked. For a beer, meal, and cheese cake slice it was almost $40. The waiters switched mid-shift and never really checked on us. What a waste of money for terrible food and service. The only way I would come here would be to pick up a cheese cake slice to-go, but I would rather give somewhere else my money.

My review is from a visit to the Cheesecake Factory that happened probably a few years ago, before I had a yelp account, but the bad experience was more than enough for me to never go back. I am a vegetarian. At the time, there was pretty much nothing I could order that wouldn&#39;t require modification. I ordered a BLT, but instead of bacon, I asked for avocado. The waitress told me there would be an extra charge for the avocado. It was one or two dollars, but for a sandwich that was already pricey, I objected. She said she had no power to waive the fee and that I would need to speak with a manager. The manager came out and was extremely argumentative with me. I mean, you would think I was bankrupting the Cheesecake Factory with my request that they waive the one or two dollar fee. My co-worker was there, and it was extremely embarrassing to be treated with such hostility over what I felt was a reasonable request. If my co-worker hadn&#39;t been there, I would have simply gone somewhere else to eat. I told the manager that by not receiving bacon, and receiving avocado instead, I was actually saving the restaurant money. He argued that avocados are much more expensive than bacon (wrong). After about five minutes, he finally agreed to waive the fee, but sternly warned me that  it was the &#34;last time&#34; he would be doing this. (Wow.) I thought my troubles were over, but when the sandwich came out, it was the tiniest, skimpiest and grossest little sandwich you have ever seen--especially for Cheesecake Factory standards. I could just see the manager telling the cook, &#34;we&#39;ll get that extra two dollars one way or another&#34;. First of all, it was plain white bread, toasted to the point where it was cracker crunchy. The cook had cut the sandwich into triangles and cut the crusts off. Each fourth was only one or two bites, max. To top it all off, the sandwich only had tomato and lettuce on it! Yes, after all of that, the avocado that I was pretty much treated like a criminal over wasn&#39;t even there. I had to flag down the waitress just to get the avocado, which came out (after a long wait) in a soup cup. It wasn&#39;t worth complaining any more, so I ate my tiny lackluster sandwich and got out of there. Vegetarians beware.
Seating was very unorganized, and crowded. After we finally got seated service was good. Food was awesome, and desert was even better!

Now I truly feel bad giving Cheesecake Factory a 2 out of 5, but I call a Spade a Spade. The service is usually on point but I&#39;m going off the Brea, California location. Our server didn&#39;t tell us she was going on break and some guy just introduced himself to us. Now I get if that&#39;s the way they do things, I don&#39;t mind. However my dish came out wrong twice and my lady was already finish with her meal by the time mine came out.  Still wasn&#39;t mad but the management team dropped the ball by 1. Not comping at least my dish. 2. Saying that they&#39;ll buy us desert. I was so pissed I just tipped them and left. The experience happen a few months ago so I don&#39;t know if it&#39;s the same management team. I get it, stuff happens but theres a certain and proper way to take care of your guest

So, of course I love this place! Love the chain, love the downtown Denver location.... Love that they are open late. Love everything about the Cheesecake Factory, but the cheesecake! Funny, right? It&#39;s not that I don&#39;t love their cheesecake,  i do (Drool) it&#39;s just that after eating one of their gigantic meal portions, shoving a piece of cheesecake into your gullet seems a strange and unusual punishment.  I digress, I love the Cheesecake Factory, though, truth be told , I&#39;ve only ever tried one thing on their menu- I&#39;ve been here a million times. Their menu is like 60 pages long- they&#39;ve got a huge selection of delicious eats and I&#39;ve only tried one thing! I just can&#39;t seem to stray from their garlic noodles... With scampi tails, it&#39;s a great dish- consistently good, prepared with sundried tomatoes, shiitake mushroom and asparagus on a bed of spaghetti, It&#39;s what I always crave when I&#39;m here. Actually as an update: I&#39;ve strayed from my regular dish and sampled their happy hour specials- it&#39;s an awesome place to go for happy hour- they have awesome cheap eats ! I love their cheesecake but budget space in your belly, or, I guess you can always take a slice home ;)

A friend and I enjoyed a nice lunch on the fabulous patio at the Cheesecake Factory.  What better way to enjoy a Friday then a nice lunch on this beautiful day.  <br><br>Typical Cheesecake Factory, huge menu, good service, great food.  My friend had the lunch size portion of fish and chips and I had the BBQ Grilled Chicken Salad (lunch size).  Everything was great.  <br><br>No cheesecake today as we needed to get back to work and not fall asleep.  <br><br>Come on Y&#39;all you know what you get when you come here....we all do!  LMAO

Cheesecake is the best here.  I love the brownie sundae cheesecake.. Yummy!  Share it, as it is like 1500 calories or so.  They have a happy hour in the bar only, from 4-6 p.m. m-f.  Drinks are less, and the appetizer menu is really reasonable and portions are the regular size.  My only issue with the Cheesecake factory is their menu is way to big, and a little overpriced, and the food has never been outstanding, outside of the cheesecake.  I love the downtown location though.  It is big and always busy and fun.  The bar is kind of tucked in the back, so you have to go look for it a bit.

We ate at the Cheesecake Factory for dinner on December 29th and had an excellent experience.  The menu is very large which worked out well as we had a large group with varying tastes, so everyone got something they liked.  The staff was superior and fun, the food was excellent and of course the cheesecake was as expected...excellent.  I recommend this restaurant and hope that you have a great experience as we did.  I also wanted to mention that the interior design was excellent as well, creating an upscale ambiance/atmosphere.    <br><br>Enjoy!

Pondering between the Cheesecake Factory and an over-priced place we knew nothing about for lunch, we opted for familiarity. As we entered the door, my friend whispered, &#34;Giant serving sizes, giant serving sizes.&#34; She wasn&#39;t kidding. I have a few questions for the Cheesecake Factory higher-ups.<br><br>Question #1: if you have a menu the size of a bible, why aren&#39;t there any gluten-free options? When I asked the server if he could recommend any GF menu items he replied the Factory doesn&#39;t have a gluten-free menu (didn&#39;t expect one) but they could make most of the items GF. After inquiring about the tamales, I was told the tamales didn&#39;t have gluten but the sauces did, so the tamales would need to be served dry. I get it. The way to make stuff gluten-free is to omit some of the primary ingredients that define the dish. Looks like another salad for me.<br><br>Question #2: if you offer a salad titled, &#34;Pear and Endive,&#34; why are there not more than five or six teeny-tiny pieces of pear in the pound of food in the bowl?<br><br>Question #3: if you offer portion sizes that could feed a family, and you park your place near a convention center where out-of-towners have no place to refrigerate leftovers, why wouldn&#39;t you reduce food waste by offering smaller  servings at smaller prices?<br><br>In the end, the food tasted fine, and the service was friendly, but I hope the amount of food remaining on our plates made someone besides me feel guilty.

Went here for lunch today and sat outside. The wind started to pick up and the umbrellas had to come down, it started to sprinkle and sitting outside no longer was an option. Our waitress was great and ran over, grabbed our food and led us inside for cover. Had the light chicken tacos for the first time and YUM! They lost a star because it was high noon lunch time and they had one person seating people and we had to wait 10 minutes due to this.

Hubby and I stopped in for a bite to eat after getting out of a symphony performance.  It was my birthday, and we mentioned it to the server, but I didn&#39;t want people singing to me in the restaurant.  The server said he&#39;d bring me cake and skip the singing, which sounded good to me.<br><br>The food was great, large portions as usual, and because we were taking the light rail home, we decided not to have dessert.  The server forgot to bring me my birthday cake, which was a pity, since I&#39;d have made room for that.  <br><br>Overall, there are better places to eat (Larimer St being one block away) but it sufficed.

I got the Caesar salad for an appetizer and it was very bland.. Or maybe not enough dressing on there. The Cajun shrimp jambalaya was very good. Too bad there were 4 pieces of shrimp and the rest were chicken. All the other entrees that my friends ordered were not very good. <br><br>The plates were huge!! You can definitely share with someone and be full. But cheesecake needs to work on quality instead of the quantity. <br><br>2 stars for the good service.

We were in town visiting, met an old friend here for lunch. Service was good but the food was kind of bland. I had the Cubin sandwich which was okay, I also had one of the deep fried avocado&#39;s our guest was having both of which were lacking in flavor. Atmosphere was pleasant. Probably will not dine here again.

Never had a problem with Cheesecake Factory before this visit, which took place last weekend. My coworkers and I arrived around 1:15 pm, before a lunch rush. We saw people who were seated after us receiver their food before us. When we finally got our food, 2 out of 3 had issues and all of us agreed that it seemed like our food had been sitting in the hot plate for a while. My coworkers both got burgers and both said the bottom buns were tough and quite warm. I ordered a salad which was honestly not very fresh looking or tasting. The lettuce was wilted. Half way through our visit our waiter transitioned us to a new server (evidently so she could leave). The second server seemed to have forgotten us and we had to flag her down for everything, including our check. What should have been a one hourish lunch took 2 whole hours. We declined to order dessert because we were annoyed and late getting back to the office - even though our original purpose in going there was specifically to get cheesecake! I could have forgiven the slow service if the food had been ok but it was just not acceptable. I wouldn&#39;t serve food like that a guest in my home; not sure why they served it to paying customers.

This is such a great Cheesecake factory restaurant! I&#39;m something of a Cheescake factory addict, and have visited many locations in several different states and this is one of my favorites. The wait times are usually reasonable and the wait staff are attentive &amp; friendly. The food is classic Cheescake factory fabulousness which will always keep me going back.

ATTENTION: one one star is not a mistake.<br><br>Just writing this review makes me cringe with awful thoughts of my meal. The experience itself was pleasant, waited at the bar for my crew, had a glass of wine (not a good idea while sick, oh well) while only waiting probably 20 minutes for a table.<br><br>Once sat,our waitress impressed us all by memorizing seven different dinner and drink orders. But, I still rate it one star because of the meal. Blame it on the cold if you wish.<br><br>I ordered &#34;Renee&#39;s Special&#34; which consisted of: 1/2 a turkey sandwich, soup of the day (broccoli and cheese) and a salad. After about 20 minutes, our meal finally arrived.<br><br>Never again am I going to order &#34;Renee&#39;s Special&#34; what&#39;s so special about it? The soup was unbelievably salty, so salty I only ate about 3 bites of it. The sandwich was ok but not that exciting - I could have made it. The salad was actually pretty good but there was too much red cabbage. Not fun.<br><br>I can say the Snicker&#39;s cheesecake rocked. That&#39;s it.<br><br>Next time I&#39;m ordering a cheesecake TO GO. This place is not my cup of tea.

Our party of 4 stopped off for a slightly late lunch, and were told it would be a 15 minute wait. 20 minutes later, after noticing that people behind us had been seated, we checked in and were told it would be &#34;a few minutes more&#34;. 10 minutes later, after seeing a party of 4 (just like us) walk in and be seated almost immediately, we took our name off the list and were out the door.<br><br>As a rule, I don&#39;t review places I&#39;ve never visited. Technically, I visited this place, although I have never eaten there.

Great food. Prompt service. Go here if you are on 16th St and want a nice meal with some delicious desert. I will say, it is hard to eat an entire slice of cheesecake, so either plan on sharing or taking some home.

Not sure where to begin with this bad situation. I know Cheesecake Factory is a standard chain, but it would have been nice if they were up to standards. <br><br>We had a brief 10 or so minute wait, which was only weird because the place was empty. As we followed the host to the table I quietly let her know it was our friend&#39;s birthday and if they could come embarass her it would be great.  We were seated, and our server was mediocre at best seemingly slow when again they were relatively empty. Our glasses were less than half full or empty most of the night and she messed up our order. It took me almost 15 min to get her attention to ask her if she could fix the order. She apologized and said she would put in a new correct order. Another 20 min went by and my correct order finally showed up, after everyone else had already finished their food. Not only that, but my food was completely bland and it irritated me further knowing I waited for bad food. <br><br>More time went by and finally our server returned.
