Rather than showing up with a slice of cheesecake a birthday song (which we had seen 4 other groups of people partake in that nihgt) she just came by and said &#34;I heard there&#39;s a birthday, you guys should order some desert.&#34; Well, not only did this ruin the fact that we were trying to surprise our friend, but by that point we were ready to leave. <br><br>Needless to say, we will not be returning.

With the many other choices in the same area, I think Cheesecake Factory is surviving on their name alone, not necessarily because they have amazing food. Service was solid, food was ok..but nothing special here. Our flatbread was burned on one side so that was disappointing.

My theory is that people read the hundred-page menu and see the advertisements for things they&#39;ll never be able to afford and think &#34;Hey, rich people must eat here because they advertise in the menu... I&#39;m fitting in with the upper-crust!&#34; when in actuality the place is bogus and overloads you with food that&#39;s just on the better side of okay.  <br><br>I&#39;ve never made it to the dessert round because I tend to fill up on weak drinks trying to catch a  buzz so I can get philosophical and come up with a good reason why - again - I&#39;m eating at the Cheesecake Factory.

Most things about the Cheesecake Factory are a little more meh than a-ok but for my dinner last night I will go with three stars as follows...<br><br>+ 1 star for a huge patio with misters that was somehow comfortably cool on a sweltering near-100-degree Sunday afternoon. Much better than the frigid ice chest inside. The people watching is pretty hilarious...both the patio patrons and 16th Street.<br><br>+ 1 star for the extensive menu options featuring ahi. For some reason I was in the mood for ahi and not having eaten at the Cheesecake Factory more than twice in my life, I wasn&#39;t sure if their huge phone book of a menu could deliver. But it did! Ahi tartare, ahi carpaccio, ahi tempura rolls, wasabi crusted ahi and an ahi salad almost all made it onto my plate. I went with the salad and it was fresh and light with avocado, tomato, mixed greens, ginger and a soy drizzle. Nothing earth shattering but fed my craving.<br><br>+ 1 star for our friends who suggested dining here on their dime...thank you for saving up years of gift cards! Because otherwise I wouldn&#39;t have been tempted to come here. The portions were even more disgustingly huge than I remembered. My husband&#39;s cobb salad could have easily fed all four of us. The ads in the menu book are as off-putting as the 1500-2000+ calorie count on most dishes.

What makes this place so popular? I just don&#39;t get it. The food sucks. I mean, really really sucks. And they give you a TON of it also. I came here on New Years Day because nothing else was open and I needed something to nurse my hangover. (Yes, I know I&#39;m a bit late on this review).  Sadly I felt sicker leaving then I did coming in. <br><br>The only redeeming quality of this place is the cheesecake. It is phenomenal. Next time, I&#39;ll just take that to go.

We went there after work on May 5th for my birthday!!! The staff was very nice.. and the Lisa fudge cake was freaking amazing! The drinks were very good! Never been there before but for the first time I really enjoyed it!! And I will be going back.. and I really hope for the rest of my life to eat the Lisa fudge cake on my birthday!!!  YUMMY!!!
Slow slow slow service. No attention to drink refills, have seen out waitperson once. At least the food was good.

Hm...<br><br>You know I don&#39;t think I would dislike this place as much if it weren&#39;t so damn popular and busy at every instant. This is one of those places where your out-of-town relatives that don&#39;t quite know your tastes well enough want to take you when they want to do something nice for you. Instead, what you get it is...well<br><br>1:Long wait<br>2:Cramped tables<br>3:Long wait again for your waiter/waitress<br>4:A huge menu with...........ADVERTISEMENTS?!! wtf...<br>5:Food is mediocore but priced like it isn&#39;t<br>6:And well the cheesecake? They give you so much food that it seriously hurts to try and fit that last fat and sugar block down your throat.<br><br>Ouch.

Everything is made of marble, so it was very loud.  I could literally hear forks being placed on tables across the restaurant. <br><br>Nearly every table had kids at it... I brought my girlfriend to celebrate having dated for 3 years and we were sat next to the worse possible table.  Two women discussing how awful men are and how they are unable to get one, while their two kids screamed and ran around, literally falling into me.<br><br>The meal was mediocre at best.  This was the second time I have been, and the second time the food has been more of a disappointment.  I don&#39;t think I will return.

I LOVE this place. I know it&#39;s a chain. I know it&#39;s always busy. I know it&#39;s always loud.<br>But gosh darn it, I LOVE IT! I don&#39;t get here very often - there are just too many other wonders of the taste buds to experience...<br>But I do tend to lean in the direction when my birthday comes around and i want to go someplace &#34;special&#34; with a group.<br><br>I never branch out - even with the 1800 page menu - I always get the Thai chicken pasta and I love it. I always have left overs - this time enough for 3 days of lunches! Ooofa! I love the JW Pink Lemondade - seriously how can you go wrong with sugar on the rim?  :)<br>I also adore the avocado egg rolls. And the sauce for dipping... Mmmmm!  The one thing i do bounce around on is the cheesecake. So much yummy, so little time!<br>This time i did the Kahlua something or other... mmmmm!<br><br>The one bummer was no reservations. I showed up 1/2 an hour early to ensure my group of 6 would be able to be seated at 7pm! I guess they are used to having tons of people, so why hold a table.<br><br>I like the bar. The waitstaff has always been great. The service wonderful.<br><br>And 16th street mall venue - lives up to all my expectations!

I have never had a bad meal at The Cheesecake Factory in the 10+ years I have been going.<br><br>Their prices do seems to creep up a little bit every year, but I guess you get what you pay for. This is the type of restaurant that I fall back on when I can&#39;t think of anywhere else to go, or if I need to accommodate a wide variety of food preferences-- steak, fish, pasta, salads, Mexican, Asian, burgers, sandwiches, meatloaf....<br><br>The patio is so fun for people watching. I once was seated outside right after an undercover police officer (dining at Cheesecake) tackled a suspect walking by him on 16th street mall. Or maybe the suspect was eating at Cheesecake... either way, talk about dinner and a show!<br><br>The servers at this particular location are ALWAYS really friendly and attentive, and they don&#39;t judge you if you order cheesecake to eat there... and another piece to take home.<br><br>Chocolate Tuxedo is my favorite cheesecake... but their carrot cake is something that I crave ALL THE TIME. One time I thought about buying a whole carrot cake, but I used better judgment and decided not to (but I would definitely win in a Cheesecake Factory carrot cake eating contest). <br><br>Definitely go here if you can&#39;t decide what you&#39;re in the mood for, you&#39;ll find something here. If you don&#39;t, you&#39;re weird. And I judge you.

What is up with all of these other negative reviews? I don&#39;t get why there are SO many negative ones and the two most popular complaints are the portions are too big and the menu has advertisements. Lame. <br><br>The food is yummy like all restaurants in the chain and the wait is long here due to it&#39;s location. The ambiance is raucous do to the location and tourists. I noticed things didn&#39;t look super clean. <br><br>Oh by the way - to the 90% of Colorado residents who were not actually born here - don&#39;t whine about tourists and out of town guests. If you don&#39;t like out of towners move to where they don&#39;t have any, I don&#39;t want to hear about it.<br><br>New rule: Don&#39;t review restaurants when you are hungover. Blyuuaack!<br><br>Gosh I am cranky! Don&#39;t take it personal. This CF falls short of the better representatives in their chain (Palo Alt, CA) so they miss their max of 4 stars by one.

They put wheat bread croutons in a salad that&#39;s ordered from the gluten free menu.  One person in our party had ordered rib eye steak and it came out cold.  However the manager tried to make up for it by heating the steak up and fixing the salad

What I had?  Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta (Honey Glazed Chicken, Asparagus, Red and Yellow Peppers, Peas, Garlic and Onion in a Spicy Chipotle Parmesan Cream Sauce)<br><br>Food review:  So, this dish caught me off guard at first as I was expecting  the chipotle bit to make this more of a southwestern type of spicy.  It actually was a sweet and spicy dish.  After digging into it a bit more, however, I rather enjoyed it.  No complaints about any of the ingredients involved.  Everything was pretty solid<br><br>Service?  A bit on the slow side due to being understaffed.  I imagine they were probably thinking it wasn&#39;t going to be that busy on a Tuesday night at the downtown Cheesecake Factory.  I certainly thought that.  :-s  Probably would have gave the experience 4 stars if they had more staff<br><br>NOTE:  Would like to note that I went here for dinner this go around.  I think that makes a difference.  My Cheesecake Factory experiences at lunch time have been decent to just not good.

GLUTTONY FACTORY<br><br>Nutritionally, Cheesecake Factory is calorie hell because of the &#34;Big Gulp&#34; theory: huge plates of food drowning in fatty sauces and/or cheese. This appeals to the American &#34;more for the money&#34; theory. There are smaller portions available for just a dollar or two less.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory hides their nutritional information under lock-and-key, as does Quiznos (also known for excessive fat and sugar content and high calorie products).<br>A slice of the basic CF cheesecake has 1,150 calories, and 74 grams of fat. 317 minutes of walking, anyone?<br>Carrot cake&#39;s healthy, right? Not at 1,560 calories and 84 grams of fat per slice.<br>A cook at <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2FRecipeZaar.com&amp;s=d0dfeb16559f22da994c46fe3a5759af69beb53293b3e4433dfb0171b3886a21" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">RecipeZaar.com</a> recreated the Pasta Da Vinci, and came up with 3,736 calories and 165 grams of fat.<br>The Weight Management California Salad, which has only -- only? -- 43 grams of fat.<br><br>Read all about it in the article &#34;Calorie Pusher Comes To Town&#34;<br><a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2Fbqwhao&amp;s=0c892675e2409b3e02d57d452bf776f875e1bc07f8a636a248f5ba6717e69099" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">tinyurl.com/bqwhao</a><br><br>HERE&#39;S THE REAL REASON TO STAY AWAY: The Cheesecake Factory is a charitable disaster. Speak to any development officer at charities in Denver and you&#39;ll find out the CF doesn&#39;t pump one dime, one in-kind gift certificate, one slice of fatty/fuffy/pasty cheesecake into Denver&#39;s active charitable community. BUT after the Breast Cancer Walk, the place is packed. Go figure.<br><br>On the other hand, when Maggiano&#39;s moved into town, their PR machine cranked out letters to all the major charities letting them know when to submit their requests for participation, rules for sponsorship, and the amount of cash and in-kind participation available for the year. Maggiano&#39;s is a community-involvement powerhouse and has much better food.<br><br>The kids at Cheesecake Factory are pleasant and hard working. I just can&#39;t recommend that corporate culture and unhealthy slop.

the wait for a table of 4 was way too long, so we only wanted dessert and we took it to go, at almost 8 bucks a slice for dessert, i dont think they should be serving frozen items,  i kid you not, the point was fine, but as i kept eating, it was crystaled and hard frozen. if i wanted frozen over fresh, i would have went to costco for a cheesecake factory box of slices.

This is one of the few places I can eat with my allergies to preservatives.  Complain all you want about it being a chain or too corporate, I appriciate restaurants that use real food.  The vegetables in the salads are all freshly cut, not from a bag which are treated with preservatives.  They are accomodating with replacements and always happy and helpful.  Going there tonight for my birthday dinner :)

I went to Cheesecake Factory with my friend this weekend as part of our girl&#39;s getaway weekend. We ordered a slice of Carrot Cake to go, and asked if getting extra frosting on the side was possible. We were told it was, but when we got back to the hotel we realized it was COVERED in whipped cream and not frosting. <br><br>My friend called the store and spoke with the restaurant manager. Since it was already pretty late the manager said he would bring us replacement slices (we only bought 1 slice so he replaced the one that was ruined and also brought us another slice!) and delivered it to our hotel! We were incredibly impressed that he went out of his way to make things right, and for that you get 5 stars!

I will start by saying I was very appreciative when they were able to accommodate our large party an hour earlier than our reservation time. I also greatly enjoyed the fried catfish, and the wine was reasonably priced. Service was a tad slow, but this seemed to be an issue at the bar and not our server&#39;s fault. The women&#39;s bathroom was appalling, though. Overall, I would go back, but I hope it&#39;s a little cleaner.

I can&#39;t imagine anyone reads reviews for chain restaurants, but here goes anyway. The cheesecake is obviously good, if not awesome. The dinner menu is huge and disappointing. <br><br>The bar is nice but small. Patio is very attracted to the homeless element.

How can any restaurant that has this large of a menu with this many items be able to make even one single dish WELL??  Nasty food every time I&#39;ve been here.  I imagine a huge freezer of frozen things and tons of cooks flash-frying or microwaving every dish.<br><br>No thanks!

You can never go wrong with a cheesecake factory restaurant if you are out of town.  I always order from the small plate menu, since I don&#39;t eat a lot.  Yes, I am weird-i don&#39;t eat crab-legs but I eat crab-cakes which is one of my favorites here as well as the fried zucchini sticks. Eating half of each and drinking the passion tea which tastes like the tea I get from Hawaii, is the bomb. I only get cheesecake when I am at home, because eating it while on the road isn&#39;t so great for my stomach.<br><br>Since note this place was cold as hell, I was freezing.

The Cheesecake factory is always a pretty safe bet. This is a good location and the food was great. I had the beet goat cheese salad and orange chicken. The service however has suffered. Many employees playing games with each other instead of taking care of customers. We never did see a Manager during our entire visit. No supervision that we could see.

You know what, this is comfort food. If you don&#39;t like comfort food and HUGE portions, then don&#39;t come here! Their shrimp scampi is one of my favorites. Wish it didnt go up in price, but inflation is REAL. I like their happy hour! You can get a good deal on DEEP FRIED COMFORT FOOD. Their Chicken Fried Wonton crisps are soooo good. It&#39;s the best of hot chicken wings without the bone.  DO NOT ORDER their sliders. They are so whack. You know those microwave white castle burgers you might have had as a kid from the frozen section? You might as well call it that. Presentation and bun quality is whack for this one which is so weird for a place with comfort food right? Their southwestern eggrolls are tasty! Their cheesecake is good too, but I rarely get it since I dont have much of a sweet tooth. I dont know what else is good here. Lemme know! I want to know! I&#39;ve also had their chicken lettuce wraps and it was enough to share between two women and we were happy afterwards!

I think that the Cheesecake Factory may be partly responsible for the nation&#39;s obesity crisis. Their portions are gargantuan, and the sad thing is that people actually enjoy this food. I will give them this, their service is great and the staff is always friendly. The patio does offer great people watching on 16th Street Mall, but these aspects don&#39;t outweigh that you will end up eating your own weight in un-flavorful, generic food. Walk around the corner into Larimer Square for some truly wonderful food that won&#39;t force you to change into your buffet pants after your dinner.

I LOVE CHEESE CAKE FACTORY RESTAURANTS. I&#39;ve been to 5 differen locations all over the states. I write a review for this one because I&#39;ve been there over 10 times. Great food, I love their menu,so many choices of every kind of food and i love the opening hours. You can go any time and have great food and service. Huge selection of desserts, coctails, salads ( Cobb salad- the best ).....<br>This place have everything that you can think of and you don&#39;t have to wail till 5pm to open. <br>it&#39;s not expensive and their meals are so big so you can share and try more of their delicious food.

The cheesecake here is good, the food all right, and the service leaves something to be desired. I have been to this location on a few different occasions, and each time it&#39;s about the same kind of experience. The food isn&#39;t all that great, and the servers usually take a while to bring food and drinks to the table. In the front of the restaurant by the bar, I feel like they crammed as many tables along the wall as possible because you practically have to stick your butt in another diner&#39;s face to get into the seats. While, for a chain restaurant, this is a pretty decent place, it could still use some work. <br>However, the cheesecake is pretty much delicious. Maybe next time I&#39;ll just buy a whole cheesecake and skip the restaurant part of the experience...
The service was very slow. Both mine and my friend&#39;s meals had food missing. When I did get me food it was inedible. Not recommended.

Hard to find parking unless you want to pay more for it than your meal.  1 star drop.<br><br>Now onto the best cheese cake and fettichini ever.... Love ya, just think you should validate parking in your building.  If you do talk with the rude security.  <br><br>Will give another star......

We came here last night after ice skating. We had to wait for 20 minutes for a table for six. Well, we had to sit in bar stools at the end and push two tiny tall tables together. The thing is that they had plenty of empty tables in the back but nobody was sitting there. I didn&#39;t feel like eating a large meal so I ordered some hot chocolate. It was $4. Everything here comes in large portions and higher prices (guess that&#39;s very American like). My friend ordered a regular slice of cheesecake but it was so sweet that he barely took a couple bites off it before he asked for a box to take home. Judging by the look on his face I would think he was eating his 8th or 9th slice in a cheesecake contest. LOL.The services was fast and friendly. That&#39;s about the only highlight.

FANFANFAN!<br><br>i was never much of a Cheesecake Factory fan.....but takeout for a large group who were working obscene hours--they were EXCELELELENT!!!!<br><br>sooooo on point with allllll the orders/sides/drinks/bread/desserts. I would recommend it!

This was a great cheesecake factory. The eggplant sandwich was huge and great, lots of cheese :) The tiramisu was perfect, espresso was not burnt, just right, The four cheese pasta was great. A person with us said the salmon and the navajo sandwich were awesome. Overall it was a great meal with friends and a great atmosphere. No complaints!

Terrible service! Sat for 20 minutes without any server even acknowledging us. It started to rain and while 3 servers stood at a podium drinking sodas and talking my husband had to drag the umbrella over to our table to shade us while the servers watched!!!! Food was bland!! The only thing we actually enjoyed was the avocado egg rolls!!

Pricey but very tasty. I had the Moroccan Chicken which was not spicy at all but very good. I also had Wild Blueberry cheesecake and Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Cheesecake. Both are great non wild flavors. Free bread to munch on before the food comes too. I have had dinner there twice the last few days. First time was great service; the second time was poor service. Just depends on the server I guess. Fun atmosphere and dining.

Regardless of the fact Cheescake Factory is a chain, I still love this place.  I&#39;ve made impromptu lunch, dinner and late night desert runs that have all led to a satisfying experience.  I like the 16th Street location as well, great people watching if you sit on the patio.<br><br>I&#39;m a fan of large portions, I have a major sweet tooth, and I love fresh warm bread... it&#39;s a ménage à trois of deliciousness and Cheesecake Factory is the eHarmony of cuisine.  It&#39;s hard to not find at least one thing you enjoy from their novel-like menu.  I feel like I&#39;ve just read the Lord of the Rings Trilogy after ordering my entree.  In all honesty, the food is moderately priced considering the portions, and I&#39;m a rather frugal individual.  The drinks, however, not so much.<br><br>Next comes my favorite portion of the meal... dessert.  I&#39;ve even ordered it first then had dinner - give it a shot to mix things up if you&#39;re so inclined.  I&#39;m a huge cheesecake fan and have probably tasted at least half of their cheesecake menu (30+ selections in total) with my favorite being the Caramel Pecan Turtle.  Depending on your tastes they&#39;re all quite phenomenal; as they should be if it&#39;s in the name of the restaurant.<br><br>I&#39;ll admit one major flaw is the typical long wait you&#39;ll experience on weekends or holidays.  So if you&#39;re looking to get in and out without enjoying your food, then by all means stay clear from the Cheesecake Factory.  Otherwise, kick back and enjoy the wide selection of food, good company, and relaxing atmosphere.

If I could give this place 3.5 stars, I would... but I just can&#39;t give it 4 based on the quality of the food. If there is one thing I took away from my meal here it&#39;s that people in Denver are REALLY nice!<br><br>We came here in our break between hotel check out and our flight home from DIA. Luckily they seated us somewhere where we had space for our luggage--big plus! We ordered an appetizer (boneless wings) and my husband got a salad, while I got their soup and salad lunch. Unfortunately, our salads (and my soup) came out... before our appetizer. A few seconds later, our appetizer came. I was annoyed, but I wasn&#39;t going to push the issue... it is what it is, whatever. But the guy who delivered the appetizers apologized to us. Then our waitress came, and she apologized as well. And THEN the manager came over, and he apologized. They felt really bad! Unfortunately, my food was not very good. The salad was very bitter, and the broccoli cheddar soup tasted like thick broccoli water. Bummer. My hubby&#39;s salad was better--a staple of ours when we visit other cheesecake factories. Overall, it was mehh. <br><br>But then the bill came. And wouldn&#39;t you know it... they comped the appetizer! Unnecessary, but amazing! And, in sum, people in Denver are SO NICE!!
Pretty good food. Huge portions, but kind of lacks the charm of many of Denver&#39;s smaller restaurants.

Food was tasty though they got my order wrong and when I told the waitress she didnt seem to care much. S&#39;mores cheesecake was delicious and so was the raspberry lemonade. And our silver ware was really really dirty.

We were one of the first tables in this morning. Took over 10 mins to get greeted. Fb ordered omelet and I ordered Bfast sandwich. 40 mins later I got my sandwich and they brought wrong omelet to bf. It belonged to table behind us. Server was incompetent. We left without my bf even eating due to the fact we declined his food when it came out 15 mins later--55 mins after we ordered. The table behind us did the same thing. Horrible experience. Manager very rude and dismissive

This place is disgusting and dirty!! I never seen a cheesecake factory soo nasty! The waiter took our drink order and disappeared for 15mins and got an attitude when my husband asked for cleaner utensils. It doesn&#39;t smell clean at all...This place need to get shut down asap

I am not so much into Cheesecake like I used to be. I prefer to try to eat lighter things these days. Therefore I don&#39;t go to this place too much, however the pasta dishes and the cheesecake that I did have from here I always enjoyed.

What can I say, it&#39;s a chain.  The overall consensus between the three of us was: &#34;I&#39;m so full&#34;...painfully so!  Thus, the portion sizes are rather large.  The deception was when the waiter said, &#34;I will bring you some fresh bread from the oven in just a few moments.&#34;  Warmed in the oven, maybe.  Fresh-baked, not!  The drinks were good, the salmon great, chicken ok, burger great.  There were a few mishaps with our orders (i.e., the rotating salad that kept coming back to our table) and the wait on wine, but otherwise, everything was good, especially the cheesecake!

Needing a lunch spot downtown I popped in here with a client yesterday. We were seated right away and brought water and then the server disappeared for nearly 10 minutes. That&#39;s to long for lunch vs a leisurely dinner. <br>So we ordered and the food came quickly. I had their chicken salad sandwich with a side salad. It was very good and enough for 2 meals. I just ate the 1/2 half. <br>Overall, ok, but the server was just a little weird.

I wish I could put 0 stars here. Well, 1 star for a good waiter, I guess. We came with a family for pre Christmas dinner for 4. 2 dishes with pasta and shrimp were not good $18 each, i ordered steak coutlion with asparagus $20 was like a rubber impossible to chew ( and I have all my natural teeth). The steak was on the plate with its sauce and inside that sauce there was a dirty cast iron pan with asparagus which they pulled  out of the oven. Ther was no salt or spices on any of them. <br>My husband ordered chicken with busquits and gravy. Chicken was ok but the rest was not good, not enough gravy.<br>We ordered 2 appitizers. One was calamari and another one was mini crabcakes. Crabcakes fell apart when we tried to pull them put of the serving plate. Calamari were separate from breading - most part of it. <br>3 margaritas were full if sugar not tequila. $10 each!<br>Our bill was $140, we had to leave $30 for tip. $170 for a dinner which didn&#39;t even worth it. Never, never go there!

Most of the Cheesecake Factories I&#39;ve visited are on the East Coast and based on a rather unscientific survey I&#39;d rank this one at the top. Food was good...there were four of us, and we started with the yummy potstickers as appetizers. one of whom had the chopped steak, another who tried a whitefish dish, another with a 12 oz steak over rice and me who had a lightly dipped batter fried chicken over pasta with pesto. While my dish was a bit oily I heard raves about the fish and chopped steak. Portions for all of us were very large - we all ended up taking something home.<br><br>For the desserts...one of us had Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake but required the assistance of the other three to finish. The rest of us partook of the Dutch Apple Caramel Struesel variety, rich and tasty and a perfect complement to our meals. Food was clearly above average and a better than what I&#39;ve found in most of this chain&#39;s restaurants. What really distinguished this one, though, was our service. Generally the biggest knock I have against the Cheesecake Factory is its very slow service; however this one was a welcome exception. Elizabeth W., our server, was impressive in every respect, from her promptness, to the way she anticipated and answered our questions, to her knowledge of the menu. The entire company could take lessons from her. Very impressive.

I remember going to a Cheesecake Factory in Chicago and it was on par with the one in Denver.<br><br>The food is mass-produced, the cheesecake is ridiculously sweet to the point it hurts the teeth  and frankly there are so many better options in the area.

This started off with an extremely targeted trip over to cheesecake so that we can celebrate a holiday that&#39;s all cheese. <br>And what can I say... the cheesecake wasn&#39;t great. So why the four stars? Because the service was amazing. It really was. We had to go back for an extremely special request and everybody, especially the manager, really went out of their way. <br><br>It actully makes me want to give the cheesecake another chance.

Our most recent visit to the Cheesecake Factory was no disappointment. Although it was very, very busy, we got a table for two right away. The service was very prompt and the wait for our food was quite short.<br><br>They customized my husbands plate with no upcharge. He had sesame shrimp with cashews that was out of this world. Their skinnylicious plates are fantastic. I had the beets and goat cheese salad along with the bleu cheese and pear flatbread. Yummy! <br><br>We took a piece if chocolate cake to go that lasted us two days. It was just as delicious as it was large. And it was large!

The place is beautiful but the lights are so dim you can barely read the menu. It was also very noisy.....we must have heard at least 15 dishes break just while we were there.  The menu is 20 pages long and a bit overwhelming.  I would expect to see Italian and American food but I don&#39;t usually associate Mexican, Thai, Chinese and Irish food with cheesecake.  The cheesecake was delicious though!

When you can&#39;t figure out where to eat, this is the place to come because they have such an extensive menu. I always order something different and it is always great, not to mention all the different cheese cakes to choose from. My only complaint is that I always overeat when I come here, which is my own doing, but I can&#39;t help myself.

The Cheesecake Factory at Denver is extremely busy. So if you go on a weekend night be prepared to wait. It took us almost 30 minutes to get seated. But luckily its on the 16th street mall and so you can walk around as they provide you a pager.<br><br>It might not look it from the outside but the restaurant is huge and goes pretty far into the back. So dont look for an intimate setting - the restaurant is very busy and so noisy too.<br><br>The reason I liked this restaurant is that they have food for everyone. They have a few chinese dishes, american fare as well as italian. The prices on most dishes range from $15 to $20 and the portions are huge (you will most definetly have to take some back home).<br><br>The waiters were nice, though a little busy and so running around a lot. But we never had to wait for a very long time.<br><br>Finally, if you go to this restaurant, you must definetly have one of their cheesecakes. The Tiramisu cheescake is definetly awesome. These range in price from about $6.50 to $8.50). Again the slices and pretty big and you will most probably be taking some home.<br><br>The alcohol was a little on the expensive side (a beer was $6.50) and so were their cocktails.<br><br>On sundays, they are open for break-fast.<br><br>I would definetly go there once again, but only as a group. Definetly not a romantic place for a couple. The desserts make it extremely kid friendly.

Went back to the cheesecake factory for my bachelorette party.... our server was the BEST i have ever had. Compared to my last visit here it was night and day. Our server learned everyone&#39;s names... very impressive. Food was great and service was better then expected. Our server made our experience relaxed and fun. <br><br>My conclusion: who you get as your server here makes all the difference!!

Had lunch here on a Saturday afternoon.  We sat on the patio and it was great.  Our waiter (Conner) was great at suggesting new items and they were great.  I had the Miso Salmon and my wife had the Macaronni Cheese Burger.  Of course we ended with a slice of cheese cake.  Everything was great.   I will definitely be back.

Took my wife, two daughters and a son-in-law before the CO symphony last Friday night.  My wife&#39;s salad had quite a bit of old, smelly smelling greens (she is trying to get over ordering salads out...), the bacon on the son in law&#39;s was burned and half the crust of the daughter&#39;s pizza was burned.  The salmon dish was fine as was my meat loaf.  But too many things wrong for $150 including tip. I wish people had spoken up but since we had to keep moving due to the concert, no one said anything!!  Pretty disappointed...  Dessert was good - shared one slice...  DT

Great place if all you&#39;re looking for is cheesecake but they have no clue how to make 1/2 of what&#39;s on their menu, the carpaccio was awful! It was more like chunks of raw steak rather than thinly sliced beef.

I love the Cheesecake Factory!! I have been to quite a few throughout the country and have been coming to this location for years- it is wonderful! The menu is extensive, the food is always awesome, the staff is friendly and the cheesecake... oh the cheesecake!  I wouldn&#39;t have thought to that it was a place to go for drinks, but their drinks are really really good! They are mixed well and pack a punch. <br><br>The only downside to this location is that everyone else loves it too- if you go anywhere from 5p-9p on a Friday or Saturday, be prepared to wait for a bit, although they usually tell you that the wait is longer than it actually is. Always a great experience!
WELL worth ANY WAIT!!<br>avacado eggrolls to die for.<br>Fave is the Sheppard&#39;s pie, but you can&#39;t go wrong with anything one the menu.<br>And it&#39;s the season for pumpkin cheesecake

Incredible atmosphere for parties of all sizes from intimate dinner for two to a big birthday party group! I personally love how the variety of table tops to choose from including a great patio right along the 16th Street Mall. Pricey... for sure but servings are plentiful so expect to take leftovers home regardless of what you order. And don&#39;t hesitate to order the lemonade which is very delicious!

The food was okay, but the server ripped me and my family off. We had a large party and paid on two credit cards with a couple hundred in cash. The total we paid was enough for the bill, the 18% gratuity they added in PLUS another $10 because our family always tips at least 20%. Even with our generosity, they added another $10 to each credit card tab and processed it even after we crossed off their addition and wrote in the correct total. Giving yourself a 30% tip is fraud. I wouldn&#39;t recommend that you to there with a large table and pay for any of your bill with cash unless you also want to be stolen from.

Had guests in town for the weekend and they wanted to eat at the Cheesecake Factory. We stopped in for lunch on a saturday. It was crowded as always but we only had a half hour wait. Our sever was pleasant but had trouble remembering our order and for some reason would not write anything down. After a couple of errors we got our food. Everything looked great but everything was also cold but we ere so busy talking that we didn&#39;t mention to each other that the food was cold. Probably be o point in complaining though. Lunch for four came to $163.00 without the cheesecake. Hope I don&#39;t have to go back.

Stopped in for Lunch and even though the place seemed busy we were seated quite quickly .  The menu is always a chore to work through, although when you finally decide what cuisine you are going to order the food is generally good and you get a lot.  Be prepared to eat about half, or share  so you can save room for the cheese cake, which is why we go in the first place. <br>Good food and service.  Can satisfy various pallets.  Kid and adult friendly, nice place to go if you just want good.

Worst food and service ever experienced at a Cheesecake Factory!  On my visit to Denver, my friend wanted to go here for his birthday since they didn&#39;t have any in his hometown or where he currently lives.  All our Canadian friends were excited because there isn&#39;t one in Canada either.  I had the lunch portion Miso Salmon and my rice was very undercooked.  Asking for more miso sauce to moisten it so that I could choke it down didn&#39;t help.  I ended up asking for them to remake my order and they just brought me a side of rice, which was equally undercooked.  My friend had ordered the chicken tacos and they gave her fish tacos--after eating one, she realized that it didn&#39;t look right or taste the same so they took it back and brought her the right order.  Another girl I was with ordered a southwest chicken sandwich, they had set a chicken salad sandwich down in front of her and called it the southwest.  She took a couple bites and noticed it wasn&#39;t spicy nor did it have avocado in it.  Everyone received their food and my friend&#39;s little sister never gotten hers.  Guess what?  She had ordered the chicken salad sandwich so they rushed her order and offered to make the other friend a southwest chicken sandwich, but she didn&#39;t want it and had them take it off the bill.  I know there was about nine of us, but get your shit together Cheesecake Factory!

Love the cheesecake. I don&#39;t eat anything else here!   Servers don&#39;t seem to have a problem with people just interested in dessert.  Tipped 2 bucks (one for each cake) and left after about 20 minutes.

I went there last night with a gf. Niether one had been there in awhile and really love the food there. We started out with a Martini each. Wow they were good but h*&amp;^y cow really $12 each???  Skyy Vodka was used and again it was good but not $12 good. <br><br>I had the Vietnamese Tacos which were excellent. Soft bread with pork you should never go wrong. My gf had the sliders. Ha ha enough said as long as the beef is cooked. <br><br>Service was okay. Had to ask for bread and water which is unusal. <br><br>I will of course go there again but skip the expensive drinks and spend it on the food.

We came on a quiet Sunday afternoon around 2:45, our server was prompt and helpful.  After she took our order, it took 30 minutes for my husbands food to appear, 10 minutes after that the rest of our table&#39;s food started to trickle in slowly.  After 15 minutes the manager came out and said my food was undercooked and would be out in 5 more minutes.  At no point during this time did anyone offer to do anything helpful, by the time my food actually arrived my family was done eating.  Their menu is too big and full of ads, the food is mediocre at best, and the management is unconcerned with keeping business.  Unfortunately, our server was great, but is subject to the poor kitchen service and their inability to send out an entire tables food at one time.  Save yourselves, buy their cheesecake from the grocery and eat at any of the 100s of delicious restaurants in Denver.
Cheesecake factory is always good.  Service this time was excellent.  Waitress Catalina is amazing. Working her way through school request her. Food was good steak diane and lindas fudge cake...

This has always been one of my favorites since I was a child. It was my first choice for my annual birthday dinner along with The Old Spaghetti Factory. That one has went quickly downhill over the years, but not Cheesecake Factory. It serves high quality everything. I have been all over the menu. I have yet to find something I don&#39;t like. As a child. I would always get the Four Cheese Pasta. Penne Pasta, Mozzarella, Ricotta, Romano and Parmesan Cheeses, Marinara Sauce and Fresh Basil. Also served with Chicken. This is one of the reasons I weighed over 300 lbs. Around 15 years old I realized what carbohydrates are and stopped eating it til I lost some weight.  Anyway, this is a decadent and rich plate of unhealthiness. With 30 grams of saturated fat, 1900 milligrams of sodium and 134 grams of carbs, this is one of the worst things you can put in your body. I don&#39;t care. It&#39;s delicious.  I recently went with my girlfriend. She ordered the teriyaki chicken. I rolled my eyes. &#34;Really... Teriyaki chicken. We have all these great pastas, steaks and seafood, and you choose teriyaki chicken.&#34; I said. I&#39;m not a huge fan of any teriyaki. I thought it would be a waste of a trip to order an out of place item like that. Boy was I wrong! This was the most amazing piece of chicken I have ever had. From the grilled pineapple to the perfect char on the chicken to the tender and moist inside of the meat. It was a masterpiece served with steamed rice. I ordered the Farfalle with Chicken and Roasted Garlic. Bow-Tie Pasta, Chicken, Mushrooms, Tomato, Pancetta, Peas and Caramelized Onions in a Roasted Garlic-Parmesan Cream Sauce. It was fantastic. Creamy and savory. A dish with perfect harmony. I was surprised by the cheese sticks. Obviously made in-house. Not your typical cheese sticks. Very good. I&#39;ve been there many times and had many dishes. I wont describe all of them . Just know, they are all good. Of course I have to mention the cheesecakes. As Eugene Struthers would say. They take it to a whole nutha level. (google it if you don&#39;t remember Madtv) Always rich (very rich) and sweet. Sometime it&#39;s hard to save room with the ginormous portions of the entrees. Very generous. They do have smaller/half portions available for some items. All in all, a great place. Good for a casual lunch while roaming the mall on the weekend, a shnazy date  or a special occasion like an anniversary.

How the heck this place is always packed and serves such average food is beyond me.  Their menu is massive which is nice but I&#39;m sure that&#39;s why the food sucks.  Everything tastes pre made, frozen and or out of a bag

We celebrated my moms 60th birthday saturday. We had had over 20 family members. The restuarants staff was amazing. Everyone from hostess staff to the busboy was great. The two waitress&#39;s we had were unbelievable. Thanks for a memorable birthday for my mom!!!

This place is very pricey and not-so-healthy but it certainly is great to go to for a good time. I love cheesecake and it&#39;s not so hard to make but there is something about looking at all the choices they offer. The food itself is fine, just a bit oversized and really, you come here for the cheesecake.

I&#39;ve never had a bad experience at the Cheesecake Factory, so I had a group of about 15 friends who met up there for my birthday. We called ahead in planning and I heard my wife tell the server it was a special night for my 30th birthday, but the server / staff didn&#39;t seem to care. They were rather dull actually. We were a fun bunch so we still had a good time -- definitely more fun than our wait staff. The food was good as usual, but no birthday song, no dessert with candles (certainly not cheesecake), nothing special. If you&#39;re looking to celebrate your birthday w a group of friends someplace else might be more fun. We did hear other tables receive such favor, so maybe it was just our server?

Great atmosphere and great staff. The food is good but this is a ritzy place that just didn&#39;t cut it for me. Our waiter put up with a lot of crap from my dinner guest and did so in an awesome way, that was my highlight. Food was good, but not stellar and that&#39;s kind of what I expected from almost $200 for 4 people. As for it being my first visit, I was as amazed as I thought I was going to be. I&#39;ll go back, but only when I feel like dropping even more money to see if they can amaze me then! Overall...good stuff

I had my daughter&#39;s first birthday there.  They let me bring cake and decorations and even let me come in a bit early to set up (after I begged a bit!).  The result was a beautiful, family friendly dining place that made for a lovely, memorable birthday.  I could not have picked a better place!  They were so patient with all of us and we aren&#39;t the easiest bunch!  Friendly, but not the easiest!

The food here is okay, just okay. The prices are a little overboard for what you get. I know a place call The Cheesecake Factory should have amazing cheesecake but in reality it&#39;s mediocre, especially for the price ($25 for an eight-inch?!). All in all this would be a place to avoid there are much better options around if you have the time or desire to look.

I used to love Cheesecake Factory.  I always got the chicken picatta.  It is tasty, the cheesecake is awesome.  However, I recently got the chance to dine here again and I spent quite a bit of time afterward puking!  I can not recall ever being so sick before, or at least not for a very long time.  I don&#39;t know if the chicken was bad or undercooked or what. Perhaps I ate something prior that did it.  All I know is that if you puke up all of your dinner, chances are you won&#39;t want it ever again.  Sorry Cheesecake factory, if I ever go there again it won&#39;t be for a very very very long time.
Over priced food. Mediocre quality. Only things I like are the cheesecake and ultimate margaritas.

I came to lunch with 2 of my friends today, literally still sitting here waiting or the bill...all of our food came out at separate times- mine 15 minutes after the others came out. Too bad I wanted to have lunch WITH my friends! Instead of an apology I was told 5 times &#34;it&#39;s coming!&#34; I&#39;m extremely disappointed! Im in the industry and understand that things happen but this is ridiculous! Never offered any resolution, just excuses! Still waiting for that tab....

This restaurant used to be a favorite of mine; however it has changed since my last experience on Monday evening, August 3, 2015.  6 of us went to dinner, my food was cold, however since my grandchildren&#39;s food was warm and they did not have an issue, I ate.  My niece had a bottle of A1 explode into her plate and a server picked it up and said, &#34;so sorry, I&#39;ve never seen that happen, I will get another steak out right away and will take this off the bill.&#34;  Well, needless to say, my niece did not get a new steak right away, by the time her steak came out, every one of us had finished eating, when the steak finally arrived it was burnt, she ordered it rare.  Well, she was so hungry I attempted to cut the burnt portions off so she could have some dinner.  When our bill arrived I was shocked it had 2 steak orders with 1 reversal; so they did not comp her dinner like promised.  I called the waitress back and she said, I am so sorry but I will have to check with the manager.  &#34;Alice&#34; a manager came to the table, she looked annoyed and began by saying, &#34;I have your check and would like to explain all your charges&#34;, and I said I don&#39;t have a problem with all the charges, just the Steak plate charges.  There should not have been a charge according to the waiter.  She said well I did not see the bottle &#34;magically&#34; break over the plate because I was cooking your food in the kitchen.  &#34;Magically, I said, what do you mean?  She said well she never heard of such a thing and she I am already paying for two steak dinners.  I said you are not paying for our meal, we can afford to pay for our dinner, I did not ask for the steak dinner to be comped; your waiter said it would be removed from the bill.  The more &#34;Alice&#34; opened her mouth the more condescending, rude and hateful she became.  I told her, enough already, I do not want to hear you say another word.  My brother in law is a kind man, he said, what are you calling us liars?  We both agree that &#34;Alice&#34; should not interact with the public.  What happened to the customer is always right?  What happened to treat people with respect and fairness?  I asked to speak to the general manger that night and was told it would be about 25 minutes as he was handling another customer complaint, so I got his card and left.  I called to report this incident on Tuesday morning, 08/04/15 however was asked to call back, so I asked if they could take my name and phone number and ask the GM, Ben to return my call, well it is Wednesday and no call back, I called this morning 08/05 at 11:00 am and was told Ben was unavailable again, so I left another message. I will update when Ben calls me back.Start your review...
The Cuban sandwich is solid.  Steaks are huge. And there&#39;s cheesecake. That&#39;s about it.

Absolutely terrible. Made reservations 2 days ahead for a birthday dinner at 7. Arrived at 6: 45, manager informed us the table would be ready in 20 minutes. 30 minutes later 2 tables in the open seating bar area opened up, but we were informed we could not sit there even though we had enough people to fill the seats. An hour later our original table was finally ready. Service was ok. However, our fries came out later than the meal, and were cold at that. After asking for our checks, the &#39; mandatory&#39; 18% gratuity was even applied. To top out off, our parking ticket that was &#39; validated&#39; required us to still pay for parking. Will NEVER return, and will advise others to avoid as well. At least 25 better dining alternatives within a 100 yard radius that would be a much better choice.

Do you enjoy savoring your food, truly enjoying it? Would prefer a small world-class meal over a mediocre trough full of food? <br><br>Well then, you have found the wrong place. <br><br>Against my better judgment (I was out numbered by far inferior palettes), I had dinner from there. I knew what I was getting myself into...read: teeny-booper fri/sat nite out: highschool date night: trashy weekend warriors - so perhaps my review shouldn&#39;t be SO harsh? Too bad, I&#39;m feeling saucy, they&#39;re catching a ration of $hit. <br><br>Facts: ungodly sized menu, literally a short novel, main characters and all - thus, that lends itself endless food options. Don&#39;t bother going on Fri/Sat nite, apparently CF has been doing some serious push marketing in Tiger beat, litered with whiny-barely-there-dressed pre-teens and their boy toys [thank mom &amp; dad for lending us the money!]. <br><br>I digress, food is at best a C-, I will give them a B+ for consistency. There&#39;s something to be said about managing expectations, and, well, they manage low expectations quite nicely. <br><br>Ok - There must be at least 5,000 restaurants in Denver, why here? On second thought, should you find yourself in the Hey-I-actually-really-like-Cheesecake-factory mindset, then do us all a favor and keep going there; I don&#39;t want to see your Coach-carrying, Aeropostale-wearing, make-up face complaining about your Pinot Grigio at one of my favorite establishments. <br><br>So, requesting a fly-by? Negative ghostrider, the pattern is full.

go to the cheesecake factory for the cheesecake.<br>they have an extensive EXTENSIVE menu with EXTENSIVE items of food. however, i&#39;ve rarely been impressed. and for not being impressed, that food is daaaaang expensive.<br>i do like the environment however, and the fact that it&#39;s on sixteenth, so i say stop in for some cheesecake. eat your dinner elsewhere, or, if you&#39;re like me, have a meal of cheesecake. and then try to go eat dinner later, and probably end up way too full. it is called  cheesecake factory, not extensive menu of food factory.

OK, chain restaurant aside, the Factory is great.  A little hard to get a quick seat but the food is worth it.  I have to admit that I usually get the same thing when I come here.  The Shrimp Scampi, if I could dive headfirst into the plate I would!   The cheesecake selection is well, large -try the Chocolate Chip Cookie-Dough cheesecake or the White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle cheesecake - YYYUUUMMM!

I ordered the crab cake sandwich last Saturday and it tasted great.  Unfortunately, I got really sick that night with diarrhea and vomiting.  Bummer.  The atmosphere and service were great.  Next time I will purchase nothing more than their cheesecake&#39;s.
Usually pretty busy and the service is pretty good.   But other than that nothing too special about this particular Cheesecake Factory.

late night sunday night after a hard weekend wedding, outside patio table in the nice denver summer night, brocolli and asparagus cheese soup, thai lettuce wraps, high quality h20, fresh bread , friendly server.

Pretty good overall. I got the seared ahi salad, which was pretty small for $16, but it was very well-cooked. My wife ordered some sort of chicken farafalle that was very delicious. Of course they had the bread, which is amazing as usual. I ordered a nice big 22oz. beer for about $6, which was a pretty sweet deal. A friend ordered a delicious looking burger and another ordered some very nice looking cheesecake. I really like this place and they are pretty consistent. I&#39;ve been to this location once before about four years ago.

If you&#39;re not in the mood to make decisions, don&#39;t eat here. The menu is extensive and I already have issues deciding what to eat when it&#39;s limited! The issue with such a diverse menu is that it tells me the restaurant doesn&#39;t specialize in anything. It just makes large amounts of food. Quantity doesn&#39;t always equal quality. However, the one thing this place does specialize in is their cheesecake and it doesn&#39;t disappoint! The pasta meal I ordered left something to be desired and had the typical olive garden, this sauce is too heavy for this meal type feel. The avocado egg rolls where a new venture for me and I liked them more for their novelty than for their greasy taste. They do offer over 50 options for cheesecake (decisions, decisions). I went with the white chocolate macademia nut (the waitress suggested it), and while it was yummy, it was also super rich. The tuxedo mousse cheesecake my friend had looked divine. The prices are what you&#39;d expect for one of these trendy chains but at of all the chain restaurants we visited in Denver, this was my favorite. The only thing I&#39;d like to add is that this place was dim. Infact, I think this was the darkest restaurant I&#39;ve ever eaten in. It&#39;s like the kind of place you take your mob associate or the person you&#39;re having an affair with. If you want to see the people you&#39;re with--or your food, this isn&#39;t your bag, baby. Yeah.

Terrible food, ours was cold and bland; terrible service, it takes forever to get your food even on a Tuesday night, and if you have any kind of food allergies, please avoid the Cheesecake Factory.  Despite the assurances they may offer over the phone, once you get there, they cannot accommodate you.

The Cheesecake Factory is an especially coveted Colorado eatery, but why?  Well, good &#39;ol fashioned American cuisine.  Huge portions, and...cheesecake of course.  Notorious.  I am tellin you.  If you have been in Coly for any amount of time, surely you have heard of this joint.  No complaints...well, watch out for calories.  Larger than life!  Good food though, my Dad likes this restaurant.
Food was amazing ! Service was great ! Had the Fettucini Alfredo with Chicken and it ws great ! Have always had a good experience here !

Not my favorite, but not the worst. The food was ok, and they do pile it high. This place is busier than it should be and would an ok place to stop if you were in the area, but you can usually expect a wait so... eh. I don&#39;t mind going with friends, but I don&#39;t suggest it either.

We could not get into Ocean Prime restaurant so we decided to stop in here...very busy for 8:30pm on a Saturday night. We were seated at 9pm and diner was served at 9:30ish. Daniel R was are server and was running his butt off keeping up with how busy every thing was. The inside of the restaurant is huge and must seat a few hundred people! My husband ordered the beef sliders and I had a giant Caesar salad and the Chicken Bellagio, way too much food but very tasty. Our server seemed like a good guy so no complainants there.  I love going down town however I think The Cheesecake Factory in Park Meadows is better.

I think there food was TERIBLE....maybe its because there trying to do way too many choices ??. We noticed last year after attending a downtown show...it was borderline just so-so......this past saturday Nov 24, 2012......7 of us went there......all of it was basically lousy....steaks were charbroiled (and thats an understatement).....I think when a group comes in and the bills over $350, when they explain the lousy experience.....you dont offer them a couple pieces of free pie (3 pieces actually.....for a group of 7.......yes, no kidding).....CHEAP SKATES. We wont be going there again.....rest assured of that.

I do love their cheesecakes...that&#39;s about it. <br><br>My boyfriend and I went there for a quick lunch..it took an entire hour for our entrees to be served. An hour! The cooks either forgot our order or the waiter did....salmon should be pretty fast to cook..no? It was not busy in the dining room, either. I hate their seating arrangement because you are literally 2 inches away from the next table. I want to eat lunch with my boyfriends..not with 2 other couples on both sides of me.<br><br>The salmon.....an hour later..was dry and overcooked. Blah!<br><br>A chain is a chain....but 2 stars for their cheescakes. I&#39;ll get it to go next time.

typically, i go to the location in park meadows mall, but i&#39;ve been to this one a few times as well. i never remember a difference between the food/service between the two locations.<br><br>my family is a HUGE fan of this place. i however, am kind of meh about it. the menu is huge so no matter what you&#39;re craving, you&#39;ll find something (they even have some lighter options for the calorie conscious). of course, the cheesecake is yummy. i remember when i used to eat beef, i was in looove with their burgers. <br><br>i&#39;ve been coming here since i was a little girl and i&#39;ve only been &#39;disappointed&#39; about twice.<br><br>first time, i ordered a philly cheeseteak and it was just boring. blah. but edible.<br><br>second time, i got the bbq ranch chicken salad. decent &amp; somewhat tasty, but not what i was in the mood for (so why did i order it? i&#39;ll never know) but i definitely made up for it when i ordered dessert. of course the cheesecake is always delicious, but the black out cake - OH. MY. CAKE. we ordered our desserts to go and when i got home, my slice was HUUUUUUUGE. i got sick forcing myself to finish it off! seriously - a lotttta chocolatey cake. mmm mmm mmmmm.<br><br>i&#39;ve also had their club sandwich - yummy, typical club sandwich. nothing spectacular. their garlic noodles are pretty good as well, and the appetizers never disappoint no matter what we get. my mom raves about the cajun jumbalaya.<br><br>the service has never been BAD - they get pretty busy though. <br><br>so if you don&#39;t mind spending money, go here for some pretty good food and delicious desserts.

Hands down, the BEST restaurant for those times when you&#39;re like, wtf do we want to eat for dinner!! Excellent ambiance, great service, casual yet sophisticated.. Excellent menu or all sorts of different anythings you can think of. The favorites of mine are: most of the salads, especially the tostada one, I get portobellos grilled instead of the chicken as I am vegetarian.. So big and so damn good, I never finish it, especially with that awesome bread n butter they load you with, the avocado egg rolls, SO good, oh my god!!!! And the tamarind sauce to dip in is superb.. Brilliant.. The Thai lettuce wraps are so awesome.. Fun to eat as you assemble them by hand and do not need silverware, comes with carrots, noodles, cabbage, I get portobello, but it normally has chicken, cucumbers, sprouts, etc and those awesome peanut and tamarind jalapeño sauces.. The fry bread sandwich is EXCELLENT! The burgers are excellent, the fries, just everything is excellent, honestly. I love the painted ceilings and walls. The cheesecake is of course amazing, I love the crazy ones like the cookie dough one or the pineapple upside down cheesecake. Only drawback is there are no reservations accepted.. And the line is always super long so, we go during off hours like 2 pm, or 3pm. A true mainstay for me. And it&#39;s all over the world, so I&#39;ll never have to go without, lol.

Good for cheesecake, obviously.<br>Having never been to the Denver CF, my boyfriend and I stopped in one night while strolling down 16th Street Mall for dinner. <br>Initially we sat outside on the patio, but opted to move in as soon as the equine crap stench wafted over us, as the horse-drawn carriage strolled by.<br>The waitress was busy, but accomodated our request to move, even as our appetizers were coming to the table by another server. <br>We split a cajun shrimp jumbalya entree, and it was tasty with big, fat shrimp and spicy sausage. <br>The ahi tuna tartare tapas plate was decidedly good, too.<br>The asian pork taco tapas things on sticky, thick buns - not so good. We sent it back because the pork tasted dry and cold, and the buns were thick and sticky, not light and fluffy like they should be.<br>That aside, our server (both of them, since we moved inside to another section) were friendly and mostly attentive.<br>We had a great cheesecake dessert, although I don&#39;t remember which it was. Tiramisu or carmel something - anyways, it was great.<br>All in all, an OK dining experience.

Aside from the cake itself this place is a bust. The food at this place is weak and you really leave wanting something good. The building itself on the inside is very nice but that is part of the problem as when you see it you expect the food to be really tasty. The service is good and thats a plus but falls short all together. The big downside to this place is the amount of want to be yuppies go there. This place is filled with people that think they have a lot of money.

Went there for a lunch. One host sitting people. Other host, a girl was on the phone for long time, not ackowledge us.  Host is not paying attention. was got the phone chating with friend and ignore us for few minutes. Good thing, other host was helping. Request for a booth table and we willing to wait for 10 minutes. Of couse, the time e need to be seat, the ignorance girl host is the one who seat us. Food was great, service was good. Overall, is good.

i really liked the food, service, and ambient. The prices are fair, and the dishes were served just like they look in the picture. well organized and real sized servings. i will definitely come here again.
Excellent food.  Most variety on a menu I&#39;ve ever seen.  Every time I&#39;ve been I get something new and it&#39;s always delicious!  And the cheesecake is scrumptious!!!
I enjoyed the special chicken dish. I don&#39;t remember what it was called. My boy-friend&#39;s bang-bang thai shrimp dish or something which wasn&#39;t all that great. I love the cheese cake!

A group of friends and I decided to take in the Cheesecake Factory for a late lunch, mostly consisting of appetizers while doing some people watching in the outdoor seating area. The service was good as we were promptly seated and our orders arrived in a short amount of time considering the amount of food we ordered. Each item we had was very good, from the potstickers, to the Tex Mex egg rolls(my favorite), etc. I didn&#39;t have the cheesecake, I&#39;m sorry to report, but maybe the next time.

I wanted to review the specific Cheesecake Factory I went too in Florida, but the meal I had on 16th street matched in quality. I&#39;ve actually ate here many times and have never had a bad meal. Ever. Doesn&#39;t mean they are the greatest, but they know what they are doing. I usually go w lettuce wraps, but have done Thai noodle salad, fettuccine alfredo, and chicken parm. All great. Its a corporate spot, but holds it down regardless. Solid 3.5

I love this place! The food is good and I always have excellent service. The place is pricey, but if you can get in before 5 and get the lunch special you still get a ton of food for half the price. Their Sun Dried Tomato Chicken Fettuchini is to DIE for! I just love it! :)

Went there after the Parade of Lights. The place was absolutely swamped.  Normally I would not wait for a table but was there for a party.  Amazingly we did get a table within the time they said.  The service was great and the food great.  Amazing how they can operate with a place so absolutely crowded its hard to even walk there.  Great job!

I usually don&#39;t write reviews, but after my experience at the restaurant &amp; then when I tried to heat up my leftovers, I felt the need to voice my opinion. I&#39;m super easy going and don&#39;t expect a lot, but I seriously had the worst service I have ever had in my entire dining out life. I was there on Sunday evening, it wasn&#39;t too busy because it was about 10, The two of us, showed up and requested the patio, there was wait which was totally cool, the hostess was super friendly and we headed to the bar to grab a drink while we waited. The bartender was on it. Very nice and made us feel comfortable. Then we were called to our table within 5 min of getting a drink. We went to the table it took about 5 min for the server Neil to come over, he didn&#39;t introduce himself, if appeared annoyed that we already had drinks, He said &#34; are you going to eat? what do you want?&#34; We didn&#39;t even have a chance to look over the menu. So we asked him to give us some time and then the service just got worse from there, I saw the other waiter go to his tables way more than I even saw our waiter, After about 15/20 min wait, we ordered our food, then didn&#39;t see the waiter again until we were about 1/2 way thru our meal. I ran out of wine and wanted another glass, I had to as the other waiter to find our waiter so I could order another glass, then he seemed to be annoyed, then when he came back out to the patio, he didn&#39;t even bring the glass of wine, then about 10 min later I got my glass of wine. My friend had finished his food and I needed a box so I asked to have him box up my leftovers. The night was ending, he didn&#39;t even ask if we wanted dessert. I wanted cheesecake to take home, so since he wasn&#39;t going to ask - I asked for a slice of cake and the check. I don&#39;t know what his issue was but he was extremely unprofessional, his appearance was not up to par (his pants were halfway down his butt), and he just didn&#39;t seem to want to be there. Oh and to top it all off, I went to heat up my leftovers today and he threw in the ramekins for the sauces (from the restaurant) no lids, they spilled all over and were dried out. So ridiculous! I know you have to go containers. I love the food, the hostess &amp; bartender were perfect. I wish I had just stayed at in the bar area. I know I would have had a much better experience.
Had their Greek Salad and their fried Mac &amp; Cheese appetizer the other night. Greek was good, but the M&amp;C was UH-MAZING!

Came in for dessert only. We tend to really dislike the food here so we came in for dessert. 30 min after asking for it to go and ordering something they claimed they were out of we got our cheesecake. Subpar service, cheesecake is ok, but the food sucks. Stay away!!! Eat anywhere but here.
They drag their feet about posting nutritional information, and there&#39;s a good reason, everything is insanely unhealthy. I can&#39;t get behind that.
Love the artichoke hearts and fresh guacamole. The entrees are enormous and give you a lot of food for the money! I just wish the wait wasn&#39;t always an hour on the weekend!!

First off let me say I do love The Cheesecake Factory.  I am just not fond of this particular one.  My fiance and I went here not too long ago.  It gets very crowded as you wait for a table and the waiting area is very small, so you are kinda forced to go outside and wait for your turn.  Once we ordered, it seemed like it took more than the usual amount of time for the food to come out (BTW we ordered 1 appetizer and 2 entree&#39;s, if that helps. This is what we order usually at ANY restaurant).  Now, granted the place was busy, but I have been to other cheesecake factories where they were just as busy if not busier and our food still came out in a decent amount of time.  Also, the food here just tasted, well, bland.  Not the taste I had expected at other Cheesecake Factories.   I was looking forward to cheesecake when I first arrived but decided against it because of the amount of time it took for us to receive our food and the entree&#39;st just disappointed us. But it&#39;s whatever.  The service was ok, nothing extraordinary.  All in all, I will not let this experience ruin my fondness for The Cheesecake Factory.  I just won&#39;t come back to this location and hope that the one in Park Meadow&#39;s offers something a little bit better.

I love going here with my friends. Just to relax and have a good lunch/dinner follow by a yummy piece of strawberry cheese cake. I love their chop salad here. It is huge so you need atleast 4 people to share it with. My favorite here is their steak with shitaki mushrooms. Overall, their food is good, portion is humongous and priced right. <br>Their cheesecake is to die for. I love their orginal cheesecake with fresh strawberries. They have many other cheesecake flavors to choose from.

I must spread the word about the wretched Cheesecake Factory. I gave one star, but honestly it should be a negative one star. I had such a bad experience, it was surreal. I went to a semi-late Saturday dinner around 9 with a girlfriend, they told us the wait would be 20 minutes but it was closer to half an hour. I could be forgiving about that, right? Then we were led to the back of the restaurant in this strange gold enclosure in the middle of the dining room. Whether this was intentional or not is anyones guess, but my girlfriend and I immediately noticed that the only other table within the enclosure was a group of African American people. My girlfriend and I are Hispanic. We looked around, as far as the eyes could see were the Aryan customers of The Cheesecake Factory. Coincidence, or did the white hostess subconsciously lead the obvious minorities to an enclosed area? Also, I could forgive that, possible coincidence. Next, we waited nearly 20 minutes for water, our server was an arrogant turd that suggest the fire-roasted artichoke to my friend, (what arrived was the hard outer husk of a burnt artichoke), then after we complained gently about the artichoke he told us quote, &#34;Oh, that&#39;s because they aren&#39;t in season.&#34; WTF, then why suggest it in the first place? The entree arrived, and their fettuccine alfredo is ridiculously bland. Our waiter had apparently disappeared so we tagged another server and requested the manager. The manager arrived, kept interrupting our POLITE complaints and actually abruptly left before I had finished thanking him for comping the food! My friend and I left at nearly 10 at night, still hungry, and in a huff about the horrific, possibly racist, incredibly bad service and food at the Cheesecake Factory.

In a town FULL of exceptional local eateries, it is simply a waste of time, money and tastebuds to eat here. I&#39;m not a fan of chains for the exact reasons this place exemplifies! Overly large portions of butter and salt, a lack of creativity and maudlin servers who are only thinking of when their shift ends. Unfortunately, my daughter chose The CCF for her birthday lunch spot since her favorite restaurant was closed. Although she relished the monstrosity of a cheesecake slice she was given, I was unimpressed by the slow service and bored expression in our servers face, even when I asked if we could do something special for her birthday. My shrimp pasta dish was nearly coagulating in butter sauce and the shrimp were tough. The overly-descriptive and novel-esqe menu may promise great expectations...but it&#39;s all window dressing. The reality is that the food is mediocre and all this place seems to have going for it is it&#39;s prime people-watching location on 16th Street Mall!

I really want to give them 4 stars, but the quality has gone down.  Even though I eat at the CF often, it is just not the same anymore.  I have ordered items that have been just down right salty and inedible.  The cheesecakes have been the only items where the quality has not changed.

I have to start off by saying that I am always optimistic and ambitious when dining out. As one who is in the service industry in the downtown area, I know what to expect for the type of crowds at various places, and am always excited to support local business. Going to a corporate chain however, always leaves me with an experience I could have done without. This last visit was the perfect example of why I dislike anything corporate. It leaves very little to the imagination, and MUCH to be desired. I have always loved dessert here, and was excited to have my favorite chocolate tuxedo cheesecake.<br>We started off here for a friends birthday dinner. She had called earlier in the day to reserve a table for 12, which they didn&#39;t do because &#34;we wouldn&#39;t need a reservation. Just come on in!&#34; This was just the beginning. We bellied up to a busy Thursday, and a 50 minute wait for a table. As we gathered round the bar, service was decent. I was unimpressed by the liquor selections and all I found was a list of over sugared concoctions, and even less to be admired with in the liquor department. A beer was sufficient. Our bartenders however, were pleasant and kept our group occupied and happy. <br>When we DID get our table, our waitress was pleasant, but did take 20 minutes to get just water on the table (1st priority in my book), and when I ordered a vodka press, had no clue what it was. Really???? Ok, so lack of knowledge doesn&#39;t make her a bad person, but in this industry, it&#39;s ALL about your service knowledge! So another 10 or so minutes goes by before cocktails hit the table, and sadly enough some drinks were even forgotten. When we tell her that we want separate checks to avoid a hassle later, she says she will split them later (Oh, boy). So we finally ordered, (after reading our novel of a menu), and all seems to be picking up. What saddened me is the amount of staff running amok, looking miserable, and clearly not doing much for one another. Even the obvious floor manager passed our table with empty waters, bread baskets and cocktail glasses without as much as a 2nd thought or offering to help his staff in clearing as something as simple as an empty glass or 2. When our food did finally arrive, it literally came out 2 plates at a time, since our waitress clearly had not much support staff to back her up, save for the one gentleman who helped her with 2 plates. I wish I had our server&#39;s name, because she was nice, but really...after waiting almost an hour for our table, and waiting for things to pick up to a relatively decent pace, things just never got past so-so. When I went to make change at the bar to pay my bill, another server was more perceptive in the 1 minute at the bar, than any other service we had all night. If I had thought that the manger seemed concerned, I may have asked to speak with him. Oh and adding 18 % gratuity to a table that you give virtually no service to, hardly constitutes as acceptable. Had you given proper service and attention to begin with, you would have received a hell of a lot more from a group who eats, sleeps and breathes in Denver&#39;s nightlife. Thanks for bagging our food to go, but with portions like that, it&#39;s probably pretty routine.<br><br>Long story short, spending 3 hours here just to get over-sized portions of mediocre food, left none of us wanting dessert, which was the main reason we came in the 1st place. I&#39;m pretty sure that unless I get cheesecake to go, or have to attend another event here, I won&#39;t be spending any more time here.

I went with three friends on Saturday, March 15 for lunch. The place was packed and there were a lot of people out celebrating St. Patrick&#39;s Day that weekend. We arrived a little after noon and were told it would be a 20 minute wait. The restaurant does this thing where they ring the little buzzer, but you&#39;re left waiting another 10 minutes to be seated. I don&#39;t know if it&#39;s due to lack of menus, or if it&#39;s a sneaky ploy to make you wait longer. We were seated and the two tables next to us (both seated after us) got served and got their food sooner than us. We waited forever, and finally our food came. Much to our disappointment, two of the dishes (neither of them mine) had HAIR in them. Disgusting. We told the server, who was just a terrible server and never checked on us - we had to flag her down - who proceeded to get her manager. The manager was a dingbat who said, &#34;I heard there was hair in your dish!&#34; to one of my friends. Sure as sh*t, my friend pulled out this long ass hair from her food. Disgusting.
